Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: Abigail S
Reviews.Content: For the price, the package is unbeatable. Rarely in the cities will you get reliable complimentary wifi, if at all. There is free breakfast everyday, as well as dinner on weekdays, which could potentially save you a lot of money. The suite, more like an apartment, is spacious and comfortably decorated and has two flat screen HD televisions, and the bed is heavenly. Not to mention this hotel is fitted with a 24/7 convenience store and a fully equipped kitchen, with free coffee and tea at the lobby, as will as fitness room and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: przybylski1
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom suite, that has plenty of room. Breakfast was crowded but tastey. Used the workout room, not a lot of choices for machines but everything worked and was clean. Parking $42.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tam8495
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the friendliness of the staff. The bellmen opened doors, delivered luggage, had fast delivery of our vehicle. The front desk staff were great too. Very helpful and welcoming. The room was fantastic. Plenty big for a family of 4, and beds and pillows were very comfortable. Had all the kitchen appliances you would need plus dishes. They offer a fantastic breakfast too. Michigan ave was very close. Walking distance from everything downtown. Very good location. Price was affordable which is a huge perk for staying downtown. Hotel was also very clean! The view of the city from our room was beautiful at night. This was our first stay here and will stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for family travel”
Reviews.Author: janelled
Reviews.Content: We just completed our second spring break at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago. The hotel is still great. Location is close to Michigan Ave. and the red line. Breakfast is great as always. The dinner menu wasn't to our kids' liking, so we ended up heading out most nights. We still had a great trip and will stay again if we go back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Longaniza43
Reviews.Content: This property was a wonderful surprise. From the lobby bellmen opening the doors for you, to the welcoming and extremely helpful frontdesk staff, to the very responsive room and facilities staff, the service matches luxury properties. The room had a fully appliaanced kitchen with large refrigerator, toaster, microwave and stove with plenty of cabinet space. The living room had a flatscreen TV and large sofa. The bedroom had a flatscreen TV and an attached large bathroom. Breakfast and dinner are complimentary and delicious: what a spread of food (beer and wine included!). There is free coffee available at all hours, with a little snack shop open 24 hours. The gym is also nice as is the indoor pool. Roger Young (General manager) and Scott Kong (Guest Service Supervisor) will make your visit a spectacular one: five star service at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price, and Service”
Reviews.Author: Harout S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Chicago for the first time this last week. We had a great experience staying at the Homewood Suites. The hotel is in a great location close to shops and restaurants. We had a free breakfast every morning and a room with tons of space. This was more of a working trip for both me and my wife and we were in the business center quite a bit. We took full advantage of the complimentary printing, internet, and coffee. The staff was extremely friendly, courteous, and accommodating. I am definitely going to stay at this hotel the next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Family loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie P
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel...Homewood Suites in Chicago is really a grand place to stay on Grand Avenue!! The hotel staff is helpful and friendly, especially the bell hops on the 1st floor!! Jonah was so friendly and enjoyed talking with him. Starr the front desk attendant was very helpful since we had never been to Chicago and told us which buses to ride to the attraction! We really enjoyed the full breakfast and Manager's dinner they include with the nightly rate! Can't say enough about the cleanliness and comfort of the suites...loved the kitchen and the comfy beds and pillows!! The view was great and enjoyed being so close to shopping and a bus ride away from the museums and attractions!! We will be back to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Homewood for 5 nights this past week. We were able to check in a bit early since we arrived in Chicago before the 4pm check-in time. The staff was very friendly and gave us a map with points of interest and the hotel circled on it. The doormen always open the door for you and ask if you need a cab. Breakfast is free and always has a good variety. Usually it some variation of eggs and sausage as the main entrees, but there are waffle makers, cereal, oatmeal, pastries, fruit, yogurt, and many other things to round out the selection. Dinner was pretty good too and it's free Monday-Thursday complete with beer/wine. The hotel is close to pretty much everything including the red line subway which is about 300 ft away from the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Indira H
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Chicago. We stayed here for a week and loved everything about it. The rooms are huge, having the kitchen area was wonderful for such a long trip. I love the meal calendar in the room :) All the meals we had at the hotel were GREAT...some even better then when we ate out! The staff at this hotel has a lot of pride in their work and should definitely be rewarded for it. They answered all our questions and were always available to help us out. We did use the laundry facility, it was small two washers and two dryers. Unfortunately one washer was not working but it was ok because we were the only one's using them at the time. It's a great location to be at, within walking distance to all the local attractions. We will definitely be going back and staying at this same hotel. I noticed some people complained about the elevators taking too long we never had that problem :) The one bad thing was that our room was directly under the gym...so in the evening all we heard were the weights being dropped on the floor. Not sure why some people need to do that when they are working out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Colleen W
Reviews.Content: My sister, friend and I stayed at the Homewood Suites on Valentine's Day through Friday, the 17th. Everything about our stay exceeded our expectations! Star, who worked in reservations, greeted us with warmth and kindness every day and went above and beyond with any need that we had. Whether it was suggesting a restaurant, helping us with the transportation system routes, giving us a room with a great view... she made us feel at home. Jason, who I believe works in guest services, is a wonderful addition to your staff! He went out of his way for us, making sure our dining experience in the evening went smoothly. I believe they were short-handed, and he was helping out in the dining room.I would like to add that dinner is free, Monday through Thursday, with free beer and wine as well. He also took us to a room on the top floor that we wanted to take a look at for our next stay there in June. His attentiveness to any of our needs was well appreciated. Another name I would like to mention is Roger, who I believe to be the manager of the hotel. He was friendlier than any manager I have met in quite some time and my husband and I travel quite a bit. He helped us print our boarding passes on our check out day, and then directed us to where we could leave our luggage with the bellhops, since our flight was not until 7:30 p.m., and gave us a late check out. That way, we could enjoy our day downtown without having to have our luggage with us. Once again, thanks to all the staff at Homewood Suites! We will tell everyone we know who is headed your way, to stay at your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Professional”
Reviews.Author: Nancy L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at almost every Hilton property in Chicago, The staff at Homewood are the best. The hotel is clean and takes care of all guests as family. Staff are professional and positive. You can't put a price on service.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality for price”
Reviews.Author: The_traveling_cookie
Reviews.Content: The hotel has free internet, free breakfast, free welcome home dinner Monday-Thursday. It is very clean, comfortable and in a great location. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “DePaul vs U of L Bus Trip”
Reviews.Author: SHIRLEY F
Reviews.Content: Overall, I enjoyed my two night stay at the Homewood Suites by Hilton in Downtown Chicago, but have a few concerns. I was in town with a bus load of University of Louisville fans to support our basketball team during the game with DePaul University. There were not enough suites available with two double beds at the hotel to accommodate our group. So, I had to share a king-sized bed with my roommate. We were really disappointed that we couldn't have our own bed. So, we each rotated sleepng in the bed one night and then sleeping on the sofa bed in the living room. However, the sofa bed was absoultely horrible!!! The mattress was very thin and the inner springs poked through the surface of the mattress. This made sleeping very uncomfortable. Also, the top portion of the mattress where your head goes was higher than the rest of the mattress. I felt like I was sleeping on a slant. The mattress was so uncomfortable until I closed the sofa bed and replaced the cushions. Then I tried putting the cover on top and sleepng on top of the sofa, However, I am 5'11" tall and the sofa was more like a loveseat size. So, I could not stretch out completely. I got very little sleep and awoke stiff and sore. My back and neck hurt. It was also awkward having to go through the bedroom to use the toilet and shower in the bathroom or to get clothes from the closet without disturbing my roommate while she slept in the bed. The layout of the suite was not well-thoughout as far as utilization of the bathroom and closet. On the plus side of the suite, the kitchen was wonderful! We liked having a fully equipped kitchen with appliances and dishes. We also enjoyed the breakfast! Shirley Fuqua-Jackson, Room 1203

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago location at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: es252
Reviews.Content: 2 colleagues and I recently stayed at this Homewood Suites for a conference we attended in Chicago. The hotel was a bit dated but it was clean and the service was excellent. The continental breakfast and evening buffets left a bit to be desired but... it's free food and I am a bit of a food snob. That being said, if you are looking for a good location at a good price, I would recommend this property. It's within walking distance to several excellent restaurants as well.

Reviews.Title: “Our Group Stay at the Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Flem1
Reviews.Content: This past weekend I booked 22 rooms at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago. We visited Chicago for the University of Louisville vs DePaul Basketball game. My group was very happy and satisfied with the accomodations. They have all encouraged me to continue to stay here on future trips. The staff, rooms, breakfast, location could not have been better. Our sales manager Melah Miller was there to meet the motor coach when it arrived and did whatever was necessary to ensure that all went well for my group. THANKS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base In Windy City!”
Reviews.Author: Chit0wnTransplant
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here recently for 9 days -- attending a conference in Chicago and wanted the freedom of a kitchen, easy access to public transportation and a safe home base. The Homewood Suites is a great value (booked online with extra discount for paying full balance in advance of arrival) and worked out well for the trip. Great location, convenient to Red Line, taxis, Jewel/Trader Joe's for groceries (full kitchen allows one to avoid eating EVERY meal out!) and great sites/shopping within easy walk. Wanted to try out fitness center but ended up walking all over the City! Business center printer had issues but front office staff helped to make sure I was able to print out materials I needed for a seminar. Wi-fi worked reliably -- basic cable options available with two televisions in the room (one more than I have at home!). Great choice! Would stay again when the need arises.

Reviews.Title: “Look somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: Colin D
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a decent place to stay but I probably should have looked a little harder...Breakfast is average, I would suggest going out to eat...Happy hour is a nice treat for the beer....The location is pretty good, everything is walking distance for a tourist and there are a few decent bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: martinjld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times before and I keep staying here every time I am back in the area. The staff here is always great. The door man are always there to greet you, open the doors and flag you a cab. The font desk is very helpful and accommodating. The breakfasts and dinners are still free and pretty good with a good variety of items. The servers are always pleasant and helpful. The location is perfect. Short walk to pretty much anywhere in the area. Lots of food nearby and pretty easy to catch a cab outside the hotel as well. Most of the rooms are very spacious and laid out well, but there are some rooms that are very cramped. The rooms are decent...nothing real fancy or elaborate. Most rooms show signs of wear and tear but are still in good condition. Hopefully there will be some upgrades or minor maintenance done to the rooms. The beds are comfy, air conditioner and heater work great, the TV's are nice HD LCD flat panels with HDMI ports to connect your laptop, windows open up for fresh air, showers always work great, and the kitchen is always nice and convenient. The internet is OK. Sometimes it is really fast and other times is best not to even bother. Sometimes this is based on the time of day and amount of traffic. The only complaint would be the laundry room which is located on the 7th floor also the smoking floor. It smells horrible on the floor and it is a shame you have to walk through the smoking floor to get to the laundry room. There are two washers and two dryers. The washers seem to leave the clothes pretty wet when done with their cycles. The dryers are OK but it usually takes two cycles to completely dry the clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Review of server in breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: I would like to comment Connie Wilson for her hard work and positive attitude during breakfast at the Chicago Downtown Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks for Location, Amenities, Room Quality, and Value”
Reviews.Author: TheSoWhatJourner
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip during which I had to share the room with an associate. Our suite was tow completely separate rooms (a door between the living area and the bedroom). The bedroom area alone (two doubles) was as big as most hotel rooms. The kitchenette was really a kitchen--as big as any kitchen in an apartment or small home. But we only used the kitchen for storing beer and snacks; hot breakfast was included and featured a lot of good choices. We also had a deal where parking included in our very affordable (for downtown Chicago) rate. When my colleague kept waking me up with his snoring on the first night, I simple left the room, shut the door, turned the fold-out couch into a bed, and slept like a baby. The Homewood Suites is two blocks north of the Chicago River, and two blocks west of Michigan Avenue--right in the thick of things and steps away from much more expensive hotels (like the Marriott and the Conrad).

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: Stephen N
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is nothing to write home about. While dinner is a nice perk, it's fairly bland. Maid service is sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “Our family's favorite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vablue122272
Reviews.Content: Great value! Awesome service & always perfect location (from our own experiences).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Todd C
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on the site, I stayed for three night at this hotel in late January for my first visit to Chicago. We pulled up to the front of the building where we were greeted by hotel staff who helped us unload and valet parked our car in a nearby garage. Being a hotel in the midst of downtown, the ground floor is not much more than elevators that take you up to the main lobby on the 6th Floor. The room we stayed in was on the 12th floor and had a nice view of downtown. The room itself was a nice suite. Although not brand new, the room was clean and the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable to sleep on. It may have been the best sleep I've ever got at a hotel. The kitchen area of the room was one of the highlights with enough kitchenware for the average traveler to prepare their own meals if they desired. The cleaning staff did an excellent job straightening up after us each day. The hotel offered free breakfast and the offering was great. The breakfast eggs were fantastic. If you're adding in meal costs, this was a huge plus with getting delicious, hot breakfasts cooked for us each day. They do offer a diner M-F each night but with being in a great restaurant city like Chicago, we splurged for eating out (By the way, I highly recommend the Big Bowl Thai restaurant nearby. Everything is fresh and was the best restaurant we ate at. Ginos East and Al's Beef were ok. Heaven on Seven was good too.) The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. We made a few special requests which they were prompt in service. Location in downtown Chicago couldn't be better. You're two short blocks from Michigan Ave (Magnificant Mile) with tons of restaurants nearby within walking distance. Leave your car in the lot and take the bus where you want to go. Bus routes can take you easily to the museums, united center, willis (Sears) tower, the loop, just about any place downtown. It's the cheapest way to travel downtown and other passengers are average people. Without question I would stay at this hotel again. In fact, this is the only hotel I'll consider until someone can show me a better place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Pisquena
Reviews.Content: Well located, awesome breakfast, in general I preffer this hotel out of any hotel. We love Mrs. Connie. She works in the breakfast area and she is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “musty, smokey and tired”
Reviews.Author: katb530
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location, but you can do much better for the money. The hallways smelled of smoke, dirty elevators, furniture in the lobby was thread bare. The staff was very helpful. The room was large, bed comfortable but the room was so musty and old smoke lingered. If you have any allergies don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Homewood suites-great downtown area!!”
Reviews.Author: Mixfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and the location was great to area attractions ! Alot of great places to dine or drink within walking distance! The Valet service guys were great to give us the scoop on nearby places to go! Starr at the front desk was very nice too! Morning breakfast was good enough, with a friendly staff. There was also a dinner served but we didn't stay for that meal. Only complaint was that when booking and wanting the $10 parking deal you must book more than than 3 days prior to check-in date!

Reviews.Title: “Was worth a try, but will rather spend more in the future...”
Reviews.Author: DJ130
Reviews.Content: Booked myself in here as I always try to stay with the Hilton Group and this seemed good value and there was all the rave about the food. Now let me get a few things right. The rooms are good value for money, enough space and all that but they are a little dated. Staff was very friendly. I can't say I was too impressed with the food, but then I am spoilt when it comes to food and I LOVE my food. I am a foodie. Enough said. I missed a little of the serenity here as well, possibly this place is better for families travelling for leisure then it is for the business traveller? Next time I would rather try out the Conrad, which is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, near the Mile.”
Reviews.Author: 5w30
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple nights in mid-January, as I needed to warm up after a few days in Green Bay. Fast, efficient service by the door staff, as my car was taken by the valet to a nearby garage. Scored a room on the top floor, a corner room with a great view of the Wrigley Building, and right down the hall from the pool and fitness center. The location couldn't be better, as it is in the middle of just about everything in downtown Chicago, all within walking distance. A great place for a Chicago home base, hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “The small things make a difference”
Reviews.Author: bballmama2
Reviews.Content: My family which incudes 6 yr old twin girls decided a weekend getaway Jan 14-16th. We often stay at various Homewood Suites throughout the U.S. due to their consistency and I would have to say this location was my least favorite. On the plus side, the location is great, the rooms are spacious and clean, the beds are comfortable, most of the staff is friendly and helpful, check in was done promptly. On the downside the hotel smells old and smoky, breakfast is suitable for non-fussy children only. Additionally, I booked the $10.00 Parking Suite deal which was my deciding factor on this hotel and noticed my final bill had the full charge. At the end of an extremely discouraging conversation, the charges were removed from the bill. The one thing that struck me odd about the conversation is that the front desk staff stated she had this same conversation with many people before me about the applicability of this deal. So my outstanding question is that if you know it is not clearly marked as applicable in certain situations why don't you fix it and then you wont have any conversations in the future because it's clear. So my tip for those of you booking this deal are as follows: When you see the rate options available to you if the Parking Suite deal does not come up it will not apply to you. This applies even if the Corporate code populates in your confirmation. If this is an important factor for you call and confirm before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: NearPerfect9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites last week for five nights. For the price, this hotel far exceeded our expectations. No, it's not the Ritz-Carlton, and there's sometimes a bit of a wait for the elevator, but $130 a night for a suite downtown including parking, two meals/day, and taxes? We got a great deal! First I'd like to say that all of the employees we came across were pleasant and friendly. Opening doors, greeting you when they see you, etc. I guess that's just common courtesy, but it's rare these days, I feel like half the places I go to eat, shop, etc, the employees act disinterested and sometimes annoyed. (How dare I come into your establishment and spend money!?!) That was not the case at Homewood Suites. It is obvious that the staff there has been trained to make you feel comfortable and "at home". In 6 days we didn't run into one curt, aloof, or even less-than-pleasant employee. That's saying a lot!! The room itself isn't that large for a suite, but it's definitely larger than a standard hotel room. This isn't one of those "suites" that has a sitting/sleeping area all in one like a studio apartment. The bedroom and living room/kitchen are two separate rooms. You can shut the door in the bedroom and not hear much from the living room. This was great for us because we traveled with my 2 y/o son who still naps. The pull-out sofa, like most, is not very comfortable. We didn't really use it (just tried it once for a nap), but I would not want to be sleeping there for five nights. Again, this is not uncommon for a sleeper sofa. I don't think a comfortable one exists. The bed, on the other hand, was very comfortable. Having the small kitchen area was great. As far as amenities, the pool and fitness center are both located on the 19th floor. The pool is very nice and doesn't have a deep end. No hot tub. The fitness center has two treadmills, two recumbent bikes, an elliptical, and a few weight machines and a bench. My husband was up there every morning and never had a problem getting a treadmill, but I did think the fitness center was a little small for the size of the hotel. I wonder if when it's busy, the gym gets really crowded? The hotel was def. not at capacity when we were there. The breakfast is far better than most continental breakfasts. They serve real eggs, unlike the Hampton Inn :) The quality of dinner varied by night, but it was definitely much better than I expected. We went down all but one night for dinner - the beef brisket was excellent, the ravioli/pasta night was pretty bad, most everything else was in between. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel, as has been mentioned in previous reviews, is the wait time for the elevators. When we visited (Jan 8-13) the hotel was fairly empty, or so it seemed. Still, I had to wait a minute or two for an elevator about every other time I used it. Not a big deal, but it did make me wonder how long the average wait is during the summer when they are busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Homewood Suites - Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: seekingsun4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites - Chicago from January 13-15, 2012. We were given a room on the 16th floor with great views of the city. The staff at the front desk was excellent. Very helpful and friendly. The condition of our room was ok. It was showing some wear and tear but it was adequate for our needs. The pool area was kept very clean. The daily breakfast was plentiful and the staff that manned that area did an awesome job making sure the food was replenished and that the area was kept clean and tidy. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family. Its location to the Magnificent Mile is a huge plus as well!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Service, Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: jeffandvince
Reviews.Content: This fall we stayed at the Homewood Suites for the fourth time, during our annual pre-Christmas family trip to Chicago (we always stay during the first weekend in December). Throughout the years, the Hilton Homewood Suites have always delivered. The facility itself is in good shape (clean and nice, but not "new"), but the employees and the location is really what makes the hotel special. Located on a side street off Michigan Avenue, the "old" Chicago (the Loop area) is a pleasant, five-minute walk away, and the mid-point of Michigan Avenue is located two blocks east. The employees (from the doormen to the front desk to the breakfast room employees) consistently deliver on thoughtful, energetic service - everyone in our party agrees. Give them a try - if you watch the rates ahead of time, you can usually find it for what might be considered a bargain, in downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Denise P
Reviews.Content: After staying at Homewood suites for 4 days - I would never stay any place else. The suites are clean, comfortable. Kitchen has all you need. Bedding comfy. The breakfast and dinner in evening included in price! Connie in dining room is very helpful as well as the weekend staff. Great location, walking to all parks and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Getting old but location and perks too awesome to pass up.”
Reviews.Author: dissolvedgirl
Reviews.Content: Chicago is not a cheap city. So the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago is great if you are looking for value for money. The hotel is very clean and the common areas don't look dated but the room we were given is surprising a bit shabby. It had that old closet smell in the beginning and the bedcover had to be stashed into the closet - it had a big hole at the edge and looked and smelled very old - so it won't remind us that this could be a decrepit hotel. But once we got over that ugly part of our stay, we began to like Homewood Suites. We got a suite that had a sofa with a separate bedroom, two tvs (one in front of the sofa, one in the bedroom), a small dining table, a kitchen with an oven, a fridge. We had free breakfast (the usual fare but good enough) and free weekday dinners (yes, dinner, but nothing great and it would be a shame not to try the many great restaurants in the area). Free coffee in the lobby and free wifi all over the hotel (including the rooms). And let's not forget the location. It is in the heart of downtown Chicago. Near the magnificent mile, a bit of a walk to the art institute but a nice walk. Nordstrom and other shops all around you, and restaurants as well. Do try Joe's Seafood and the Japanese restaurant next door. I would stay here again definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, great view, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MNHighlighter
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel of our road trip. We stayed from Dec 23-25, 2011. Check in went well as we used the valet service and they helped us with our bags. It is a little odd that you enter to an ugly elevator area on the first and the actual lobby is on the 6th floor and then you must then get your bags to another floor where your room is. I must comment that the gentlemen working valet were so friendly always opening the door and saying greetings/goodbyes. Our room was a King Suite with a full kitchen, it was very nice and fully equipped with everything we needed. The fitness room at Homewood was fantastic. My daughter and I used it both mornings we were there and not only was the equipment excellent, the view was beautiful also making it not seem so bad to be hitting the treadmill/elliptical/bike. I do with they had a few more pieces of equipment as many times all was in use. We also used the pool and it too was a comfortable temperature and nice to have available. Breakfast was good and filling. We got it and brought it to our room but you could be seated and eat it in the breakfast area which I saw many families doing. Check out was simple and getting our car out of valet was quick and painless. Again the valet gentlemen were friendly and polite. What a wonderful experience. When we're back, we'll stay again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suite hotel, great bargain”
Reviews.Author: jswedek
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 1 bedroom suite with full kitchen. Price included buffet breakfast and dinner during the week. Also, got a great deal on parking at $10/night rather than $35+. Close to everything and within walking distance to Water Tower, Michigan Avenue, River North galleries, etc. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEl!”
Reviews.Author: Redpare
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Nice pool on top floor of hotel. It has a very good complimentary hot breakfast and very good manager's receptions Monday through Thursday. The hotel is a short walk from Michigan Ave and it is not a terribly long walk from the Willis Tower either. However, we had to change rooms three times because the air from the smoking rooms below us would come up into our room, making our non-smoking room smell like a smoking room. But the hotel was very accomodating and moved us without a hassle all three times.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Rest”
Reviews.Author: MukuSix
Reviews.Content: A lot of what is said in reviews here, about the lifts being busy and all, really depends when you visit. It was quiet for the first 10 days before Christmas. Then Christmas through January 1st was busy. Today it's back to being a slow going, chill place. So, be mindful of when you go and take what is said about things like that.into consideration. Breakfast (and dinner) will also be very busy during these times. With that said, this is a great place to stay. A couple minutes from the Mag Mile, and a bit further and you're at Navy Pier. Some of the other attractions (Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, etc) are technically within walking distance, but it's probably best to buy a 3-day transportation pass to get to those. The breakfast can tend to become old quickly, if you stay for an extended period of time. (We've been here 19 nights as of tonight, leaving in the AM to go back home.) They swap up a few things like the meat on the bar. Can be bacon, sausage patty, or sausage link. Change up the second batch of eggs at times as well, and maybe once in a while one of the three cereals. But having breakfast really saved us a lot of money. The big selling point for us was the free wifi and kitchen. The free wifi requires you sign in once a day, so no biggie there. The kitchen is awesome for being away from home so long. No oven, so can limit you a bit. But the stove top and all is nice, as well as a dishwasher so you don't have to worry about washing dishes while here. Toaster also included as is a coffee maker and some other small amenities. The staff here is amazingly helpful. Able to help us find things in area as well as provide change for the washer/dryer. The staff at the door are always a nice group, welcoming you back and all. There are some minor inconveniences we've encountered while here that I should note. I read in another review that the drain in the tub is slow. This is true. We've also had water issues. Not pressure issues, but our water being cool to luke warm. They had someone come up while we were out during the day to look at it, but it still didn't seem to help much. This issue seemed to crop up right around Christmas, so I'm not sure if it was just being a busy in general issue or what. Considering it's winter, warm to hot water for showers is a bit important. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again and would make this my go to hotel. Price versus what you get AND location? This is a great place to stay. Our room here had John Hancock in the distance, so we had an amazing view as well.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CameraDude29
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago twice and it has become our "go to" hotel of choice now. We have stayed at a variety of hotels near/on Michigan Avenue and this place is the best value overall. Honestly, I don't know why they do not charge more for this hotel (anybody from Hilton reading this...pay no attention to that comment :-) ). The first time we stayed here was Thanksgiving weekend of 2009 and found it very comfortable and priced very reasonably. The second time was this year (2011), again for Thanksgiving weekend. The Homewood Suites has a great breakfast buffet that never seemed to be out of anything even with the large crowd of families staying there for Thanksgiving weekend shopping and family get-togethers. Thanksgiving afternoon and evening was a special treat with a full traditional Thanksgiving buffet meal for guests...free! We had reservations at a nearby restaurant but canceled those and decided to try the buffet instead and we were pleasantly surprised. Granted, the food wasn't anything over the top, but was really quite good and they had wine and beer too. We really enjoyed the food and the opportunity to just chill out and have some family time over dinner. During a normal week (Sun-Thurs I believe) they have a dinner buffet for guests that caters to the business travelers. As for the rooms, we had a suite that consisted of a living room area and kitchenette with a table and chairs that could be used for eating meals which would be great for families with children, but since we were there on "Black Friday" for shopping, the table got used for a spot to put all of the shopping bags. The sofa opened up into a sleeper and the separate bedroom had a king sized bed. The bathroom was adequate and we had good water pressure in the shower even though we were on the 18th floor. The place was very clean and each day the suite was cleaned and made up by early to mid afternoon. No matter what hotel you stay at in downtown Chicago, everybody always complains about how much it costs to park your car. Yes, the going rate is usually $42 to $50+ per night but you kind of just have to accept that fact...unless you can snag the Homewood Suites deal that includes parking for $10! When you check the rates for the various rooms, make sure to look for the $10 parking suite deals. It truly is just $10 for parking over the price of the room. I think we paid $149.00 per night and that included parking, breakfast (full buffet, not just rolls and cereal), and Thanksgiving dinner! If you have ever stayed in downtown Chicago you know that is a great deal. All of the staff were friendly and helpful and always greeted you upon entering or leaving. The food staff were equally helpful and were always checking to make sure we had everything we needed from the buffet. As with any of the hotels during busy times, the wait for the elevator can get a little long, but that really only happened once or twice and the wait was much less that at the really big high-rise hotels on the Mag Mile. The location is great and only blocks away from Michigan Ave and a short walk to State Street and the Loop area. We recommended this place to friends and they were not disappointed. We will be back next time we go downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Be realistic and this place is just fine”
Reviews.Author: Grinanbear
Reviews.Content: These suites are in a tremendous location - you can be right in the Magnificent Mile within 3 minutes of leaving the hotel, walk across the river into the loop within 7 minutes, and walk to the Navy Pier in 15 minutes. They are also tremendous value for money - we had four people in our suite which would have cost significantly more had we checked into a hotel and booked two rooms. All of the staff are extremely helpful - I have stayed in much more expensive places than this and not had staff get me a taxi this quickly or get my bags to the room so fast. On that basis, I would thoroughly recommend this as a good place to stay in Chicago. On the downside, the decor is a little tired, the lifts can be slow at busy times, the breakfast is fairly basic and you need to be pretty assertive if you want to get your bagel into the toaster amongst the jostling crowd that quickly fills up the fairly small food serving area. However, I come back to the fact that at the price, I doubt there is a better place to stay

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Rab M
Reviews.Content: We have just recently travelled round the world on a tour and this is the most impressive hotel we have stayed in yet!!very comfortable quite room with comfy bed,excellent Location, free wi-fi, laundry, free coffee ..breakfast and dinner with wine/lager.. This place rocks... Giving it a 5 star on my books.. And just a five minute walk to the subway for travellers coming from the airport like us.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetBTS
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel in a great location. Our suite provided a good amount of room and was very clean. Check-in was efficient, but very perfunctory - can't say the front desk staff was overly friendly or welcoming, but they were efficient. There were a few minor negatives - some of the doors in our suite had holes in them, the water pressure wasn't particularly good, the drain in the tub was very slow, and the wine and beer during the "happy hour" were atrocious (they could do much better for not much more money - and maybe even less). But, the food during happy hour was plentiful and quite tasty (you could make dinner out of it) and breakfast was excellent with lots of choices and very good service from the staff. Staff during "happy hour" was also very nice - friendly and looking for ways to be helpful. The couch in the lobby could use replacing as it's pretty saggy and threadbare. Overall it was a very good choice. We'd definitely stay here again - good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emeraldcoast
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the location, and we were correct. It is an easy walk to many attractions. The suite life made it easier for the kids after an exhausting day. The rooms are a nice size for a city hotel, and the kitchen was very useful for leftover Chicago pizza! The buffet provided at the hotel wasn't great but it was decent for a busy family that wanted to grab breakfast and go. I would recommend this hotel to families for the location, the ability to spread out and relax, and the kids even enjoyed the indoor pool after a long day of site-seeing! I would also highly recommend the travel passes (GoChicago or CityPass). These passes allow you to skip the lines which can get very long during the summer, especially on the weekends. Both passes were accepted at most of the sites. Well worth the price! The line for the Field Museum was around the block - crazy - and we didn't have any problems (find the side door - not the main entrance.) The Science and Industry Museum should not be missed, and we all (kids included) enjoyed the Architectural River Cruise. It was just the right length of time.

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon1284
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was very excited about this hotel, but upon arriving I was underwhelmed by the offerings. First the positives: The hotel has a great location, easy walk to Michigan Ave. the breakfast was very good and the fitness center was above average for a hotel. The breakfast was organized well and was less chaotic than ones I have experienced in the past at other hotels. Second the negatives: Probably the most annoying thing was the heat in the hotel. At times it felt like a sauna, even in late December. The hotel only has two elevators, which for a good size hotel meant long waits for one. The evening dinner was a bit much and very crowded. Maybe a smaller reception would have made sense, instead of a free for all Old Country Buffett style dinner. Even with the outstanding positives, I'm not sure I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: erickfuks50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, right in front of Nordstrom and the shops at North Bridge. We stayed with 2 kids in a suite consisting of one bedroom, one bath and a separate living room with a sofa-bed. Complimentary breakfasts were good and "welcome home" meals not so much. The only thing I can really complain about is how uncomfortable the sofa-bed was. Too noisy, and there is just a thin layer separating the springs from your body. Our kids ended up with a real back pain from sleeping there. Next time I'd get two separate rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: JKHEBoston
Reviews.Content: they had a washer and a dryer for guest use! Since we were at the beginning of a three week trip this became a high point. The suites were spacious and clean. The kitchen area was relatively well-stocked. Missing a corkscrew, which was provided by the very helpful front desk staff. The downstairs bellmen were very welcoming and helpful. Location was great for shopping and attractions. The closest Metro stop that gets you there from the airport did not have an escalator or elevator to street level, which made carrying bags a little difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Fun weekend in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: 822traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place when visiting Chicago. Easy walk to Michigan Avenue, Rush Street restaurants, and tons of shopping. Went to see a play at the Cadillac Palace theater, and even walked back from there on a Saturday night. We have stayed in both summer and winter, great time each stay. Nice rooms, great breakfast. The only place we stay when visiting downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfection”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. Always a perfect stay and this was no exception. A good rate, a warm greeting and a great complimentary breakfast. A large suite with two flat screen TV's. Clean and quiet and a great nights sleep. What more could anyone ask for. The service here at this hotel is 5 star to say the least. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fdwt994
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my family and I have stayed at this property since 2009. Just like our last visit, the staff is top-notch with a friendly demeanor and eager to please. The valet was always present and opening the door for us night and day. They were also great at assisting us with our luggage and retrieved our vehicle quickly when we needed it. The workers in the dining area (breakfast AND dinner is included) were also very pleasant and quickly cleaned tables. The room was very clean and spacious. Consider that you are 1/2 a block from the magnificent mile in what is essentially a one bedroom apartment. With the subway a block away, your access to the entire city is convenient. All units include a kitchenette with microwave, full-sized refrigerator, cooktop, dishwasher, toaster, etc. Compare the price and you'll see that this place is hard to beat. The only area I can offer improvement in is that the facilities are probably in need of a refurbishment soon. This is nit-picking, however, because everything is very clean and functional. Certainly not something that should keep you from booking here. I know we will again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kiawah_Regular
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights over the recent Thanksgiving Holiday at the Homewood Suites, We weren't looking for luxury, but wanted a clean, safe, place to stay in a convient location. We enjoyed the Magnificant Mile, Thanksgiving day parade, etc and found this to be a great location. We especially wish to send a great big "Thank You" to the Valet Staff especially Henry. They went out of their way to take care of the wife, kids and especially the amily car. I know they don't work directly for Homewood Suites, but they really are the ones that greet you as you come and go. Also wanted to thank Rose at the desk for her assistance as well. Breakfast was great, but one day we decided to get a sit down hot breakfast and found Mary's right down the block to deliver exactely what we were looking for. Would definately stay at Homewood Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find right off the strip”
Reviews.Author: InspireMI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Chicago for a getaway over the summer and it was a great find. The Homewood has a great spread for breakfast and dinner(weekdays only) and the amenities were very comfortable. The room was well equipped with a nice kitchenette and a full size fridge (great for leftovers with all the great food in Chicago). The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was above average. It's not glamorous by any means but for $100 a night for 2 blocks off Michigan Ave with meals you can't go wrong. Definitely recommend this hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Lots of space. Pleasant staff. Good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Lislcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, at the end of October. We usually stay at one of the Embassy Suites downtown, but we got a good deal on this Homewood Suites and we will definitely stay there again. It's just down the street from our favorite restaurant, Joe's Steak and Seafood, which was definitely a plus. Also, just across the street from the Nordstrom's entrance to the Mall on Michigan Ave. We walk everywhere, when we are in Chicago, so this hotel was great. We were there on a weekend, so didn't get to try the Manager's Reception. I'd give it 5 stars, but the bathroom door would hit the toilet, if the seat was down and it could use a little updating. That being said, we're looking forward to our next visit. Also, I went looking for some hair things, so I could put up my daughter's hair and couldn't find any in their shop, so asked at the front desk and they gave me a handful of rubberbands. Just what we needed! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely service oriented”
Reviews.Author: 20Natalie20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our kids over Christmas last year and liked it so much, we intend to do it again this year. The location is absolutely perfect: the magnificent mile, Nordstrom shopping mall, Millenium park, Movie Theatre, Rain Forest Cafe etc etc are all in walking distance. The service in the hotel is awesome. Keeping in mind that it was Christmas, when occupancy was probably lower than usual, we were allowed to check in early and got a corner suite on the 16th floor! Views are almost good everywhere, since the hotel starts at about the 6th floor, My kids loved the pool, which is situated on the top floor and has amazing views in 3 directions. Breakfast is included and is very elaborate. There is a parking garage that comes with the hotel, and yes you have to pay, but the hotel is not at all fussy about how long you end up parking, so it is still a lot cheaper than a regular parking garage which adheres to strict houirs. So all in all, 10 out of 10, with a very good price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: The staff at Homewood Suites in Chicago are awesome. Connie Walter's in the dining room is amazing. Kind, polite, helpful, always has a smile. We have stayed there many times and she always has a smile and something kind to say. The front desk staff is always helpful and the rooms are great and clean. Every member of the staff is helpful with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Soulforged25
Reviews.Content: The idea of having a suite is a pretty cool one, and only if it was for 4 nights, i thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. My room was on the 13th floor. Upon arrival, i was a little early for check in, (it's at 4pm, i forgot and though it was 3) the people on the desk were very helpful, found out if my room was ready, which it was and let me check in early. The room(s) itself was big, living room, couch and a chair, which a flat screen, kitchen, everything you'd need more than what i needed for 5 days. the bathroom was great, (the pipes for the shower were a little noisy, maybe a bit of air in there or just a bit aged) the bedroom, another flat screen in here, and a big bed, queen size (i think...) really comfortable. I had a great view of the trump tower and the wrigley building from my window too which was nice. They also provided both breakfast and dinner, i didn't have dinner there (wish i had of done, looked and smelled good, but i was out a lot) but i did have a breakfast, typical american style breakfast, cereals, bacon, eggs, potatoes etc, and waffle making machine, which is awesome, so great value on the food. Great location too, just a couple of blocks from michigan avenue, the tribune tower and the river, lots to see and do, some great restaurants and bars around too. I would definitely stay here again next time i'm in chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay Marathon weekend..headed back next week”
Reviews.Author: JohnHooker
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family during the Chicago Marathon when every hotel in the city is busting at the seams...despite the crowds the hotel staff did a great job, including a great effort with the huge crowds at breakfast. Great location and great value; I look forward to returning next weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, even unexpected blizzard delays”
Reviews.Author: christinern
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January/February 2011 during the infamous Chicago blizzard. My lengthy stay was very positive, considering the city shut down, and I was a long way from home. Rooms are very nice size well appointed, with great downtown views, which gave it a very big city feel! During the day of the blizzrd, every hotel guest received a note , that due to staff not being able to make it in, housekeeping services would be minimal for the day ( clean towels, but not much else). I found this to be a nice gesture in explaining the situation. The daily breakfast and "dinner" specials were average to below average. Very little in terms of fresh fruit or veggies, alot was prepackaged, or prepared ahead of time. The breakfast area was very crowded at any time of the morning, however, the breakfast hosts were very friendly and helpful. I did have to use the laundry facilities- which were located on a smoking floor---not a very positive experience. The entire laundry room was hot and smelled very heavily of smoke. Yuck! For the most part, it was easy to catch a taxi right out front, and there are lots of great restaurants and shopping nearby the hotel. overall, it was a positive experience, and I do hope to be back to Chicago in another season!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect - as usual :-)”
Reviews.Author: Gert S
Reviews.Content: stayed there with the whole company (small business lol) for our company Christmas party for the 3rd year in a row - just perfect! Extremely friendly people from bottom to top, reasonable prices, large rooms, great breakfast, perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Great rates”
Reviews.Author: jmp01
Reviews.Content: Great rates and rooms. just blocks of Mich ave great breakfast also has small supper Mon- Thursday

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Trip”
Reviews.Author: Kathy T
Reviews.Content: Our family shared a suite at the hotel for Thanksgiving. The staff was truly friendly and kind. The breakfast was delicious, the happy hour was unexpectedly generous, and the rooms were spotless. Great place to stay with a family that is traveling during a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving week in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Tripped0ut70
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a room at Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago after seeing that it was the #11 hotel in the city. My husband and I had a king one bedroom suite. The room was perfect for us, as were the amenities of the hotel... large breakfast, wine and beer in the evening and DINNER! Although we only ate one evening meal the night we went to a play, I could not believe the amount of food this hotel offers to its guests. We had a corner room facing the Wrigley clock and Trump Tower...beautiful view. This hotel is very conveniently located. We took the orange line from Midway to the red line by transfering at Roosevelt. The Grand CTA stop on the red line is about one and one-half blocks from the hotel. Be warned that there is no elevator or escalator in or out of this stop. But construction is going on now which will add an evelvator. We went to see the production "Million Dollar Quartet" at the Apollo Theater and loved it!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Homewood suites”
Reviews.Author: GR_MI_traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of Home wood Suites, and this was probably our best experience. The location is very convenient for shopping, the Red line metro, and restaurants. Even though a lot of people were eating breakfast, they kept the buffet well stocked and tables clean. The pool is on the top floor with nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Rooms huge”
Reviews.Author: GalwayGirl2010_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and really nice hotel. great location within walking distance to Michigan Avenue, the loop so handy. and the free breakfast in the morning was so handy and also the evening meal with free wine, beer... great value and the rooms were huge separate bedroom and living room. The only downfall was there was no bar, just a small reception are where you could purchase beer and wine. But the reception area was lovely too as we arrived at christmas and it was decorated lovely with an open fire. would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic mother daughter weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Love4Life2
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping, dining, and sightseeing. Close to Michigan Avenue and State Street shopping. A lot of great restaurants are walking distance from the hotel. Very friendly staff who greeted us at breakfast, and every time we came in the front door. They were very prompt in bringing our luggage to our room, and picking it up to store it while we shopped after checking out on Sunday. Breakfast is absolutely wonderful. Great food, great selection, and great hours. We had a spacious King suite room with a view of the Trump tower. Plan to stay here again in the future. Entrance and lobby is small and not as fancy as many other hotels but they more than make up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant downtown stay”
Reviews.Author: timesaway
Reviews.Content: With a wedding to attend we decided to stay downtown for the weekend and found the Homewood Suites to make for a perfect weekend stay. The location makes for an easy walk to the Michigan Avenue stores, as well as several restaurants. All of the staff we encountered at the Homewood Suites were very pleasant, acknowledging our presence each time we encountered them. The breakfast which is included with the room price had a good assortment of foods from which to choose. The muffins were especially tasty. It would have been nice to not need a car since the parking fee is pricey, but expected to be so with it being a downtown Chicago location.

Reviews.Title: “How the Hilton stole Christmas...”
Reviews.Author: cyber89
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my family of 4 to stay overnight to see the Magnificent Mile Christmas Lights Parade. I chose it because it had a sofa sleeper and one bed. We arrived at our hotel around 3:30 PM to check in. We came at this time because the front desk worker said that we could not check in until 3:00 PM. After giving him our name, the manager said,"OK, we have your king smoking suite available". We quickly corrected him to let him know that we were traveling with two very young kids and we reserved a non-smoking room. He insisted that his computer said that we reserved a smoking room. We went back and forth, then he asked us if we had a copy of our reservation. Luckily, we were able to pull the reservation up on our phone. It clearly said non-smoking. After showing him our reservation, he explained that there was nothing that he could do to correct the situation because they had no other rooms available. So why in the world did he need to see our reservation!! We decided to see if we could handle the smoking room. It turns out that the entire floor was smoking and for a non smoker there was no way that we could sleep in a smoking room on a smoking floor with our two young children. The manager eventually called around and found a hampton inn near by with one bed. We canceled our room reservation. We live about an hour away from downtown so we made the late night trip back home. My family was very disappointed. My husband is a gold member with Hilton. Let's just say we will be switching back to Marriott. The hotel lobby was dated. The smoking room that I saw looked very dated as well. They made an error and never owned up to it, nor did they do anything to compensate us for such a huge inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: S T
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The room was perfect for our family of 5, the pool was great, we were with in walking distance of many things, and the valet parking was priceless. What put our stay over the top though, was the staff. They were so friendly. Connie greeted us and chatted every morning. The doormen were cheerful and quick to help. We started off rocky the first night because the hotel was over booked. We were taken care of and it turned out fine. The rest of our stay made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween proposal!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonecrusher69
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with a nice brunch! The staff is manificiant!! We had a great time there. My sweetie said yes to my proposal!!! Boy was she surprised!!! THIS was on Halloween morining, right at 12am!!! What a scary Halloween!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: RB1313
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel especially if you have kids. The suite was a good size and the staff were very accomodating. They had a full breakfast buffet every morning and monday-thursday had a complimentary dinner - which they called a light dinner but it was pretty good - with free wine and beer! They also to-go containers so you could take it to your room if you wanted to. It was also pretty central to everything - walking distance to Magnificent Mile - 20 mins to the beach...20 mins to Navy Pier. Nordstrom Mall across the street (great food court), bloomingdales around the corner, Nordstrom off the rack 10 mins away, and about every kind of restaurant and fast food place around it. Our family would definately stay here again. There were no children activities - but when you are in Chicago - you don't really stay in your hotel room except to sleep! But they a decent swimming pool which my kids enjoyed (both under 5)

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suite Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Blakelake
Reviews.Content: The entire experience at Homeward Suites was excellent. The Doorman were absolutely AWESOME, always said hello, helped with doors, attentive and always working. they hailed cabs in no time. Everyone, especially Connie were great in the hosted breakfasts every morning. The only thing we didn't like was the bathroom sink, way to small of an area.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value in River North”
Reviews.Author: MrFrump
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable and spacious rooms, I love having the separate bedroom area (I think all rooms are like that but I'm not sure). Staff was exceptionally friendly and attentive although things were so well run we rarely talked to anyone! It was no big deal to us, but oddly enough there were no pots or pans in our kitchen, everything else seemed to be there. A few times we wished there were more elevators but that would be awfully hard to correct! Overall I'd think it's the best value in River North for price and proximity to attractions and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: DeadOn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-Night stay at the Hilton Homewood Suites. This place is everything you've read on TripAdvisor so don't be concerned because it's worth it! We had a corner room on the 13th floor and it was perfect. No noise! The elevators were never slow as others have wrote and we moved freely in and out of the hotel. Jonah and crew (Bellmen) are great and helped me remove, store and replace my luggage carrier. The front desk was very helpful and check in was simple and quick. The breakfast was fine, but the weekend is very busy and we had to be seated in another (conference) room off the main room which was fine for our family of 5. We would normally be there by 9:00am and the weekend crowd would fill the place, but were still seated for the buffet. The food is average to above average for breakfast fare so don't expect omelets made to order, eggs benedict, etc.. Considering it's a part of the hotel costs it's well worth it...Dinner was not as good in my opnion but I base that on one night so I'm not a good judge. Our room had a fantastic view and was perfect for what we needed. Kids had there own flat screen and pull out sleeper sofa. Mom and Dad had a king with french doors that closed. The bathroom is located in the King bedroom so you do travel through to access. The kids used the pool a few times and it's what you would expect. But like everyone else, the location here is the key...We took cabs and buses everywhere and never once took our car out of valet. Walked every night around this area and dined at (close) local establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown Chicago hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: MNBadger
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at Homewood Downtown Chicago in Sep-11 it was a very nice stay. Homewood suites is what you expect - large, modern, well equipped rooms, bathrooms, with all the modcon's. The hotel staff from front desk to cleaning staff were all very friendly and helpful. Chicago - nice! Location was great - central, 1-2 blocks from public transportation and many bars, restaurants nearby. We could walk to virtually everything and did. Breakfast was a bit chaotic. Lots of food choices. Staff worked hard to not run out of food at times. A host 'seats' you for breakfast which was a bit odd, but worked out OK. Room price/night was competitive by downtown Chicago lodging standards especially when you consider rooms are 1 bedroom + you get breakfast. One issue is the cost of parking ~$39./24hrs kind of the going rate around hotel. I guess some of our party should not have driven into the loop. On our next trip to Chicago we will definitely staff at Homewood suites again

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: tbark
Reviews.Content: This Hilton brand hotel provides cozy, clean and very large rooms in Chicago downtown, for a reasonable price. The staff was very friendly, we arrived late and there was a small mixup in our reservation, but they quickly cleared everything out and expedited the check-in process. The room itself was a King room, it was a large suite consisting of a living room + kitchen area, and a bedroom with shower+bathtub. Beds were comfortable, although the bed sheet was a bit annoying, it was attached to the bed cover and made things a bit clumsy. The room was clean & spotless. I found breakfast to be a bit lacking, but it was only slightly worse than other hotels in this trip. Bottom line - good value for money, hotel is centrally located, prices are reasonable for business travelers, and the rooms are large and comfortable even though its a central location.

Reviews.Title: “JUST AWSOME!”
Reviews.Author: Wayne G
Reviews.Content: WOW! After researching vigorously for the right hotel to stay at for our honeymoon trip to Chicago, We choose Homewood Suites Downtown Chicago. I was was impressed with the ease of the reservation system. They made my reservation stress free and where I usually stress "maybe its just me" on omg did they get my reservation right and what if?, Their continues emails of conformation information was appreciated. The night before our stay I called to ask them if they could put us in a great view room on a high floor, The front desk was soooooo helpful and the girl had a great personality and made me laugh. She said she would take care of it and made me feel comfortable she would. The next day we arrived at the hotel and was greated by great service right when we came in the door. The front door service was awsome!. We went up to the front desk and told them our name and when they pulled up our reservation I was impressed that the girl the night before had taken note and had reserved us a great corner room on the 18th floor. She had even noted that we were honeymooners!. The man at the front desk was so awsome! he talked to us about the different restaurants and helped us decide accourding to our preferences wich would best suite our taste. He was very informative and very knowledgable. When we got up to our room I was sooooo impressed! So clean and so beautiful! By far the best room I could ask for! Our room was even better than the description they provided for it online! The service remained 5 star through every shift change. Never once did I come across an employee who wasnt 5 star quality. Over all the best hotel in Chicago. The location was awsome, so close to everything as we walked to navy pier and Hancock building, hard rock cafe, millinium park, Union station etc. You want to feel pampered on your next trip to Chicago the I recommend you stay at the Homewood Suites downtown Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Nice central location”
Reviews.Author: kc1wong
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights here. It was actually our second choice but became our first choice for these reasons (1) Located close to public transportation - 1 short block to the Redline subway line and 2 blocks from a bunch of bus lines (2) 2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile - not too far from Water Tower Place (3) comfortable neighborhood - lots of restaurants nearby and it felt pretty safe (4) Connie Wilson (? On the last name) in the dining room always greeted us warmly and watched over us wonderfully - she had the most wonderful countenance and was so helpful! (5) the dining room was handy for breakfast. We had dinner there one night - a nice break from eating out especially the night it rained - grabbed salad/side dishes in the dining room and warmed up leftover Giordano's in our room (6) all the staff was quite friendly and helpful. I'd stay there again and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Jnachbur
Reviews.Content: Our suite had plenty of space for the three of us -- two queen beds in the "bedroom" and a full size pull-out couch in the "living" room portion of the suite -- and a kitchen and table for eating/snacking. The location was close to downtown shopping, within relatively easy walking distance of Navy Pier and even though it was far from the Chicago Half Marathon start line, it worked perfectly for everything we did before and after the race. The plus was P.F. Chang's was across the street!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheAgeofAquarius
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Chicago. I travel there about four times a year and typically stay here for the free dinner, free breakfast, large rooms, multiple TVs. The only bad part is that the gym is small.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: bwmmac
Reviews.Content: This place was just fine for our purposes- 4 nights in Chicago. Very central - close to michigan avenue and state street, so good for shopping etc. The apartment although slightly smaller than expected was ideal and functional - what more do you need. It was clean, the staff were competent and extremely courteous and all in all contributed to this being a great base to have for the limited time we had in chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Double Wow!”
Reviews.Author: golfany1
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpfull staff- nicely appointed room- very clean- in the centre of everything for tourists wanting to see it all! View from pool exciting at night. Breakfasts and dinners were filling and delicious with plenty of choices to start your days. Used CTA for the entire trip-even to and from the Midway Airport-very convenient to all venues. BLUES bar on Halstead was a lively spot-excellent entertainment- as was the Redhead Piano Bar. Also try the authentic deep dish pizza at UNO. A truly spectacular city - would go again in a heartbeat!!Don't forget to take a Signature Segway tour! A Mom and Daughter

Reviews.Title: “sister trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bbarbiebean
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with one king bed in the bedroom and one pull out sofa bed in a small sitting area. There were doors that divided the two areas. There was also a small kitchen that we did not use for cooking but it would come in handy if that is what you want to do. It had a nice refrigerator and a sink, microwave and small cook top. This room was big enough for 3 adult women.The hotel was quiet and we never heard our neighbors.We were on the 17th floor with a nice view of the Trump building.The hotel had a very nice hot breakfast included in the price of the room. We felt safe in the area at all times and the doormen were always there to call for a taxi. It was walking distance to Michigan Ave.,good restaurants and a great little blues club called Blue Chicago. Chicago is a clean , friendly city and I would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel, maybe a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Sharon074
Reviews.Content: What we liked: 1. The location couldn't be better: near Michigan avenue (the main street of downtown Chicago) and only a 2 minutes' walk from a subway station. There are also many bus stations nearby, and all this without hearing the noise from the street (the hotel has many high level floors). 2. The room was comfortable and big: Great shower head, two televisions, equipped kitchen, good bed. 3. Very nice staff. 4. I used the swimming pool in the mornings for a few laps and really enjoyed it (it's not big, but has great view and is a little bit heated). However, the gym could stand to have more than two treadmills. 5. Good breakfast and, on week days, complementary dinner snakes. 6. "Pizza Uno", by far the best pizza we ever ate (and we've been to Italy....) is just around the corner. What we didn't like: The price was pretty high, although it's not unreasonable, considering the location and comfort. If it's not too much for you - go for it! If it is,you can find nice hotels in lower prices further away from downtown. A little tip: Chicago's public transportation (buses and subways) in superb. I would recommend depending on it instead of renting a car, unless Chicago is only one city you plan to visit on your road trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pghjanedoe
Reviews.Content: When I booked my trip I tried to find a hotel that was centrally located to the things I wanted to see. I hit the jackpot with this hotel. Walking distance to the Navy Pier, "The Magnificant Mile", and just about any cuisine in a restaurant you can imagine. I mainly went to hear some "Blues" music. There were several venues again within walking distance. The hotel had breakfast and a small meal available at dinner time, both free of charge. The food was nothing to write home about BUT hey it was free. I have had much worse that I paid for. The rooms were plenty big enough for two people. The kitchen does appear much larger in the pictures online but functional. (Bring your own dish soap) The valets were very friendly and courteous. They helped with directions and restaurant suggestions. My only complaint would be the maid service. I don't utilize the maids to clean my room every day at any hotel I stay at. I prefer my privacy but I do like fresh sheets every few days. And I ask the maid for new towels every day. After two nights I took my do not disturb sign off the door and left around 12n. I returned at 4p expecting a clean room. It hadn't been touched. I called the desk and was told I was on the "list" for 5:30p. Why in the world would anyone want a maid in their room at 5:30p? Isn't that when everyone is getting ready to go for dinner? In fairness to the hotel, the woman at the desk was going to send someone up but I was back in the room to get freshened up for the evening. I never saw a maid during the day. I called to get fresh linens. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: nlg
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay at the Homewood Suites in Chicago. We love the location-it is very convenient for walking all over the city and there are many great restaurants within walking distance. We were celebrating our anniversary and they sent a bottle of wine to our room-that was a nice touch. Star at the front desk was very helpful when we asked for directions and also was able to let us have late checkout on our last day. We enjoyed the breakfasts and the breakfast room was not crowded at all when we were there. The wine and beer was nice in the evenings-we ate dinner there one night when we didn't want to go out and it was very good. We hope to be able to return to Chicago and the Homewood Suites before too long. We had a corner room on the 19th floor and had a great view of the clock tower.

Reviews.Title: “the people are fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lacheson_11
Reviews.Content: 6 of us from rural Michigan checked in on the 21st of September. It started with John and his team at the door to greet us with smiles and welcomes (after our first Taxi ride which Iam sure came from Hell itself..).Then upstairs to Scott Kong at the desk...two of us girls sure gave him the run for his money with our questions of where to eat how to get there and whatever else we needed( some of which he had to answer 2 or 6 times and draw us pictures on the map).....but he kept right on the same page and was absolutley fantastic! And they stayed that way throuout our entire stay. One of us had a craving for a muffin at 9 0clock at night...Scott went to the kitchen and emerged with 4 warm danishes MMmmmm thanks Scott you saved us from a lonnnnngggg night. John made sure we had a taxi to fit all of us and did NOT come from hell to get us back to the train. Thankyou sooo much for making our stay in Chicago rememberable......

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MOfun42
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, Toni McGraff, the desk receptionist, asked us what our plans were for the weekend and if we needed any help with anything. We told her we were there to celebrate our Mom's 80th birthday. Toni asked us what kind of things our Mom liked and when we came back from dinner that evening there was a lovely basket of goodies and a birthday card for Mom in our room!! Toni really went above and beyond our expectations to make us feel welcome and personalized our visit. We will definitely stay with Homewood Suites when visiting Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites is my first choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mo2men
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Homewood for 4 days. People are nice & helpful. Location is close to many attractions & restaurants. Rooms are clean & include amenities for all what you need. Breakfast & dinner are great. I feel happy as the Internet is free.

Reviews.Title: “Was skeptical, but no more. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pyegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a winner. Who would expect a Homewood Suites to be great? I loved every aspect of this hotel. Its in a great location, has been recently renovated, serves a great breakfast (included), and has a great staff. The staff are very helpful and seem very happy here. It's a busy place but they are very relaxed, something I have not noticed in other hotels. A lot of people have alluded to how "busy" the hotel is with families. We were there in late September and the hotel was full, but the it was noisy or full of kids. Mostly an adult population at this time of year. As for the room, I had a one bedroom suite on the tenth floor that looked east. Nice room with a kitchenette, two televisions (one in the bedroom, other in the living room), free wifi, and a very nice bathroom. The only thing that was not newlyl renovated in the room was the bathroom tile, which looked a little tired, but was completely fine. Everything else was new and tastefully done. As for parking...I parked at the open-air lot one short block away (corner of Rush and Illinois). It's very convenient to the hotel and costs $35 per 24 hours. Warning: If you are late to claim your car, the first 1/2 hour (after 24 hrs) costs $10...so make sure you note the time you left car (on the ticket) and make sure you pay at the kiosk before your 24 hours is up.
