I got there 10 minutes "late" and paid an extra $10 for those 10 minutes! One more thing: you can get a AAA discount, but the rates differ by date because of the demand at the time (lots of conventions in the fall). All in all a great find. I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “The Place To Stay In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Duke1414
Reviews.Content: Great location .. lots of room .. friendly helpful staff .. excellent breakfast .. and Connie the personality of the breakfast room .. best value in the windy city for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wildwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my stay overall. Pros: --Location is great with many restaurants and shops in the area --Free breakfast and dinner is convenient, good quality and availability --Outstanding service at breakfast by Connie who remembered me by name --Fitness center is good size and has a nice view on the 19th floor. --Room was plenty big enough for business traveler --You can pick your room online when you check in --Room cleaned thoroughly and promptly --Did not use the grocery service but they will stock the fridge at your request Areas for Improvement --A single front desk person ruined check-in for me. She seems more interested in her personal conversation with another employee than helping me. I cleared my throat 3 times and eventually had to say excuse me to get her to help me. She was an anomaly though as everyone else was very polite and customer-service oriented --The rooms are good size but need a little bit of updating, especially the bathroom --Wireless is free but intermittently cut out for a 30 seconds at a time making browsing a little challenging. Overall very good experience. I would certainly stay here again. I am a fan of the Hilton brand and very pleased with my experiences with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Elevator Challenged”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Mom_035
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Homewood Suites in Chicago for a weekend family get-away. The price was right for a great location and suite style hotel. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from Nordstrom's, two blocks from a red line El-station and Michigan Ave, and a straight mile from Navy Pier. The hotel staff was all very friendly. The "Suite Start" breakfast was very crowded both mornings we ate there, but there was a wide selection of the usual hotel breakfast foods, both hot and cold. The breakfast staff was courteous and quickly took away dirty dishes to turn the tables. There was always hot coffee available in the lobby, which we found more convenient than brewing a small pot in our room. Our room was a standard 1-Bedroom King Homewood Suites room (I think I stayed in one in Baltimore that looked very similar). It wasn't large, but it was functional and comfortable. The downside of our stay there were the elevators. There are only two elevators to service a 30-story building. The lobby is on the sixth floor so you can't do or go anywhere without riding in an elevator, which would have been fine if both of them were working. One of the elevators was down most of the time we were there though. We had to wait at the street level entrance, in a long line of other guests, for almost a Â½ hour one day before we could get on an elevator. I felt like the bellmen could have offered to let guests ride on the service elevator, but they didn't. Then instead of waiting for the elevator to go up to the pool we decided to take the stairs. The stairwell was filthy and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. The pool is a little goofy too. It is like a big stainless steel tub. There are no stairs to get in, just ladders, so there is really no good place for little kids to play. Overall we had a good stay, and I would consider staying there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “worth shopping around”
Reviews.Author: kg-houson
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff with the exception of first person at check out desk. Returned several times to ask questions and other 2 front desk staff was helpful. (younger girl and gentleman). Our room had a great view of the clock tower and I am very glad we saved the money by not staying down by the waterfront. Very close to the redline for trip to Wriggley Field. Nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “City View”
Reviews.Author: WANDERLUSTinME
Reviews.Content: I recentley stayed at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago. It was a fantastic experience. Our room was located on the 9th floor, spacious King Suite with a city view, 2 tv's with Pullout! Free Breakfast on the 6th floor was amazing, lots of variety including fresh fruit daily! Excellent staff, very helpful. Pool on the 19th floor which we did not use as it has no stairs into it. No parking on site, but our car was taken by Valet to a building next door, very safe. Bring tip $. Great location, just 1 1/2 blocks from Michigan Ave, close to a fabulous authentic Italian Restaurant & Pizza Due around the corner! I would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: wiveliz
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and were welcomed by a very friendly staff. The location is excellent, close to Michigan Ave., boat tours, public transportation and food. My kids really enjoyed the area specially the Lego store close by, Navy pier and the river. The room is very comfortable and the separate living room is great when you have a baby that falls asleep by 8PM. My older kid really appreciated the space to vent down without waking up his little brother. The breakfast is a little bit crowded if you arrive after 8:30AM. The elevators are also a little bit slow. There are several food delivery services nearby and the microwave is pretty convenient to reheat any leftovers. The only "big" inconvenience we had was that the closest L line station (Red line) was under construction so there was no elevator and the only way to take the stroller with us was to take very long stairs. Not really a problem with a 1 year old but pretty inconvenient if you have a smaller baby that fell asleep in the stroller. Overall: very good value for the money, great location and perfect for families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: NDBNDB
Reviews.Content: We went during the labor day weekend to Chicago and stayed at this hotel. We took advantage of the $1 parking deal, and it worked out just great. The room was perfect with microwave/fridge and a gas range! The breakfast was extremely well stocked, they had steel cutlery! And finally, it is perfectly located - very close to a train station (we used subway when we did not use the car). The front desk personnel (Rose) was very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seem123
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay.Excellent location close to malls,shopping area,navy pier, magnificent miles, Staff was extremly friendly both in the reception and bell captain desk Rooms very comfortable .Flat screen both in the living room and the bedroom .Kitchen was convenient Overall a great experience

Reviews.Title: “The best stay of our 2 week vacation, highly recommend staying there”
Reviews.Author: TBAK
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, front desk and valets were extremely helpful. Rose and Starr at the front desk, Sam in the valet group and all the people associated with the property were always cheerful and asking what they could do for us. Room was clean and spacious,. bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was yummy (we did not make the dinners as we were out doing tourist stuff all the time I'm sure that was good too). We stayed 5 nights and it was the best stay of our vacation. A very top notch property!! Highly recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience we ever had”
Reviews.Author: Thomas G
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Wonderful accomadations. Great staff and service. Very great value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location. Felt Like Home”
Reviews.Author: USMC_Retired
Reviews.Content: Overall Impression: Great Location. Felt Like Home. Have stayed here for business and vacation. Plan to return for a visit next summer. With my Hilton Honors Diamond status, I received HH points. PROs: - Great staff -Proximity to local restaurants and shopping. - Everything within walking distance, even Navy Pier -Subway stop next door -Good Breakfast and Dinner -Room was spotless -Great Business Center -Affordable CONs: -$42 Valet Parking (only) - Good Breakfast and Dinner, but it gets crowded

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Stapleton29
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week on business and the Homewood Apartments were a little home from home. Friendly and helpful service from all of the FOH staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: aleitz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now and every time it has been consistently great. Perfect location to the Red Line to get up to Wrigleyville and right in the middle of downtown. The Bellmen are always in high spirits and willing to take care of your needs. This time I booked 2 rooms and they put us right next to each other without us asking and it was just great to have close proximity with the people we were traveling with.

Reviews.Title: “Was it bad? Well, no. But...”
Reviews.Author: ATLDavid
Reviews.Content: I have to preface this review by saying that what may be pleasing to one person may not be pleasing to another. It is all relative. Being in the room right near the pool on the top floor was not a terribly pleasing experience, as I was constantly subjected to the yells and cries of children consumed with delight as they charged to the pool with their parents; these joyful children and their parents could be heard clearly and explicitly from the hallway. Yes, it occurred to me early on to change my room; however, given the arduous experience that checking in was (and I heard the front desk repeatedly explain to other guests that there were no other rooms available), I decided to just stay in the room. Some reasons why include that the room was clean. The bed was quite comfortable. The room itself and its view were pleasing. Then again I was not in Chicago to admire the Trump Tower from my hotel window. Again, it's all relative. Now, let's talk about the piece that was most unpleasing--the check in. I admit to having gotten there early (around 11:30 a.m.), but "my room" was, according to the front desk, not yet available and would not be guaranteed until 4 p.m., but I was offered to drop my luggage off with the bellmen and to call back around 2 p.m. to check if my room was available. So, off we went to wander about the city, which was fine, but not ideal since I had hoped to get in before 1 p.m. to get settled before taking the 3 p.m. architectural boat tour, for which I had already bought tickets. I do realize though that the rules are the rules and that the fine print does say that rooms are guaranteed until 4 p.m. As anside, I was told that upon my return I would be able to pick up my luggage from the bellmen and that they would have the keys to my room (I had already done the paperwork during my initial attempt to check in). Well, it didn't quite transpire as promised. Upon our return, we were directed to go back to the front desk to get our keys (the long was extremely long and occupied with some unhappy campers who evidently were encountering some problems. In all fairness, it was Labor Day weekend and quite busy). On a positive note, the bellmen did bring our luggage up to our room and everything was intact. The bellmen were always friendly, the front desk staff not terribly so. At any rate, the breakfast was fine. The location of the hotel was outstanding. It is a fine place for families given the suite model. Was the experience bad? No, maybe if I had had another room away from children stampeding towards the pool, I would have had a different impression. But I can't know that. What I do know is the check in process was disappointing and the room cleaning service did not come until 6 p.m., hence the average rating in lieu of a "very good" or even "excellent" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great on every level”
Reviews.Author: travelbugRNC
Reviews.Content: After reading the many reviews, and spending to many hours on picking a hotel, I am so glad I decided on this choice! Every part of our stay was great, from the hotel check in, where they provided us with maps, and what was near by for free (Navy Pier Trolley), to the meals, to checking out and the bellman getting us a cab to the train station. I will be back for business or pleasure Had the room request, and where very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Just great.”
Reviews.Author: Toton-traveller
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, just around the back of the Magnificent Mile. Pizzeria UNO is just across the street, and was well worth the visit. The hotel is valet parking only, and the valet staff were really friendly and helpful. They have obviously honed their craft over years. We had a be my guest certificate and the front desk accepted it without question. Our room, a one bed suite with two double beds, was very spacious and equipped with a kitchen. It was amazingly quiet. Breakfast was a bit of a hectic affair. The lady running the area was a little curt when we arrived and went to sit down, not realising that we had to be seated. This was the first homewoodsuites where we had ever had to be seated. It made sense in this hotel, and I dont think she meant to snap at us, but it was a little off putting. She did smile on our way out. We did not have time to go to the pool but it was quite cool, being on the 19th floor, and had views over the city. I would recommend the hotel, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough GREAT Things!”
Reviews.Author: popskid2
Reviews.Content: All of the wonderful things people have said about this hotel are true! You can't find a better group of people than the staff here.- I don't care where you stay! From Mr. Young(special thanks!) on....So kind, helpful, accommodating and professional. I don't think they know the word "no"! Thank you to everyone who helped to make our Girls' Weekend absolutely perfect in every way. Our room was great - fantastic view! The location is perfect. Close to Mich Ave. but still close to all the cool restaurants a bit West of Mich Ave too. Shopping everywhere. Red line stop is a half a block away. Water Tower and Millennium Park are about five or six (short!) blocks away each so it's the best of all worlds. The breakfast was very good with lots of fresh fruit (even big fat blackberries!) and nice entree hot choices too. Great place for families too. You can pay more somewhere else, but why??? Can't beat the value. We got the $1.00 parking deal. Saved us about $200.00 over elsewhere. Stop looking and book your room now. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonsar2
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. The location is central to all. The free food breakfast and dinner was outstanding. The suite for the price was a great vaue it was like a small apartment with a refrigerator and microwave. The amenities and people could not have been nicer.I have two teenagers and they are well-- your typical critical teens and they gave it a big thumbs up. If you want to in a great place stay--stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: nyyanksrdbest
Reviews.Content: Although the date above says September 2010, I actually stayed in August 2010 (not an option). Anyway, this hotel was perfect. Excellent staff, excellent offers with the free breakfast and free internet. Very clean bathroom. The only one minor complaint I have was the pool. It wasn't dirty but it was not that clean. Nonetheless, if you ever visit Chicago, this is the perfect hotel to stay in. I would definitely come back and recommend it to others when they visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: hqunit22
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Homewood Suites in suburbs that had very spacious rooms. This hotel was a older and smaller but we still did not feel cramped. The Free breakfast and dinner buffet REALLY saved us money on this trip and the dinner buffet was with kegged beer and wine like Embassy Suites once had. We had a few minor things come up that the staff was overwhelmingly more than happy to remedy for us (and quickly did so). The $1 parking was also a savings ($45-$50) and the very close proximity to EVERYTHING was great. The trolly was right outside the door and picks up every 15 minutes to take you directly to the Navy Pier and back before 10PM. We got a Chicago Go pass for two days of a 3 day trip and the Gray Line Trolleys this pass gets you on takes you anywhere in the area with a open top view of everything on the way (Don't Stand Up, You'll Die!) Our family will only come back to THIS great valued hotel, next year when we come back. We had a great time in Chicago (although I really don't like cities) The exposure to the diversity and the cleanliness of the downtown part of the city made this a superb place for my kid's to stay in their first BIG city. See the picture for our nice room view (we asked for a certain room and they were able to give it to us) Really nice people running this hotel, from the Valets all the way through Guest Services and room service. Not a four-star hotel, but definitely a four-star value. Our Family Will Be Back.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay. Great downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: ladyluck523
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat. Very close to Navy Pier and Red Line public transportation. Also, plenty of shopping. It's across the street from Nordstrom and about a block from Bloomingdales. I've been to other Homewood Suite properties and this was a typical Homewood Suite. Comfortable, clean rooms with kitchens. The free breakfast was good but at times could be quite crowded. They do offer an evening reception with things like Pizza night or Hot Dog night or Pasta night and wine and beer but we never took advantage of it. There are too many good restaurants within walking distance! Another nice thing about this hotel was the indoor rooftop pool. Beautiful views and way for kids to work off some energy. It is "Valet Only" parking which my husband doesn't like since he doesn't like them touching his car but I suppose it's a necessity in this downtown location. All in all a good home base for our explorations of Chicago. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: AprilMoon
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel in a great location. Big rooms, complimentary breakfast a big plus. I didn't have a chance to try the snack-bar, it sounded great too. Customer service was really good and flexible. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: lstark123
Reviews.Content: At times my work has required extended stays. You all were the best for that....Lately have travelled just for pleasure. This Homewood in Chicago is one of a kind. Perfect as usual. Oh, and for those of you who don't know where this hotel is at --it is on the Magnificent Mile....Wonderfully accessable to shopping food, sports stadiums, and parks. The true heart of Chicago. The staff is great--helpful, friendly and knowledgable. Rooms as they should be-clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great food, cool-ish front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: babymakes387
Reviews.Content: This hotel was almost sold out. We picked it for the $1 parking special, and the perks of free breakfast and free evening snack. Upon checkin the clerk was toneless and rattled off the necessaries, did not welcome me as a Hilton member, and said there were no other rooms then the King bed available. So be it. The evening reception is from 5-7 and they offer beer and wine. Also available are take out containers so you can bring food to your room. We took advantage of both the breakfasts and receptions. In the breakfast room is Connie to seat you and take care of removing plates. Her attitude shines, she is welcoming and would give you the shirt of her back. Take a look at all the stars she has received because of her service. Great job Connie. The room was great, liked that the bedroom and living room had a door that you could shut. Cleaning staff went as far as putting away the clean dishes in the dishwasher. Spoiling us! I had to go to the front desk 3 seperated times, and I got the same attitude from each employee, like I was bothering them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location ! Loved it”
Reviews.Author: USA123WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a location. Just 2 blocks from the magnificent mile and close to many many excellent restaurants. The staff there was extremely good and helpful. Scott who is the manager there must be keeping his staff well motivated as they were always available for any help including our need for some extra bedding late at night. They have a buffet breakfast and a diner every evening ( Mon-Thu) at 5PM including drinks. That is fantastic, as it allows one of have a bit of fill before walking out for a stroll in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, but not a great Homewood”
Reviews.Author: Midatlanticmom3
Reviews.Content: One thing for sure is that you can not beat this location in Chicago, but I think I would not stay again at this property. I would choose one of the other hotels near it. The pull up to the front is very very tight and you come up to a small corridor with an elevator, small sofa and a TV. It gets real tight if bellman are there with luggage carts. The lobby is located on the 6th floor. The pool is located on the top floor but so needs to be fixed up. It was freezing in the pool. It looked like something out of a horror movie and so not kid friendly at all. A few minutes there and we were outta there!!! The room was clean but seemed very worn. The orange slippery type of comforter on the king size bed was just something out of the 70's. The breakfast area was very small and the food was not that great. The staff were helpful but not overly friendly. They have very very little 2 bed rooms available...they have a waiting list for those. My husband needed something out of our car and it was a hassle to do the whole garage/valet thing so he watched where they took the cars to park for the guests. They park the cars in the Hilton Garden garage (which has direct hotel access to the Hilton Garden) so he took our spare key and found the car to get the item. This was a rewards stay so I can not comment on pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: bravotango
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2-nights on a quick getaway to experience downtown Chicago and catch a show. The hotel service was wonderful, especially the helpfulness of the bell men/concierge. Good location near the river and the lake...could walk to Navy Pier and Michigan Ave. Nice pool on top floor..kids loved it. Suites had nice kitchen and comfortable beds...very quiet rooms considering you're downtown. Manager's reception on weekend nights and free breakfast. Will definitely stay here next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “LEGENDARY PENTHOUSE POOL W/ VIEW”
Reviews.Author: Harris_of_Hollywood
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough about this hotel, and how wonderful our stay was. One thing I have to single out though is the pool in the penthouse, and the unobstructed view of the lake... breathtaking! Amazing, amazing, amazing! We loved out room, we loved the people who worked there, and look forward to going back! It was my 1st tiemin Chicago, and they made it very very special. Cheer!

Reviews.Title: “Can we get an elevator?”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1024_9
Reviews.Content: This property is average for a suites hotel. Feels very crowded when fully booked, which it was the weekend we were there. Wait times for elevators (there are only 2 for this large property!) were so long, a lot of people just gave up and took the stairs. As a result, fire doors were propped open to allow everyone access to the sleeping-room floors from the stairwell. Surely a fire hazard. The scene at the breakfast buffet was chaos. This place reminds me of a lot of Hilton properties: Like a cattle call. Too little space and investment given to the public areas, so that when the hotel is full it really feels cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back here next summer”
Reviews.Author: demaru
Reviews.Content: I come to Chicago every summer for my research for these couple of years and used to live in the city. I have stayed at several other hotels but this is the hotel I will use from now on. The door persons and front desk staff were always pleasant even late hours after midnight. The room was somehow outdated but kept cleaness. All the dishes were put in the dishwashers everytime we came back to the hotel. Breakfast and welcome supper with beer and wine were available although I stopped going to breakfast since it lacked the variety after three days. The room was just cozy and comfortable, just the right size for two people. I loved two flat tvs in the bedroom and the living room since my fiancee usually stays up later watching tv. We stayed ten days there and do not any complains but the two things. One is the elevators. They only had two elevators fir the size of the hotel and one time I waited for exact twelve minutes. The other one is we found there was no one at the door at 4 in the morning one time. The door was wide open and anyone can walk into the building. One guy came back from outside. I thought it was a bit strange although it is located in river north, relatively well patrolled area in Chicago. I also want to add that I liked Connie and Tony among the staff. They were always pleasant no matter how busy they seemed. I love the hotel and we will be back next summer for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Sara9889
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and it is my hotel of choice in Chicago. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Internet and breakfast are included, making this a great value compared to other Chicago hotels. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “They look after you here.”
Reviews.Author: CaroStev
Reviews.Content: This place really looks after its guests and all of the staff we encountered were cheerful and friendly. We were backed up a block at check-in, but we were in our room with our bags in no time. I asked at the front desk if there were enough towels for 4 people and they immediately sent up more. We got fresh towels every day (not environmentally friendly, but we appreciated it). Decided we needed a cot and that arrived to the room right away (no charge). Very clean hotel and the king bed is comfortable. Suites are roomy, although the sofa bed is best for one person or two small children. Plenty of seating for hot breakfast or they provide styrofoam boxes to take it up to your suite. Had morning coffee by the pool, which is also very clean with plenty of fresh towels. Great location - a short walk to most attractions (less than 20 minutes to Navy Pier), and steps away from the Red Line up to Wrigley Field. Free wireless was a big bonus as we were able to check attraction prices and hours. We sometimes heard showers and a bit of noise from other rooms, but it is a hotel so you need to be prepared for some of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: daddyoIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: So don't expect the Four Seasons and you'll be satisfied that you left with the best possible value for your dollar. Rooms are showing signs of age to be sure, but nothing I could not deal with for a couple nights. Pros Location. - we took advantage of the block walk to Michigan as well as to the CTA red line (best way to museums via bus130 transfer). Plenty of restaurants and groceries nearby. Cons Madhouse in dining room for breakfast. Have patience and you'll get a decent breakfast as part of your hotel rate. I did not try any of the dinners with all the great restaurants in area. Rooms need refreshing. Mostly in bathroom/closet area.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rad2011Destin
Reviews.Content: We frequently spend long weekends or a week during the summer in Chicago. This is the only place we stay. We hunted for the perfect location and found it. The staff is great and helpful. Food is good. Love eating supper there during the week and then heading out for a great dessert. It is on the trolly and redline route so getting around is easy. The pool is great with a good view. And the best part, after a a long day the kids can sleep in one room as we have peace and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, great value.”
Reviews.Author: neshera
Reviews.Content: Thought I had booked a $1/day parking special; turns out the agent who booked me by phone did not set this up, and the hotel did not have any of these specials left when we arrived. So parking was the standard $42/day - still a bargain for downtown Chicago, with unlimited in/out privileges. And that is the worst thing I can say about this hotel! The room was surprisingly large - two double beds and a sofa bed, kitchenette. Plenty of room for two adults and three teens. Very clean. Free WiFi worked flawlessly - so we could check out attractions, book tickets, etc. from our room. If you need to print out tickets, there is a business center just off the lobby with free computers and printer. Good buffet breakfast AND DINNER included daily! Very friendly and available staff. Basically on the Magnificent Mile; 15 minute walk to the Art Institute. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good buy for your buck spent”
Reviews.Content: I have spent a very good time in this well placed hotel. The staff is friendly and the service is good. The front desk employee 'Loreena' is very efficient and extremly forthcoming when it comes to helping out customers. She is the good soul of the front desk. Rooms need some freshen up and the hotel needs an additional elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money. Would not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: mckinj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is trading on the Hilton name and although adequate the decor is dated and depressing. Although classed as a three star the prices do not reflect this. It was more expensive than other four star hotels in the neighbourhood, The breakfast is poor quality and the room very crowded. All in all the worst hotel we stayed at in a 14 day tour of Canada and the USA. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and staff , we had a wonderful 4 days here !”
Reviews.Author: christinecostarica
Reviews.Content: Thank-you Tripadvisor for another great hotel. I was a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews but I have come to the conclusion (after 3yrs and numerous hotel bookings) that I need to trust the majority of positive reviews while also keeping in mind it is impossible to please everyone (and trust me I read every review on top rated hotels before I book, it drives my husband crazzzy...) . I would like to thank all the people who have taken the time to write the positive reviews the information provided is top notch and accurate !!!! Just remember if the majority of the reviews are positive you will have a winner. This hotel in my review gets a two thumbs up. The staff is excellent here, the front desk staff will take the time to answer your questions and will give you directions with a smile sometimes very rare for a busy hotel in a large city.The valet staff are friendly and efficient.Connie is very warm and friendly with a great smile. We found Connie's warm greeting each morning to be a fantastic start to our complementary breakfast which by the way we found to be fabulous, there was fresh fruit, moist scrambled eggs,waffles,muffins,bacon,yogurt,cereal,tasty side potatoes,bagels, toast and if you wanted coffee and tea all day long at the front desk.I could not imagine not being excited about the complementary breakfast. My husband and I had discussed going out for breakfast because of a few negative reviews but after our first morning we were laughing at the idea of going elsewhere for breakfast .....and I truly mean laughing (and very happy with the savings,we figured we saved $20.00 each morning and saved the stress of finding a restaurant before starting our day) I can also honestly say we found nothing negative with our stay .Our room was spacious with a clean bright kitchen with a full fridge( ice maker to boot ). Bathroom was large and also spotless,thank-you to the cleaning staff, beds were very comfortable ,pillows were great and I think they were five all together on the bed, view was fantastic and oh..... by the way location is outstanding and we felt very safe in the area (downtown Chicago is a very clean and friendly city) In Close if you are looking for a hotel with clean spacious rooms,great location including a great complementary breakfast to start your day and free wi-fi at a reasonable rate in downtown Chicago this hotel will fulfill your needs with a smile( I am smiling right now as I recall 4 great days in Chicago ) Thank-You Homewood suites Chicago for all your hospitality !!!!..... we felt very comfortable and very proud of our choice... hope to be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: RAD24
Reviews.Content: I booked the $1 suite deal parking.When I received my reservation email the offer was not included.I had to call several different people to get the reservation cancelled(which took about 2 hours total)When I called and spoke with the Assistant Manager(Mr.Berg) he said it was not the hotels fault and they had done nothing wrong.He offered no compensation for all the trouble which WAS THEIR FAULT.He was pompous and uncaring.Stay somewhere else.Don't give theses jerks or the Hilton's your money

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but watch your belongings!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amydietcoke
Reviews.Content: While it was a nice hotel, but i am rather frustrated with them! During our stay our room was cleaned twice by housekeeping. The first day was fine. Second day my diamond earrings came up missing. Noticed they were missing while in the packing up and checking out process. My biggest mistake was not staying there and dealing with this further. But we had a family reunion and funeral to get to. While the front desk was great and said they would handle it, I believe they say these things just to get you to go on about your way! We filed a police report and the GM of the hotel is supposed to be working on it. We have called several times but receive no answers. They keep telling us the cleaning staff have been there 10 + years.....that dosen't matter to me! If they are not held accountable what's to stop them from taking anything. There is a dishwasher in the room, and they found my daughters ring (which was in the same glass with my diamond earrings) in the dishwasher. They say I put the cup in the dishwasher. First, I am on vacation, trust me i'm NOT doing dishes! Second, why would I wash one glass and leave the other dirty dishes in the room? So, while it is a nice hotel....lock up your things of value! They may come up "missing" and you'll be left frustrated!!

Reviews.Title: “Five or Six People in Your Family?”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: Then this place will work for you. We got a room with two doubles in the bedroom and a double-sized sleep sofa was in the living room. The rooms were large, especially the bathroom. The sink was outside the toilet/shower area, with a lot of counter space. I can't decide if the decor is dated or was planned by someone with no sense of style. I'm leaning towards the latter, as most items are still in pretty good shape, even though they appear to be circa 1980. We paid an arm and a leg for the place ($350 with taxes) , but every place downtown was super-expensive during Lollipalooza. At least we got the $1 parking package. When booking, pay extra-close attention, as that parking package is easy to miss. If using the hotel's parking service, just pull up in front of the Grand Ave. entrance for the valet park. We requested a rollaway bed, but none were available. The hotel was completely sold out during our stay. The good news is the wait for the elevators wasn't usually too bad, nor was the noise from other guests. My son wasn't particularly fond of the pool or work-out room. I thought the breakfast was great and I'm pretty picky. The scrambled eggs tasted like real eggs, as did the sausage. They also served hash brown potatoes. There were ripe pineapple chunks and melon balls, too. The breakfast room is a zoo if the hotel is crowded. You may have to wait a few minutes for a table. Get there early or be prepared to get a container to go, as you may have to eat in your room. There is no conceirge, so you must go to the front desk. They gave us directions to Gino's, but failed to mention the discount coupons they have available. (I asked if they wanted some we didn't use.) They have discount coupons for many restaurants and tours, so don't forget to ASK for them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: KM123175
Reviews.Content: My 3 young children (ages 2, 4, 6) and I stayed at the hotel for 1 week. The free breakfast and dinner/receptions were high quality and nutritious, which made feeding my family much easier. They were also nice enough to try to seat us near the food since I seated my children and then went to get the food. We used public transportation for most of our stay, and they are conveniently located near several bus stops. The sleeper sofa was very uncomfortable; we could feel the springs when we sat or laid on the bed. If you need the pull-out, you might want to consider your options.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time in Chicago ... Won't Be The Last!”
Reviews.Author: GdRocker03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and this was our first time in Chicago. We had stayed at a Homewood Suites in Ohio before, and loved our stay so we booked this hotel right away when we found one was available in Chicago. We got complimentary breakfast and dinner everyday which saved us lots of money. Connie who works in the dining room does an excellent job getting people seated and making sure everyone enjoys their meal. The doormen were very friendly and always helped out, even held our luggage for us after check-out while we waited for our train that left a few hours later so we could go do more stuff around town. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. Hotel was in a busy area of town but was one block from the subway and within walking distance to many attractions. There is also a free trolley that goes to Navy Pier and has a pick-up spot one block away. The only downside to this hotel is probably the elevators, sometimes you had to wait awhile to grab one during "mealtimes". Overall, excellent hotel and a great staff! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home for a week - everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kfl56
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago for a week for vacation. My king sized bed suite became my home for the 6 nights. I loved having the kitchen with a coffee maker, burners, toaster, full size fridge and freezer, full size microwave, plus a living room, along with the bedroom and nice bathroom. I was on the 19th floor at the end of a hall in the corner and my suite was very, very quiet. The view of the city was really beautiful, especially at night. Even though I was on the same floor as the gym and the pool, I was on the other end and the only thing I ever heard was the occasional comings and goings of the people in the one suite across the hall from me, and that was only if I was in my kitchen or living room - the bedroom was totally insulated from any hallway or other side of the wall noise. The hotel was loaded with families, but my suite still was quiet and private - it felt more like an apartment than a hotel. The breakfasts were wonderful - I mostly enjoyed the yogurts, breads and fresh fruits (twice there were huge fresh blackberries, along with daily blueberries, melon, pineapple, apples, bananas), but there were also hot choices, cereals etc. as well. I chose to take my food up to my suite each morning, but seating was mostly not a problem. The "welcome home" meals were mostly geared towards families and kids, but you can't beat the free wine and beer! I also took that up to my room. It is all you can eat and drink and they are happy to provide as many take-out containers as requested. The maid service was also excellent - I never saw them, but each day I came back from sightseeing to the usual made bed and cleaned bathroom, along with kitchen dishes washed in the dishwasher, kitchen garbage taken out and all kitchen counters wiped. There is a Trader Joe's about 2 blocks away, so I kept a small supply of snacks and seltzer in the fridge and cabinets. I loved this hotel and will look for Homewood Suites wherever else I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for exploring Chicago”
Reviews.Author: SALovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because most of my usual choices were fully booked for the dates that I was in Chicago. I was pleasantly surprised. This is a good hotel for exploring Chicago. It is close to the main attractions. It is also good value for money. The staff was friendly and helpful and made me feel at home. The breakfasts were also great - made it worthwhile to get up in the morning for them. My only gripe is that I got a room with a view of the parking lot. But I guess that is what you get for making last minute reservations! I will definately have this hotel in my list of potential Chicago hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Deal, Careful When Making Reservations”
Reviews.Author: STherese05
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here at the end of July. We had a one-bedroom king suite with a pull-out sofa. The comfortable room was large and spacious. The refrigerator was full-size and we had a working stove top. Unfortunately, our room was next to the elevator and our Chicago view was of the parking garage across from us. Still we got a good deal on the rates and the parking was only a dollar extra. The breakfast was ample and delicious. For us, it was difficult to eat in their extremely crowded breakfast room as there were few tables that could accommodate a family of five. Fortunately they had take out containers which we would fill and take up to our room. We took advantage of the evening reception only once, but it was wonderful. They served pulled barbecue pork sandwiches with green beans. The menu posted on our refrigerator listed other quite substantial meals. On Monday through Thursday one could easily dine at the hotel. However, when you are in Chicago with all of those good restaurants within easy walking distance . . . . Some restaurants that weren't too far from the hotel that have been our favorites include, Star of Siam, Giordanos, Ed Deboviks. Shopping is also quite close as is an el station. They have a wonderful fitness center. You can work out on an elliptical machine, a treadmill, a bicycle or with weights while looking from the sixteenth floor onto the Chicago skyline. The pool is located next to the fitness center. The staff was always extremely friendly, welcoming us back each time we returned to the hotel. The only difficulty we had was when we made reservations. My husband called when he saw some great rates but was reluctant to prepurchase the package until we had finalized our plans. We weren't sure if we would arrive in Chicago on a Tuesday or a Wednesday. The reservatiion clerk with whon my husband spoke told him he could hold the rate for a few days. My husband took his name, but unfortunately when he called a couple of days later, they denied him that rate. After my husband spoke with a manager, the reinstated it, but it took a few phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: wineyrose
Reviews.Content: What this hotel lacks in elegance and class it makes up for in comfort and convenience. Great for families who want a full kitchen and fridge along with separate bedroom with privacy door and pull out sofa for the little ones. Breakfast is included as is an evening appetizer and cocktail reception. Check-in was flawless with car valet and bellman. Upon checkout, there seem to be mass chaos in that area. Since there is no concierge thehelpful front desk staff must answer endless questions from tourists about what to do and how to get there. If you have a simple question- call from your room instead. If you need change, get it somewhere else in town. Great place to stay- will return again.

Reviews.Title: “We would highly recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Neil2e
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago. The reservations were made by Kristy, who made our stay something to remember. Our room was clean, spacious and had a spectacular view of downtown Chicago...the Chicago Tribune,Trump's building,etc.The breakfast "feast" each morning offered a delicious variety for everyone's palate!!! We enjoyed the free wine and beer from 5-7 pm on Monday night. The hotel was well within walking distance to many of Chicago's attractions and buses seem to be running all the time for those who would rather sit back and relax... Thanks Kristy for answering all our questions,giving directions, and welcoming us to Chicago!!! We'll be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Comfortable Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AndThePirates
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at Homewood Suites and would recommend it. Very comfortable room with separate sitting area, two TVs, nice large bathroom. Very clean and quiet. Free breakfast provided a wide variety of things to eat, and Connie, who works in the dining room, was cheerful and helpful to everyone who came for breakfast. Doormen were helpful and welcoming. Easy walk to Millennium Park, Navy Pier, and stores on Magnificent Mile. Plenty of good restaurants in surrounding blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Worked very well”
Reviews.Author: bubu3
Reviews.Content: Extremely well located (and yet not noisy) downtown, this is a reasonably proced hotel with small but comfortable suits and a large bathroom. The staff were extremely helpful and the breakfast worth going down for.

Reviews.Title: “Our standard Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: OMC1212
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we come to Chicago and could hardly imagine staying at another hotel. Everyone from the valet to the front desk staf and everyone in between works their tails off making sure you feel welcomed and "at home" here. The location is perfect. Easy access to everything you want or need to do in downtown Chicago and if you can't get there on foot, one of the oh-so-friendly doormen will flag a cab for you. Don't be surprised if they start calling you by name. The rooms are very spacious, even for a rambunctious three-year-old. We always find clean rooms with comfortable beds and love having the ability to connect our travel DVD player to the living room television. Having a kitchen is really great if you'll be in the city for any length of time and there are plenty of places nearby to grab some groceries if needed. Having the option of a light dinner during the week is a nice touch. Most of the time we don't do dinner in the city until later so it's nice for the kids to be able to have a warm snack. Breakfast consists of nice, fresh, standard breakfast items and everything is plentiful. We have yet to find an empty dish when we go to the dining room. I should also add that on our last visit we had one issue with some water dripping through the ceiling but the problem was handled SO swiftly and professionally that I can't even count it against them. In fact, we even received a very generous discount for that stay. It is my belief that it isn't what goes wrong, it's how it's handled and I was not disapointed. Customer service is really wonderful here. All of these reasons, and so many more, are the reason why Homewood Suites is our only choice in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good price and great location”
Reviews.Author: BluesDoctor
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old son and I stayed here for the weekend to see a concert and a White Sox game. The hotel is very well located being two blocks from the Red Line and a easy walking mile to the Navy Pier. Lots of good restaurants around the corner. Pizzeria Uno, Harry Caray's, Rock Bottom Brewery and a couple of dozen others within a short stroll. Shopping is close also but was not on our agenda as we were bachelors. The price was competitive and came with a passable breakfast. The only downside was the room. While it was clean and comfortable a few problems existed. The bathroom fixtures, i.e. toilet and shower head, need repair and the mattress on the sofa bed would give a Chiropractor some business. The in room A-C unit had vents that blew directly on the bed and the sofa making it hard to regulate between arctic or off. The vent slates were adjustable but this made little difference. If you are use to sleeping with a fan blowing on you, this is your hotel. I would stay again just for the location and price but plan on making some "architectural" adjustments

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: YellowJacket26
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Homewood suites 5 times in the last 3 years. It is, hands down, a very well run hotel. The desk staff is extremely courteous and helpful. The breakfast is above average for a Homewood, especially when compared to some of the ones in Orlando, FL. The location is excellent, one block off the red line, walking distance to the Miracle Mile, hundreds of great restaurants within walking distance. I don't even look at other hotels in Chicago when traveling with my family anymore. Just book the Homewood and I'm done.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for our family!”
Reviews.Author: hopeandlarry
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight (9 of us), & the bellman was cheerful as was the front desk! From that point on, it was a wonderful stay! Breakfast was great, very good variety, & plentiful. The hotel seemed full, but the staff moved us with smiles & humor. The front desk staff was great in steering us toward resturants that were good for all of us (grandparents, parents, & kids). The walking was easy, but the trolly to Navy Pier, on our last full day, was nice! In our 6 night stay (3 rooms), we had the evening refreshment only once, but it was very good, so no need to go out to eat that night. The first guys you meet are downstairs, & they were able to find transportation for all of us, even in the rain! All in all, we were there for a family reunion (outside of Chicago), but the hotel was a great place for all of us, plus the kids enjoyed swimming in the pool! We will go back, but I'd like to enjoy it without feeling like I was "herding cats" every where I went! Thanks for a wonderful vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: amofam
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all - perfect location, nice suites, free breakfast, wifi, pool for the kids, and most notably, outstanding customer service. The front desk staff were all great! Leave the car, everything is in walking distance or short cab ride away. Be sure to walk over to the Tribune Tower on Michigan Ave and check out the pieces of buildings from all over the world. You can also get your picture made on the front of the newspaper and have it emailed to you. We will definitely be returning to the Homewood, thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for the Family”
Reviews.Author: Joseph58
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for convenience, room, and value, this is a great choice for Downtown North of the River. It's a block from Michigan, a block from the Red Line, and a block from Trader Joe's. And the location is surrounded by a wide variety of restaurants and stores. This property is not new - I stayed there ten years ago - but it is well maintained. The standard Homewood floor plan gives a family plenty of room to live, as well as a full kitchen â€“ nice if you are staying for several days. An excellent complimentary breakfast is provided each morning. The hotelâ€™s indoor pool and workout room on the 19th floor have a view of Hancock Tower. One of the finest features of this hotel is the well-trained and managed staff. They are consistently helpful and courteous - from check in, to the dining facility, to the parking valet. Downside â€“ this hotel is booked primarily by families for the tourist months. If you are business traveling, you may want to look elsewhere during the summer and winter holiday months. Iâ€™ll stay again and Iâ€™m looking forward to it already. .

Reviews.Title: “Your own apartment in the heart of downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: djrhoffman
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceed my expectations. For the price I expected a dumpy hole in the wall but I got a full one-bedroom apartment with kitchenette and large bathroom. I could have stayed there for a week! Not to mention they offer free breakfast, happy hour, and a light dinner all for less than the price of a regular hotel room anywhere else downtown. Good service. Great rooms. Amazing skyline views. Great location. Only downside was the lack of room service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Show66
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here with kids 10, 6 & 3. Generally enjoyed our stay. Rooms show a little age, but was fairly roomy, especially for downtown Chicago. Free breakfast is good, but pretty crowded every morning, however the staff generally handled it well. Kitchen was nice to have. Evening meals on Mon-Thu were pretty decent. Location was good: Walking distance to Michigan Ave, Navy Pier, Red Line, and bus stops that we needed. Staff was generally friendly and helpful. Kids enjoyed the (fairly small) pool with cool view from 19th floor. Overall, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly with a great location”
Reviews.Author: gdo_fred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beginning of July for a conference (me) and vacation (the family). We all enjoyed our stay there. We had a King suite and did use the fold out sofa. It was supposed to be for the kids, but I slept there one night when I was up late working and all the room was taken in the king bed :) The king bed was very comfy. The sofabed was acceptable - noticeably not as comfy as the bed, but passable. The rooms were well cleaned each day and the housekeeping staff was not pushy about getting in on their schedule. While the room comes equipped with a small kitchen, most times we found ourselves going out or enjoying the food downstairs. The breakfast changes daily and has plenty of excellent selections. Monday - Thursday, there is a manager's reception that includes a full meal. This isn't quite at the same standards as breakfast, but was still good. There is a 24-hour snack and sundry shop next to the reception desk. Trader Joe's grocery is also just two blocks north on Ontario. The kids wanted a pool, and they have one on the top floor that was open until 11pm. No problems with hygiene there and no overwhelming chlorine smell either. The pool deck has brilliant views of the city. The exercise room has a bike, elliptical, and treadmill, plus one upper body machine and some hand weights. The hotel is a short block and a half from Michigan Ave which has all the trendy shops, including an Apple store. My family had no problem walking up to the Water Tower Place (a high rise mall) or walking back with their packages. Note that Michigan Ave is at a higher level, so you need to go up the stairs by the street or through Nordstrom's. My conference was actually at the Hyatt on the other side of the Chicago River, but the walk there was pleasant and easy. We highly recommend straying out away from breakfast one day to visit Xoco, one of Rick Bayless's restaurants. Turn right on Grand, turn left on the near side of State and walk a block or so.Giordono's pizza is close by. We also highly recommend the boat tour "River and Lake" which includes going through the Lock from the river into Lake Michigan. Almost as much architectural info as the regular tour, but the lake is added fun. And the boats have a small bar and snacks downstairs! The Museum of Science and Industry is about 20 minutes away by car. Turn left on State, turn left across the river on Wacker, go down the ramp and turn right on Lakeshore Drive. Valet (only type available) parking is expensive at $42/night, but the bellhops/valets are quick and helpful. Chicago is a great town, and the Homewood Suites was a great base for our explorations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,breakfast and staff”
Reviews.Author: CasualTraveler53
Reviews.Content: Well located for downtown, the metro and seeing the sights. Homewood Suite's valet and front desk were very friendly and helpful even though the hotel was packed. The breakfast was excellent. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Even across from the elevator was fine because kitchen/bath/anteroom muffled the noise. Overall excellent way to see the city for a mid-range price.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: BBrown22
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay here with my husband and 2 toddlers, ages 2 and 3.5. We had a suite room with a king-sized bed and the space was perfect for our family of 4. IT was so nice to have a kitchenette- even though we never cooked in the room we definitely used the utensils, plates and glasses, and the frig. was a necessity! The location was great- right by the red line (which we did not use but I saw it), free trolley to Navy Pier, and just a few shorts block from Michigan Ave. and a Trader Joe's! Service was amazing right from check-in- our room was not ready right away because we were a bit early but our bags were stowed and we were told to come back in 45 minutes. Went to Northbridge Mall across the street and came back 45 minutes later and our room was ready! The front desk called right away to confirm that we wanted a pack 'n play and apologized it wasn't there and one was brought up right away. I didn't even have to call first! The first night I hadn't had a chance to get milk for my 2-year-old's bottle so I called down to the front desk to see if they sold it in the little convenience store. I was encouraged to come down to the kitchen and they'd provide me with some pints for her bottle free of charge- so sweet! :) Same thing with ice when we went to check out- our ice maker hadn't been working and we never realized it b/c we didn't use it the whole time we were there. One call to the front desk for ice and a huge bag of it was brought up right away to our door. Service was outstanding. Maid service was also top notch- each day our room was perfectly clean, beds made and bathroom spotless. Much appreciated with 2 little ones everywhere all over the room. The carpet was a bit worn and bathtub tiles showed signs of grout, but overall wonderful room. My biggest complaint was the way the door hung- I was in room 1413 and the door hung crooked on the frame so there was a sizeable gap at the bottom right and top left- lots of hallway noise filtered in and light at night. However, I brought a sound machine for the kiddos so that took care of the noise and the light didn't seem to bother them. Breakfast every morning was top-notch and such a cost-saver. Friendly staff and wonderful variety- can't find it anywhere else! We only partook in the evening reception on our first night but it was very nice to have free beer and deli sandwiches after traveling. Great value! :) The concierge desk was always friendly and helpful, as were the valet guys downstairs who greeted us warmly every time we came back to the hotel and left. Will definitely be back! Oh, one more note about the pool. We used it one night and the views were definitely great, but the cleanliness of the pool was a bit suspect. The kiddos didn't mind a bit but my hubby and I were a bit bothered. Still nice to have it, though!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: lyndaweavers
Reviews.Content: A group of us from the UK booked 3 rooms for a first time trip to Chicago. We loved the city, we loved the hotel. The location was good, the suites were spacious and very comfortable and the staff so friendly and welcoming. The inclusion of breakfast and welcome home drinks/snacks was a real bonus and made the rates really good value.. As newcomers to Chicago we found the reception staff and the concierge extremely helpful, they offered advice, made recommendations confirmed restaurant bookings etc. The staff in the buffet restaurant were also great. Well done to you all and thank you for helping to make our visit such a success. We'll come back to Chicago and back to the Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place we will ever stay in Chicago :)”
Reviews.Author: Aubrav
Reviews.Content: We were extremely impressed with this hotel. I was in the city on business and researched the hotels before booking so I could find one that was most comfortable for my family (My husband and 2 daughters, ages 5 and 9, came along on the trip). The staff was absolutely amazing in all departments. We arrived early around noon and were immediately assigned to a room. When we got there I realized that it was not the room type I had booked and called the front desk to switch rooms. They didn't have one available yet so we decided to go have lunch and walk around a bit. My husband realized that he had left our pack of bottled Pepsi's in the fridge in the room. We got back to the hotel and picked up the keys to the new room, all of our luggage was neatly laid out by the bell guys. After we checked out the room and oohed and ahhed over the space, large kitchen, views, etc. we decided to go to the beach. When we returned the pepsi's that we had left in the other room were in our fridge, I would definitely consider that taking care of the small details! That really impressed us. Connie, the breakfast waitress was fabulous, greeting us every morning as we walked in for the wonderful breakfast buffet. We also had the opportunity to talk to Vanessa who was making rounds at the dinner tables ensuring that everyone was having a great stay. She made sure to ask the kids their favorite parts of the city and she was very easy to talk to. The front desk staff was extremely helpful throughout our trip whenever we had questions about which buses to take, the best route to get somewhere, and they were able to accomodate us when we asked for a late checkout. My husband cannot stop talking about the valet guys! He LOVED them! Everyday after I went to work, he and the girls would head out to see the city and apparently they made very good friends with the valets. They were greeted every morning, afternoon and evening when going in and out of the hotel. They were also extremely helpful with directions and suggestions. One night we were heading to Navy Pier and were planning on taking the bus, but the valet guy stopped us and told us about the free trolley stop right next to the hotel that went to Navy Pier. They just felt like family. The maid service was also fantastic, and they did all of our dishes and re-made the sofabed every day when they came to clean the room. I just was amazed that they did the dishes for us. The breakfast was very good and fulfilling, each day consisting of some kind of eggs and meat (sausage, bacon), and always oatmeal, bagels, toast, fruit and yogurt. There was also an endless supply of different types of coffee and usually you could find some flavored creamers stashed in the creamer bin... a nice touch. The dinner was also completely adequate, each day featuring a different theme such as Mexican, Italian, Deli, etc. along with the complimentary beer and wine (but I'm not much of a drinker). The pool on the 19th floor was very nice with 180 degrees of city views out of floor to ceiling windows. There were also restrooms at the pool that included showers which seemed very convenient, and a towel rack full of towels so you didn't have to worry about using the towels from your room. I just can't stress enough how wonderful our stay was. We have never been taken such good care of anywhere we have ever stayed. Because of this we will never even consider staying in another hotel when visitin Chicago. This hotel will not disappoint!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A_Michigan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights with our 2 year old daughter and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. We stayed here once before - almost 5 years ago - and all employees that we talked to welcomed us back. The room was very spacious. The bedroom was even big enough for our daughter's pack n play. Having the full kitchen was wonderful - we were able to grab some supplies from the nearby Trader Joe's. It was nice to grab breakfast in the morning and bring it back to the room. The hotel is close to the Red Line and just a few blocks from Michigan Ave. The water taxi stop is also just a few blocks away - an easy way to get to Navy Pier and the Museum Campus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: momtogo
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for 5 nights at the end of June. We were warmly greeted by the gentlemen that worked at the front door. They informed us that reception is on the 5th floor. We arrived quite early so our room was not ready but the friendly gentleman working at reception gave us a map and some ideas for the day. We came back later in the day and were given the keys to our room on the 17th floor. The room was a fairly good size with a kitchen area, living area and bedroom with the bathroom attached. I will say the storage space is somewhat lacking in the room, really my only complaint. The location was great, we could walk to so many places. The Navy Pier free trolley stops just a block or so away. The Mag Mile is just a block or two over. We really just walked almost everywhere we needed to go. The breakfast buffet in the morning is good although it can be very crowded at times. The pool area was very nice and had great views, worth a trip up there. It is on the 19th floor. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations! Will be Back!”
Reviews.Author: couldntresist
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at a Homewood Suites before and was completely surprised at how great it was! I was in Chicago with my sisters, niece and nephew and it was a perfect stay! The entire staff was so incredibly friendly and helpful...from the valet, the bellhop to the front desk. I travel a lot and have never stayed at a hotel where every one was so great! The rooms were spacious and clean...the breakfast buffet was yummy and the location was perfect! Highly recommend! Will definately be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dswaggers
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night here. We went to Wrigley & did some shopping. Michigan Avenue is only a couple of streets away. Breakfast was an extended breakfast & very good. Room was very nice, roomy (has a small kitchenette, living room & very comfortable. Price was reasonable. We requested a late check out & it was no problem or charge.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: sue-manchester
Reviews.Content: 6 night stay with husband and son - our 4th visit and it was as comfortable as ever. We had a 2 dbles, one bed suite on the 17th floor and it was very quiet. The staff are so warm, friendly and very efficient. The breakfasts are great (more of the gorgeous bacon, please!) and the rooms are spacious. For quality and price you can't go wrong with the Homewood Suites Chicago Downtown. Tourist Tips: Art Institute is now free on Wednesdays (poss. only during summer). Grosse Point Lighthouse, Evanston - easy to get to using subway and local bus. Open Sat & Sun afternoons. Jewel Osco supermarket on the next block is handy for meals, beer, wine and stocking the fridge/freezer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: I was here for a weekend vacation in July 2011. This is an all suite hotel located right in the heart of downtown Chicago. Each suite has a full kitchenette, pull out couch, separate bedroom with doors that close, and a standard bathroom attached to the bedroom. These are probably some of the bigger hotel rooms that you will find in the city of Chicago. The front desk staff was great and housekeeping did a fantastic job each day. The hotel offers free intenet, free breakfast each morning, and also has a pool and fitness center on the top floor. Parking is expensive if you have a car and they charge $42 per night, but this is typical for any downtown hotel. The hotel is located 1 block from the red line train and there are literally hundreds of shopping and dining options in the vicinity of the hotel. This is not a luxury or full service property, but is great for families, groups of friends, and business travelers. I have stayed here several times and will be happy to return the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a great place for the value!!”
Reviews.Author: iluvtraveling123
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids stayed here for an overnight trip to Chicago (We're from nearby Milwaukee), to see Navy Pier with some friends from Ohio. We wanted to stay somewhere near Navy Pier and saw it was highly-ranked by TripAdvisor. It truly was worth it because we got a King Suite (with a living area and kitchen), 2 TV's, lots of extra blankets, and a great full buffet breakfast (not the "continental" ones). The trolley to Navy Pier was a short walk away, as well as shops, and we were next to such landmarks as the new Chicago Trump Tower, which was literally a block away!. Staff were friendly, service was great ! Definitely recommend staying here, especially for the price. Valet parking was steep but it's the running rate for all the other garages in the area..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, staff and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: hannokitty
Reviews.Content: Nothing but good things to say. Full kitchen with one bedroom. Perfect for families or, in my case, traveling with sister so she got sofa bed and privacy while I had the bedroom. Whole foods a short walk away. Trader Joe's just two blocks. 15 mn. walk to downtown loop. Across the street from Nordstroms and next to a great susi restaurant. No complaints. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Suspicious stains on duvet cover”
Reviews.Author: Takepictures
Reviews.Content: After reading good reviews about I booked a 5 night stay. Checked in late bit called early in the day to assure we'd have a roll away as well as the pull out sofa for 2 teens. They somehow had us booked for two rooms instead. Got that sorted out and arrived around 10 pm. Checked in and waited for our luggage... Finally went down and got it ourselves. The room was a little grungy, furniture shabby, and discovered a suspicious stain on the duvet cover. Ewww. Called for a new duvet cover which was delivered and unceremoniously handed to me. FYI it's kinda gross to have to change the duvet cover in a hotel. Next day tried to iron a dress for dinner and the iron didn't work. Called for a replacement, waited a while, called again and was brought another iron which also didn't work. Third time was a charm. Oh boy. Too bad we paid in advance. Won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ilovegophers
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel based on price and location. When we checked in, the front desk noted that our reserved room would be too small for the three of us so she put us in a larger suite at no extra charge. Room was clean and breakfast was fresh with lots of healthy choices. The location was outstanding since we were blocks from everything. The free Navy Pier trolley picked up right outside our hotel. Weber Grille was around the corner and Portillos was about two blocks down. They also offered free dinner wih beer and wine on Mondays thru Thursdays. Would come back in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Diane50336
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Homewood Suites in Chicago and will definitely be back. Connie, I believe was her name, in the eating area was wonderful! What a joy to see in the morning. Breakfast and dinner was good and worth going to. Hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to most things. The Metro is less than 2 blocks away and the doormen were extremely helpful. Rooms were a bit dated, but clean and very comfortable beds. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great value and location”
Reviews.Author: ladybeetle
Reviews.Content: This was such a great place, all staff friendly and helpful. I think our suite was just a standard king suite but it was large and clean with nice spacious kitchen, stove, fridge, dishwasher. It was nice not having to have been crammed in to a small room with one king bed. The location just blocks from where to catch the Hop on-hop off tour trolley at Rock and Roll McDonalds, and just short blocks to Michigan Avenue and shopping. There is also a large grocery store nearby. We either walked or took the trolley to Taste of Chicago at Grant Park. The hot breakfast buffet is free, delicious and convenient. No need to waste time finding an affordable breakfast restaurant! Get to breakfast early to avoid a short wait. The free dinner buffet served Mon-Thurs was also convenient. We ate, enjoyed happy hour before going out on the town. Between the breakfast and dinners I'm spoiled! The pool is mid-size and very clean. Parking is Valet only with in-out priveleges for $42. City garage is $38 with no in-out. I travel a lot and recommend this location. Good value for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: T-1SJCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My boys and I stayed at the Homewood Suites for 5 nights the last week of June. We found the entire staff extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel provides a breakfast and dinner, this helps after spending the whole day sightseeing. The room was very comfortable and well maintained. This hotel is only one block away from the Red Line and only two blocks away from Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarionOH_Buckeye_Fan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. It is close to shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing locations. Room was good. The bed mattress is soft. The bathroom is big but the sink is outside of the bathroom in the bedroom which is kind of inconvenient if someone is still sleeoing and you wanted to use the sink and mirror. The complimentary breakfast was very good. The welcome home reception in the evening was awesome. Great food and a different theme every night. You don't have to buy an evening meal if you eat at the reception. It is a meal, not just appetizers. Pool and work out area located on the 19th floor. Both were small but adequate and seemed clean. You also get a free USA today at your door every morning. I was however, disappointed in the service. I asked Rose at the check in for a suggestion on a place to eat lunch and she recommended the food court in the Nordstrom mall across the street. Huh? That's your recommendation? A food court? She seemed very unintersted in helping us. So when we were leaving the hotel, I aksed Jonah at the bellman desk for his recommendation. He asked us what kind of food we liked and really took an interest in helping us find a good place to eat. He recommended a wonderful place a few blocks away and it was very good. Jonah was very nice and helpful. Lisa at check-in also seemed uninterested in welcoming us to the hotel and helping us. I had to ask her where the breakfast and reception was served. I had a charge on my bill for the Suite shop for $19 that I did not make. So when we were checking out, I approached Horace at the front desk and asked about the charge. I told him I did not buy anything at the shop. He acted like he didn't believe me, but he did remove the charge. As I said before, the hotel is a great location and the rooms are clean and adequate. Despite the service of a few employees, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel impressed my family so much that we will always stay at a Homewood suites wherever we go.”
Reviews.Author: dzconaway
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. When we arrives we were greeted by Sami and Jonah. They were greatly helpful to us and even offered to store our roof rack away so that we could park locally. They both had great attitudes and always asked how we were and what they could do for us everyday that we saw them. The front desk ladies were great too. There was a mixup on the dates that was sort of my fault since I'm the one who scheduled us. I had called in and asked them to change the arrival date and it did not get changed. This seemed bad at the time bc the hotel cancelled our reservation and charged me for two nights. However, the front desk reversed everything and got us back in a room lickety split. The house cleaners did a great job. I never noticed that they had been there but I could see the clean sheets towels and surfaces. The only negatives I had about the hotel had to do with our bathroom. There is no entrance from the main space so I had to walk through the bedroom where my son was sleeping to get to the bathroom. The tub didn't drain well, the light flickered and the tub needs those safety traction stickers on the bottom. My child slipped in the shower. When I complained to the front desk they offered me a free nights stay. The pool and gym were ok. The best part of this hotel was the complimentary food. This saved us so much money and the food was of good quality. They did not try to skimp on it. The waitress Connie, i think, was awesome. She remembered us everyday and helped us get our table just the way we liked it. When something happened or someone was ill, she asked about us the next day. When there were problems with the meal she had them fixed immediately and made sure we knew when it was fixed. I was impressed with the service from a hotel employee. She could have been less helpful and attentive like other staff I have seen before but she chose to be great.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: milkav
Reviews.Content: I am actually a guest at this hotel right now and it is fine. we checked in yesterday. Our room has veru used furniture in the family room and overlooks a parking lot :( but we aren't here for the view. Dinner was good last night. We just came up from breakfast and it was good. Lots of guests needing to eat. My complaint is they let a group of 4 women take over a large round table and basically sit there for an hour or more not even eating. They had a banana and coffee. The room attendant kept hovering around them treating them like VIP's and they even had their suitcases over at our table crowding us where we couldnt even get out of our seats without almost tripping (and I have a sprained ankle to begin with) Then some other hotel workers came over to ask them if they need anything just let them know.
