This is all while other unimportant guests were standing in lobby waiting for a table to become available. NOT GOOD PRACTICES HOMEWOOD.! On another note we needed more shampoo and went down to get some last night but were told there wasnt any there but they wood send some up but they never did :(

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Visit”
Reviews.Author: ShowMe
Reviews.Content: For our annual business/pleasure trip to Chicago, we again chose Homewood Suites. The location is convenient for most any excursion, being located beside Nordstrom and just 2 blocks off of Michigan and the Magnificent Mile. The hotel is also close to the Loop area and a block from the El. Our arrival was after 11:00 p.m., but the suite which I had selected via eCheck-in was available. Suite 1904 is a corner room on the top floor-excellent views and extremely quiet. All staff were courteous and friendly throughout our stay. The room was immaculately clean with the linens being of a nice quality. It is always convenient to have the vanity area seperate from the tub/shower/toilet for the purpose of preparing for the day. There is a flat-screen TV in both the sitting area and the bedroom. There is free WiFi throughout the hotel. Decor is standard Hilton decor. Choices at the buffet breakfast were numerous, although the buffet area can get quite congested with no designated flow. It is helpful that a staff member is available to seat parties during the busiest portion of the breakfast time. This hotel is especially comfortable for families, so there are always lots of little ones around. But, again, we experienced no noise disturbances. If you are seeking a luxury, boutique experience, this hotel would not be a good choice. However, if location, friendly, courteous staff, clean/comfortable large sitting/kitchen/bedroom/bath space with included breakfast is important to you-then this is the hotel for you. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: homewood5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to visit Chicago for a long time and fianlly got here and So glad we did. Staying at the Homewood has just added tremendously to our trip. The whole staff is wonderful, starting with the guys that helped us with our luggage then everytime we needed to go someplace they were there to help with directions. Then the food lounge not only was the food delicious but also everyone who served us was terrific from Connie Wilson who was always gracious to us Guadalupe and Sergio who picked up our dishes to Guadalupe who constantly stocked the food bar, they are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: bernicetaj
Reviews.Content: First visit to Chicago, and I had a FANTASTIC time. The Hotel was centrally located to everything. The popular restaurants were all within walking distance of the hotel. Our destination was the Taste of Chicago , we walked to Grant park.There is a free Shuttle at the corner that will take you to Navy Pier. Shopping is across the street. The Magnificent Mile is can be found easily if you walk through Nordstrom. The L Train is 1 block from the hotel. We took the train to Wrigley Field easily. As for the Hotel, the rooms were clean and the staff superb. Breakfast was average Homewood Suites food.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: Christy001
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that would be within walking distance to most of our vacation sites we had selected. This hotel was perfect for being centrally located, but after staying there, it went above and beyond our expectations. I travel for business occasionally and have stayed in many hotels. I have never went out of my way to leave a review until now. This hotel deserves the review and positive feedback. We have a family of four, which includes a teenager and a toddler. We chose the "Park and Play" package which allowed us to access the valet parking as needed during our stay. The hotel provides complimentary hot breakfast buffet 7 days a week AND a hot dinner buffet Monday through Thursday. Every staff member went above and beyond to ensure our stay was fabulous. The valet staff was superb and recognized us as we came and left the hotel and asked how each of our visits were going and were available for transportation suggestions, restaurant suggestions, and more. The front desk was very accommodating to all our requests throughout the week. The Navy Pier trolley stops right in front of the hotel which was great, as was access to all the shopping on Michigan Ave and many of the great restaurants people have on their To Do List when visiting. I highly recommend the hotel for individuals and families for business or vacation trips.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Suz1991
Reviews.Content: Every year my family enjoys a few days in downtown Chicago. As often as possible, we stay at the Homewood Suites in Chicago. It is a wonderful location. So easy to get to when we take the train into the city and then take the Chicago Water Taxi. Just a few blocks to walk and we are at our home away from home. The hotel is a great property. They have a fantastic breakfast and dinner included in the price of the room. The staff is very friendly. One person in particular, Connie who is generally a part of the breakfast staff is always there with a smile and upbeat attitude. So nice to start the day with people who care and go out of their way to make you feel at home. If you are looking for a nice hotel, with good amenities in an easy to get around town location, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Clean, comfy, quiet and right in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: purplem80
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived, I knew I had made the right choice. The staff was friendly, the room was spacious and clean and the view of the city at night was amazing. The bed was comfortable and we heard no noise at all at night. The breakfast was very good and we liked being able to bring it back to the room for the kids, who wanted to sleep in. Great location within walking distance or a short bus/cab ride to anything you may have planned. We will definitely be back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: DOWNTOWNWALKER
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend in Chicago for a nephews graduation from Northwestern and we had family members in 5 rooms from Northeast, South and Southeast locations. What a friendly staff working here, always as helpful as could be. The hotel was booked solid for the weekend and the staff had no problems dealing with any thing. Great location as well to walk to attractions or to get the "L". Enjoyed the Breakfast every morning and the dinner one night. The rooms were well set up for gathering family in the evenings and there are plenty of stores nearby to pick up provisions if wanted and a full kitchen was nice. Would not hesitate to come again and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than this !!”
Reviews.Author: Richard3360
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, Weds thru Sunday morning.. the Staff was outstanding, couldn't have asked for anything better.. Quiet rooms..great food.. the dinner they serve from 5-7 Mon/Thu was great.. can't say enough about the breakfast buffet ! The location was great, just a couple blocks from Michigan Ave, and 1 block from the Red Line subway which we took to Wrigley Field.. Anything you needed or wanted the staff went over the top in providing.. We stay Hilton Hotels 99% of the time, and it's well worth the money, for the serviece and great ammenities.. R Pool... Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff and Free Food”
Reviews.Author: isabill
Reviews.Content: We booked based on Trip Advisor as well as price. When I made the reservation I asked for a quiet room away from the elevator and they indeed took care of this. Our view wasn't the best but the room was quiet. The staff is incredible. John and Starr at the reception/check-in (on the 6th floor) were fantastic and very helpful. The doormen were super friendly and also very helpful with directions and getting taxis. Connie in the breakfast room was fabulous as were the other people working there. When coffee or food ran out (get to b'fast early - the tourists are hungry!!), the staff would find us to let us know items were replenished, even going so far as to bring the fresh coffee or fresh breakfast items to our table. Having free breakfast (a pretty big selection at that) was great - it lasted us well into the afternoon by the time we were hungry again. During the weekdays, they offer a dinner buffet. It's not gourmet but it's fine a quick bite and it's part of the stay . I agree with other reviewers about the rooms, ours needed a little bit of TLC in some worn areas but overall our room was perfect for our needs. The only downside was there was one weekend afternoon that we came back from sightseeing all day, around 5 pm, and our room wasn't made up yet (the cart was doors away from our room). So we left for about an hour and a half, (which meant more shopping for our daughter, so she was happy!) and when we came back our room was completed. The location is perfect - we walked to/from many sites, incuding the Art Institute, the Magnificent Mile, John Hancock and the Sears (Willis) Tower, and Millenium Park. I definitely recommend this hotel, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: dutchhorse
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites is a suite-based hotel in a very old, rather dark building, which makes it all the more remarkable that the staff provided us with such a lovely stay. I cannot say enough about the staff - from the doormen to the cleaning personnel, they were warm and competent. The hotel is spotless, the breakfast was excellent, and coffee is available all day. The gym was small but well maintained and the pool very nice. The location is good as well. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to travelling families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean hotel, friendly service, and beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: MsJulicious
Reviews.Content: To everyone who wants a nice comfy stay in the heart of the city for a great price, stay here! This place kicks booty. Seriously! Definitely a must-stay if you want to stay in the heart of the city, soak in the great sites of Chicago, and save money on cab fare. First of all, our room wasn't ready and the concierge holds your things in a secured area the entire day and it only costs a mere tip for their services. So we arrived about 10 am, had them hold our things until we finally checked into our room about 10 pm. The next day, we checked out, but decided to stay in the city for some sightseeing. They came to our rescue by holding our things after we checked out until we were ready to leave the city about 9:30pm that day. I gave them $20 tip for their services. They definitely deserved it! All service was extremely friendly and accomodating, our room was nice and roomy (separate area for the living room/kitchen and bedroom/bathroom) and had a spectacular view of the city! In the morning, they have a free hot breakfast buffet. And if you want swimming with a view, the top floor has an indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: katluver_2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central to shopping, public transport, restaurants, and attractions. Room was quiet and comfortable. The fully equipped kitchen, complimentary breakfasts, and some dinners makes this a great place for family stays. Our room was comfortable. Front desk service was courteous and prompt. I especially appreciated Toni's patient answers to my questions for directions. Jonah's helpfulness and smiles were great ways to start our days. Decor colors could be a little more upbeat and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jim-Longmont
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites has a very convenient location. It was very clean and the beds were excellent. Excellent breakfast and very friendly staff. Free internet and nice pool. The sofa bed in a separate room worked well for us for a teenager. The room was very quiet with no hotel or outside noise. It is not the most modern hotel and the hallways were a little drab but all in all, this was a good choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “a brilliant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: fergus7edinburgh
Reviews.Content: We arrived well before check in time but were immediately allocated a room on the 17th floor which meant we could settle in then go for lunch. The suite was very spacious with bedroom, sitting room and kitchen and while the decor was a bit dated it was very clean and the bed turned out to be really comfortable. The room was at the end of a corridor and was very quiet for the duration of our 5 night stay. The only downside was the waiting time for the lift - particularly on the weekenf. We had breakfast each day which was good although again very busy on the weekend. The food was very good but we stuck to the continental breakfast options as the hot food was not aimed at european tastes. The hotel is in a great location and we were able to walk to all the places we wanted to see. There are a lot of good restaurants. nearby and we particularly liked Joes Seafood along the street from the hotel. Alll the staff we came in contact with were very friendly and only too willing to help with advice and directions. We would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: EamonnMc
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed for 2 nights in this hotel in Chicago. I cant compliment the staff enough, absolutely superb..... for the valet to the bellhop to the lady in reception, wonderful and friendly and more than helpful to us all on our first trip to Chicago. Room was perfect, food was really nice and accesible at any time. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Hotel is right at the centre of downtown Chicago ..... nearly all of the usual tourist sites within walking distance. Highly recommended and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good”
Reviews.Author: ta-user-2011
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times over several years and it's consistently good. The bell/valet staff is super-friendly and helpful, even though they're seemingly always busy! Our biggest concern with this hotel is the lack of elevators. There are only two public elevators and during peak periods the wait can get a bit long (though it always seems like forever it's probably only minutes). This is a very minor point but when you're waiting with an impatient toddler it can seem like forever. :-) Additionally, our room was warm but we were told that the AC couldn't be turned on because the overall hotel either provides heat or cool but not both and the outside air temp was less than the cut-off for AC (and yes, we had Engineering come to look at our room's HVAC unit). Luckily, they flipped the building-wide switch to allow us to turn on the AC before it got really hot outside, but it was noticeably cooler in the halls and a bit uncomfortable for sleeping before that. I might recommend changing that policy to allow people to turn AC on sooner... the rooms heat up quickly and accumulate heat from floors below. Our recent stay was on the 12th floor and our room was showing a few signs of age/heavy use with the carpet being a bit worn and frayed, so it might be getting near time to refresh some bits. The cleaning staff is great and the room looked and felt clean. We will definitely stay here again. None of the concerns in this review are big concerns and I would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! The staff is terrific! And the location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Lisadiva
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Homewood Suites. What a great place! Our room was clean and comfortable. And having a fridge allowed us to bring home our leftovers and enjoy them later. The included breakfast was very nice and plentiful. Great selection of hot and cold items. The location of the hotel is superb. Just one block from the red line and several bus stops. You can get anywhere with a CTA pass and a map. Or just walk. There is so much to see and do within a short walking distance from the hotel. But let me talk about the staff. WOW!!! What a great bunch of people. Always pleasant, smiling, and professional. We were offered suggestions, directions, and recommendations at all turns. You could not have asked for a nicer bunch of people. From the front door staff, to the check in staff, to the breakfast room staff. I will definitely stay here again the next time I make a visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Homewood, in a GREAT location with Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: travel4workAA
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for shopping and eating! The actual rooms were dated but clean with nice large windows. The workout room was big and with a great view, but the AC didnt work at the time. There is a small pool (indoor). Staff was wonderful all around. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great, just a few gripes; the good BY FAR outweighed the bad”
Reviews.Author: Luhrs02
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Jonah in Bell Service; very friendly, quick with our baggage, engaged our kids 2) Substantial breakfast 3) Kids loved the pool on the 19th floor 4) Location of hotel is PERFECT 5) Very close to red line station and to other bus stops on Michigan 6) Free wi-fi was easy to set up, worked flawlessly (a rare feat it seems these days!) Cons: 1) Timing of housekeeping staff 2) Temperature controls in room 3) Room could use a bit of TLC; peeling wallpaper, etc. 4) Pack N' Play was promised but not delivered 5) Valet parking $42./day with in-out privileges, but we literally never got the car out while we were were; there should be a lower price if you don't intend to use your car ** We have visited Chicago 5-6 times prior to this trip. This was the first trip with our two boys (ages almost 4, and almost 1). The hotel was perfect for them. They boys slept in the main room, in the pull-out couch and our Pack N' Play (we reserved one with the hotel, and the front desk person at check-in indicated it was or would be in the room, but it wasn't there; we had brought our own from home, because I kind of figured there would be a problem with this). The location was absolutely perfect for walking to most attractions, including Millenium Park, Navy Pier, shopping on Michigan Ave., etc. We took the #146 bus to Shedd Aquarium with ease. The pool is more than sufficient for splashing about with the boys. Not too big, but big enough. At its busiest, there were maybe 10-12 people in the pool, and it wasn't bad as everyone was courteous. If there had been more people, and/or the ones in the pool had been unruly, it would have been bad. But it wasn't. it was great! The breakfast was a very nice addition, allowed us to save time and money by eating at the hotel before venturing out each day. Plenty of seating, high chairs, variety of foods for both parents and adults, etc. ** When we arrived at check-in, the room was very warm, which was a surprise, as it was only about 50 degrees outside on May 27th. Jonah with Bell services noticed the temperature, checked the vent and indicated that they had had to switch back and forth between heat and AC because of the big temperature fluctuations. We tried a variety of combinations, between opening the windows, turning the AC on and off, etc., but couldn't get the temp quite right. Also, it was strange to me that the AC control was in the main room, and we'd have to "sneak" in there in the evening from the master bedroom, trying to adjust the controls while not waking up our kids. The issue with the portable crib wasn't a big deal, and I'm sure they'd have brought one if we'd reminded them, but since I specifically called to add same to our reservation, and then at check-in the staff reiterated that one would be in the room and wasn't, that was kind of annoying. We stayed 3 nights. On the first full day, after the first night, we returned from a day of sightseeing about 3:15pm and the room hadn't been cleaned. Not a big deal, but we put the kids down for a nap and about 4 housekeeping came knocking. We got fresh towels and asked if they could come back later, and that wasn't an option. The following full day, they came and cleaned between about 4:45-5:30pm, which I thought was pretty late, but it is a big hotel. Also not a huge deal, just struck me as a bit unusual. The room was cleaned very well when it was cleaned. The room itself was overall nice. Some peeling wallpaper and cracks. Just a bit unsightly, nothing more. The bedding was nice. The kitchen is well-appointed with some cookware, place settings for 4, etc. Enough that if you were inclined to save money by cooking some lunches and/or dinners, you certainly could do so. We even had a garbage disposal and dishwasher, along with two-burner stove, microwave and full-size refrigerator with freezer. ** Overall, we would definitely return, mainly because of the location, 2-room kid-friendly suites, friendly customer service, and free breakfast. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “great value!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowmoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May and the location was excellent! Less than 2 blocks from Red Line El train that we took from Midway airport to the hotel. Fare was only $2.25/pp. Across from Nordstrom and Michigan Avenue for lots of shopping. From there, a short bus ride or the El again to other sites. Shedd Aquarium is a must see! Our room was a king suite with kitchen. Could use updating but was functional for our family. The front desk was very responsive, especially Toni who gave us a late checkout on our last day. Thanks also to Jonah, the doorman who always had friendly tips and a big smile for my son. Complimentary breakfast each day helped keep costs down. Great stay for all of us in the Windy City! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: jsv888_11
Reviews.Content: The folks that run and work at this hotel are amazing. I stayed here with my husband and 1 year old son on a business trip. They serve free breakfast every morning. And not just packets of oatmeal, every morning they have eggs, potatoes, bacon, waffles, fruit, and more. They also serve dinner, although we ate out most nights. The service is really great too. They go out of their way to make you feel at home. The front desk, the doormen, the house staff, the breakfast attendants, each one took the time to learn our names and greet us every day. The rooms and amenities are just ok, they could use updating, but it's a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff, rooms”
Reviews.Author: wallian67
Reviews.Content: We arrive quite late, check in was easy and front desk clerks were all very friendly as well as helpful. We had a corner room over looking Grande Ave. it was fabulous. The room was not huge but house 3 people comfortably. The bed was comfortable and the pull out sleeper sofa was comfortable too. The locaton could not be beat. We were close to fine dining as well as casual dining. The grocery store is just 2 blocks away and it is close to public transport. The valet men were amazing! They knew us by our city! Acknowldeged us everytime we left and returned. Loaned us an umbrella and always greeted us with a smile. They even called for our cab at 5 am and then called our room to let us know the cab had arrived. The breakfast was excellent with a new variety of main dishes every morning. There was plenty to choose from and it was pretty tasty too. Homewood Suites is a great value! The service was more than what we expected. We would recommend this as the hotel to stay at if your are planning business or leizure trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location with family !!”
Reviews.Author: cartervio
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Homewood Suites. Traveled with our two young boys (10 & 12) to Chicago, their first time in the big city. It's Great Hotel great location, great staff and great dinner and breakfast. overall we love this place. it's good for stayed with your family

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mthowells
Reviews.Content: Great location ---very comfortable---delicious breakfast ---wine and dinner ------We plan to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: IWantAnotherVacation
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. The room was clean and had a nice set up. It has a nice kitchenette and seating area by the television. The separate bedroom had it's own TV. I thought the beds were uncomfortable, though, which is why I wouldn't stay there again. We were able to buy snacks in the lobby. The pool is very tiny (but, clean), but since our 2 ten year olds were the only ones in the pool, it was fine. It would have been a problem if it was crowded. Valet was very slow. I suggest self-parking. Also, we left our bags with the valet to bring up to our room. But after an hour, we walked downstairs and the bags were still exactly where we left them. We brought them up ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the Magnificent Mile!”
Reviews.Author: kellyttravels
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever written a review. I was so impressed with this hotel, I had to! The location is excellent. Just steps to the "Magnificent Mile". The service was exceptional! EVERYONE was friendly and helpful-no exceptions. They obviously haven't forgotten about customer service, like so many have. The rooms were very spacious, and clean. Even though we were in the heart of the city, it was quiet inside the room. The breakfast that was included in the room rate was not your standard continental breakfast. They had hot items too, which actually tasted good! The value for the room was very good (my only apprehension about writing this review is that if too many people write a good review, and business increases, the prices may too!). Thank you to Homewood Suites for a great stay! We WILL see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: pontiac_grandam
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton (May 5 â€“ May 7) and were pleasantly surprised with our room. I liked the layout of the rooms and furniture placement, the kitchen was stocked with everything we could possibly need and we were right downtown Chicago with views of skyscrapers. The staff was very friendly when we checked in and whenever we left/arrived at the hotel. The only complaints I can come up with is the incredibly stiff bed, breakfast had a lot of variety but the eggs, bacon and potatoes werenâ€™t that good, and the fact that they leave a sign saying if you want to reuse your towels hang them up which we did but Iâ€™m pretty sure we were given new ones anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, unreliable elevators”
Reviews.Author: emilyjemima
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service from Connie in the dinning room - thanks again, Emily 3yrs

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: sonny6s
Reviews.Content: Performed a training seminar at the hotel and the staff bent over backwards to meet any requirements requested. Even going to another hotel to get Fed-X shipping packages. Luis head of Cooking and Alredo,IT, were always asking if I needed anything. And providing what was needed.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5 saves money and gets spacious room”
Reviews.Author: wehave5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults, and 3 teens stayed here for a week at the end of April. We paid $199 per night for the first 5 nights, and $279 for the last 2 nights. By my calculations we still saved money (there are hotels that sleep 5 to a room for less per night) because of the buffet breakfast every morning and the evening buffet Mon thru Thurs. Breakfasts had scrambled cheesy eggs every day, and some mornings included french toast & bacon, or potatoes, biscuits & gravy. There were always two or three kinds of fruit, oatmeal packets, 3 cereals including fruit loops, breads like bagels or muffins, yogurt, cottage cheese, juices, tea, coffee. The weekday M-Th dinners included a main dish like meatballs, hotdogs, brisket, or baked potato with toppings. Sides varied with combos of mac n cheese, soup, chips and salsa, macaroni salad, potato salad, green salad, green beans, broccoli, mashed potatoes, and more. I thought the weekday meal would be minimal, but it included so many choices and you could return and get more from the nicely organized buffet. Evening beverages included serve yourself wine carafes and beer. At busy times, you wait at the entry and a staff person seats you. At other times, you seat yourself. We only had to wait for a table once and only for a few minutes. It is a large carpeted room with nice, substantial upholstered chairs and plenty of tables that seat 2-6. Let me tell you, with 5 of us, even with 3 of us on the small side (me, plus my youngest who are 7th grade twin boys) every meal at a restaurant was about $100, so these meals saved us a lot. Our room faced the back, looking over roofs, but with views of skyscrapers beyond. We had no problem with too much traffic noise, even with open windows - so glad for the fresh air. There is always a bit of noise in a huge city - to be expected. The bedroom had a window, two double beds, a tv set on a chest of drawers, a full size closet, and a wide-counter sink with mirror and the entry to the super spacious bathroom. The living area, separated from the bedroom with a door you could close, had another window and another flat screen tv, a double-size sleeper sofa and upholstered chair, a small table with two wood chairs, and a kitchen stocked with 4 serving sets (haha! good thing all 5 of us didn't eat all at once). It was great to bring back leftovers from our restaurant meals, store them in the fridge, and buy extra groceries, and eat them for lunch or our Friday night dinner before departing the next day. More savings! Coffee and tea are provided with a coffee maker in the room, too. Pros: LOCATION! Set just 2 blocks from the red line which we rode multiple times each day, and Michigan Ave. with its bus lines and things to do. Close by is also Pizzeria Uno and Big Bowl thai/chinese and Weber Grill and we enjoyed all these restaurants. SERVICE and CLEANLINESS: The staff are wonderful, friendly, and the room, lobby, buffet, pool, were always so clean. POOL - my kids swam twice and said the water could be just a tad warmer, but the warmth of the room helped. Cons: The sofa sleeper mattress was thin and felt wiry. And, there was a door to the next room, so someone could have adjoining rooms. It was safely bolted, however we could easily hear all the neighbors' voices which was a little distracting. We would be watching tv and it sounded like we had guests. I couldn't always hear the actual words they were saying, and thankfully this only happened 2 of the nights so either just those people were louder or the other 5 nights the room was empty. Also, thankfully, all was quiet after 10pm. And, there is no fan in the bathroom. The room's spaciousness meant the good distance from the bathroom door to the bed, where someone might be reading or watching tv, helped, but we made sure to have the tv on if someone was *ahem* using the bathroom, in order to minimize embarrassment. We used two laptops with the free wireless connection. It was slower in the evening when I suppose so many guests were online at once. One of our computers performed better than the other with the connection. The business center, with free printing of our boarding passes, was great. All in all, a very satisfying, comfortable stay and it was even better than I'd hoped. We would definitely recommend Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: CMonkey33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on spring break with my nieces, 12 & 8. The doormen were great and very helpful. We arrived early and our room was not ready. They stored our luggage for us so we could begin our vacation. The rooms were large with a nice sitting area and full kitchen. They were clean and comfortable. The bus stops and subway were right around the corner. Because of the great location, you could walk quickly to Magnificent Mile. The breakfast was wonderful and full of different choices. Each night they provided a different type of meal for dinner. It was more than enough food and good choices for meals. We loved the pool area which overlooked the city. It was nice at night. We will certainly return on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: KateJD
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Homewood Suites for our Spring Break trip to Chicago. I chose it based on Trip Advisor reviews and I found that they were accurate in their descriptions, so I hope to add some useful information for others. The rooms were clean and quiet, the breakfast was substantial, the indoor pool was a very good diversion for cold and rainy days, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The only quibble we had was that we could not use our iPad in the room; it requires Wi-Fi and our connection kept dropping off and there was no way we could send e-mail or download anything. This was frustrating, but would have been more so if we had been there on business travel. All in all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with Internet Connectivity”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: Although the service at the Homewood Suites Chicago Downtown is generally quite good, we had two major problems during my stay that contributed to my giving this hotel an average rating. I had significant problems with Internet connectivity. The hotel staff moved us to another room, which helped a bit, but which did not resolve our Internet problems. I stay in many hotels and would rank our experience with the Internet here in the bottom 10% of all hotels. I also did not particularly like the room configuration of either room. The Homewood Suites has two room suites. In both rooms that we were given, the bathroom was located off the bedroom with the sink area in the bedroom itself separated from the toilet and bath by a door. This meant that I woke up from the sound of running water every time my traveling companion used the bathroom at night. The Homewood Suites offers free breakfast and an evening meal, which my traveling companion enjoyed. I did not like either very much and did not believe that the meals were very healthy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: socalsue
Reviews.Content: My older daughter and myself traveled to first time Chi Town on Spring Break. It happen our Baseball team was in town too! What a thrill to attend the game at Wrigley field. The Hotel room very comfortable. I requested a quiet room (1801). It was great and a great view of downtown skyline. Nightly "light dinner" was far from light! Very good and filling,including beer and wine. Breakfast excellent. Both meals changed everyday. Very friendly staff. Just one very tiny problem with Room Service hotel/ restaurant fee. It was solved. A block away from Mag Mile. Nordstrom to TJ Maxx in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “go for it....worth for money”
Reviews.Author: kay-nat
Reviews.Content: really love this place we enjoy this hotel during our trip in USA -good location, near shopping center, magnificent miles, restaurants around. -front desk+staff -room +breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a tourist and super value for a family.”
Reviews.Author: SDPadres
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites Tuesday April 5- Sat. April 9 2011 We were able to secure a great AAA rate.(135) Location is perfect. We flew into Midway and took public transportation into downtown. Very easy and cheap. Checked in early as we had e-checked in the night before. Picked a corner room away from the elevators. The first few days we were in the hotel it was sold out and there were quite a few families with young children. It wasn't a problem for us. Any over flow was taken care of quickly at breakfast and elevator waits were minimal due to management allowing folks to use the freight elevator. As for previous posters who bemoaned the "running out of food", the only thing that ran out during our visit was the waffle mix on Wed. (Waffles are every other day) Guests seem to think it's ok for each of their children (regardless of the age) to make a waffle and then eat a bite and not eat the rest. The waste was amazing. We saw people take BOWLS of sausage. This is certainly not managements fault. Later in the week there were sport teams in the hotel and nothing ran out. I noticed people coming down after breakfast hours and still being allowed to sit and eat and everyone was gracious about it. For a tourist the location is great. We were close to the red line and numerous bus lines, and walking distance to many, many sights. And with a teenage daughter how perfect to hit the stores each evening. We didn't walk a lot as the weather was gloomy and got to know public transportation quite well. The front desk folks were able to get us to the correct buses, find me enjoyable jogging paths, and direct us to short cuts over to Michigan Ave. The employees were fantastic. I have to say EVERYONE we encountered in Chicago was so pleasant, and helpful. Kudo's to the City of Chicago. The evening snacks vary and can be dinner depending on your likes. We didn't have "dinner" but did stop in one night and had some food before we headed out to the Art Museum. Our room was clean, clean, clean. We had a problem with one TV and it was fixed within hours. The housekeeping staff were pleasant and after asking just once for extra conditioner (a couple of long hair girls) they always provided a few extra each day. The only thing missing for us was an in room safe. We travel often with a lap top and would have to deal with it. The wireless was strong and complimentary. The workout room had just 3 pieces of equipment but only one or 2 folks were using it at any given time. The pool was quite busy but no noise traveled out of the pool area. Would I recommend this hotel. YES ( well if you are a couple you might want to find another hotel with breakfast if you are trying to "get away" from your own kids.) But even with all the families it was not a mad house in any capacity. The kids were very well behaved and having a great time. So families this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Still Returning”
Reviews.Author: Canton,MI
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times since our first stay during its construction. We still are returning to this fantastic hotel and recommending it to our friends for many reasons. 1. Location: Right off the Mag Mile, short walk to Watertower Place, 1 mi straight down Grand to Navy Pier, short walk to the theater district. This time we took the 151 bus from in front of the Amtrak station at Union Station right to Ohio & Mich Ave (2 short blocks from the hotel). We also took the Red line 1 block from the hotel right to Wrigley Field. (Addison stops 1 block from the stadium) There is a large Jewel/Osco store 1 block away. You are in the middle of many wonderful restaurants and 1 block from the ESPN Zone. 2. Value: Beautiful, full breakfast every morning with long hours. We were served several types of fresh fruit, cereals, yogurt, coffee/teas, milk, juices, breakfast meat, scrambled eggs, 2 kinds of potates, and waffles or french toast. Great variety and quality of food. On Sun-Thurs nights they serve a buffet dinner where we found plenty to fill us up. The main dishes for the 3 nights we stayed were, stuffed green peppers, beef pepper steak, and chicken cacciatore. The sides were a soup, bread, a hot vegetable, 3 salads, and rice or pasta. Drinks were ice tea, water, lemonade, beer and wine. The desserts were cake, cookies and brownies (1 dessert/night). There were hot drinks available all day long which were a big help since Chicago was showing her rainy and cold side during our visit. 3. Rooms: We stayed in the King suite with a pull-out couch, 2 flat-screened TV's, full kitchen and large bath. Very nice sitting area. In the past we have stayed in the larger rooms with 2 beds with a pull-out couch. We have also made use of the cots they have available. The bedding was very nice on the King and the bed extremely comfortable. All this makes the Homewood Suites very comfortable for those of us traveling with kids. Our room was very quiet and was ready for us even though we arrived shortly after noon. 4. Staff: Very friendly, helpful desk personnel who made an effort to have our rooms next to each other without us asking. Doormen were very personable and welcoming. The maids also went out of their way to help us with small issues that arose. The dining personnel were particularly helpful and attentive. Everyone had a smile and made us feel welcome. 5. Pool: One of the few hotels in Chicago with a pool and this one is on the top floor with magnificent views of the city. Those with kids know the importance of having a pool. 6. Business Center: We did not bring a computer, so having 3 computers with a printer for our use 24 hours a day helped us keep in contact with work and friends while away. We also were able to use them for travel plans and maps since we don't have a smart phone. There is free internet (wired and wireless) access throughout the hotel and rooms. We visit Chicago regularly and have stayed at several of the hotels, but we still return to the Homewood Suites for all of the above reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Two for two, even more outstanding the second time”
Reviews.Author: hamptondragon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here once last year for a meeting and since it is family friendly I brought mine with me. Liked it so much that we came back for a leisure visit during spring break. As with all Homewood Suites, the free dinner M-Th and free breakfast each day saved a lot of $$. The parking fee is a downer, but such is life in downtown Chicago (too bad they can't waive it for reward stays, wish they would). We were on the 19th floor and had a great downtown view. The food is good and priced right, the suite was clean, spacious, and the hotel is very family friendly. I LOVE the fact they let one take extra food back to one's room, even have containers with which to do so. Some hotels whine about taking extra food away (may feel it drives up costs) but that is one thing that gets our business--we can take some food and eat it for lunch later in the day at one of the many sites in Chicago, which is exactly what we did. Business center is OK (though had an issue with reading one of the programs I needed), fitness center is great (and for the workout gurus one gets free access to the Conrad fitness center across the street which is even better). The pool is very nice, esp being on the top floor. With such a large hotel it is crowded every night, but that is OK. My young kids liked playing with the other young kids in the pool. The staff are friendly. The walls are thick and guests don't disturb each other even if some guests are loud. Couple of minor issues--there is no hot tub, that is a bummer. Rooms do not have direct thermostats, only temperature regulators where one can only set a few values. It was March in Chicago (i.e. still cold) but our room was so hot that we still had to open the windows to cool off. That worked OK, but at other times in the year that could be an issue. Elevators (only two of them for 14 floors including the ground floor) can be a bit of a wait, but not usually too bad. These are minor issues. This hotel is outstanding and we will be back, with our large family and still have a lot of space.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mturner85
Reviews.Content: Traveled with our two young boys (10 & 12) to Chicago, their first time in the big city. This hotel has a great location, one block from Michigan Ave. and onle block from the Grand St. EL station. The price is reasonable, the suites were large enough for two adults and two kids. It was also nice to have a kitchenette in the suite although we really didn't need it because there are two many great places to eat in Chicago. One deciding factor for us was the hot breakfast served every morning adjacent to the lobby. It was very nice with a good selection of food, not just your basic continental breakfast. They also have a hot dinner on Monday - Thursday but it didn't impress us. Hard to stay in for dinner though as I mentioned earlier. The pool on the top floor was nice and it had a great view of the city. I also used the work out facility each morning, its small but functional if there's not more than 3 people working out. This hotel oddly does not have a lobby on the 1st floor, there is a bellman station and the elevators. The lobby is actually on the 6th floor. All in all, this was a nice place to stay with plenty of room to stretch out for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience-rooms, staff, and amenities--and good value!”
Reviews.Author: vjgriff
Reviews.Content: We are a group of five friends who booked two adjacent rooms for a long weekend. The rooms were immaculate, roomy, well-appointed (great pillows), and well-furnished. Our rooms were both right across from the elevators but we never heard them. The breakfasts and Mon-Thurs light suppers were excellent and the bell staff, wait staff, housekeeping staff were all extremely efficient and pleasant. The location is close to everything on North Michigan (it's right across from Nordstrom's) and the Art Institute and Millenium Park are walkable in good weather. And now for the tale of what made this hotel truly outstanding. My room was right across from the elevator, so after shopping and before meeting everyone else for lunch, I rushed back to the hotel to drop off two shopping bags. I got off the elevator and the door to my room was open for housekeeping, so I reached in and put the bags on the table, telling the housekeeper,"I'm just going to drop these off." Then I left to join my friends for lunch. When we all returned to our rooms, the bags were missing. The manager was immediately responsive and within only a few minutes he had begun an in-house investigation, offered to make right all losses, and had talked with the head of housekeeping, the housekeeper for our room, and all of us. This was done in the most positive, professional, and pleasant way and we all felt as if--whatever the outcome--things were going to be ok. And they were. Because I had started talking to a fellow elevator passenger, ridden PAST my 11th floor room, and gotten off on the 19th floor. The room in which I left my shopping bags was indeed the room across from the elevator--just on the wrong floor. The housekeeper who had been cleaning the 19th floor room had turned in the bags and they were returned to me later in the day. Whew and oh, gosh, was I embarrassed. The calm positive reactions of everyone at the hotel and the quick supportive responses of everyone involved exhibited a level of professionalism and efficiency that can be hard to find. It's a great place, I will stay there again (as will my friends), and I will be sure to doublecheck the room numbers when I get off the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: MPfromCleveland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites for 4 nights and overall it was a pleasant experience. We reached there after a six-hour drive, and chose both the valet parking and luggage service options (it was a bit confusing how the parking worked as there was no direction posted at the front entrance. Turned out the lot the hotel uses is around the corner across the intersection). Throughout our stay, we found the entire staff (valet, bell service, food service, reception) very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was great, but the dinner was so-so (would have liked to see more choices for kids - my 9 year old boy would have liked mac-and-cheese), but can't complain since it was complimentary (and they do seem to have different items each day - we were there only for two nights for dinner). When we got back from sight-seeing the first day, our room was not serviced so I had to call the front desk. But from next day onwards I would let them know when we left in the morning, so the room would be all clean by the time we returned in the afternoon or evening. We had our suite on the 19th floor, with really nice views of the downtown! (Sometimes wait for elevator was too long, and almost always it stops at every floor which was a minor annoyance since we were on the 19th floor). If I have one complaint, it is the $42 per day parking fee, which looks rather steep!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was at the Hometown Buffet on BBQ night special”
Reviews.Author: msa23_2000
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business and picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews of location, free breakfast and free dinner. I was completely unprepared for the amount of families with lots of kids. Breakfast and dinner were a nightmare - you had to fight to belly up to the meager buffet. There were kids everywhere - which to many is not a big deal, but I was travelling on business so this was unexpected. The location is great. The beds are comfortable, but the price is very expensive for the area (unless of course you are cramming a family of 8 into one room).

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST TRIP THAT I HAVE BEEN ONJ”
Reviews.Author: newone_258
Reviews.Content: As soon as you find the place (Chicago is a very busy city) with not being around there. It all started with a great big smile from Steve the high class doorman. He took care of very thing in the lower level. He was very very informative on anything that I had asked. Went up to 6 floor to check in, again greeted with a BIG smile form Jennifer. She also was able to tell me anything that I asked her, plus give me some good ideas for my kid with 2 adults and 3 kids ages 3,(girl) and two @ 10(boys at that)J. Rooms were GREAT just the right size for us. The kitchen big plus. The boys LOVED the pool on the 19th floor over looking the city with all the lightsJ My daughter and I enjoyed it also. The free welcome dinner from Monday-Thursday was great save a lot of money with that. The breakfast was great also, except one morning we came down with an hour left of breakfast, and they were out of a lot of stuff I mean a lot. I donâ€™t know if they were short staff to refill things. I can understand running out of waffle batter I guess, but cereal, mike, sausage, bread were all gone. I know they would fill it soon so I waited, waited and waited now I have 2 really hungry boys and a crabby 3 year old. So, of course now Im mad walking out. The manager of the eating area notice I was not happy and started talking to me and he was very apologetic. I mean he was very sincere about it too. He told me he would be right back and came back told me the room for that night is on the house.. WOW I couldnâ€™t believe it. That was the furthest from my mind. I was taking his apologue and moving on. I just got to say WOW. This hotel wants you to be very comfortable and happy at all cost. Ive never been to a hotel like this. I thank everyone there for making our trip the greatest everJ ps: if your kids want to go to legoland DONâ€™T go waste of time and money really. Legocity across from hotel is much better and it free. Legoland cost for the 5 of us $86.00 and the kids were ready to leave in about 25/30 topsâ€¦L

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding group service”
Reviews.Author: Dr_PRprof
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the windy city with 16 students...needless to say, trying to keep it affordable is always a challenge. Homewood Suites was outstanding. The personal attention to our group was admirable. Our rate was reasonable, especially since our stay included free wireless and a full breakfast. We will be sure to stay here again on a future trips-with or without the students!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, good staff and location”
Reviews.Author: fearagones
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel great location, great staff and great dinner and breakfast. Luvina from the front desk were so nice with us and Sergio from the restaurant too... everybody were very nice and friendly, clean, the bell boys did something that i've never seem in my life we change the room and we were not there at that moment and they put the things exactly on the same place and the same way as before like same position, even the messy thing was messy in the same place the same way i was impressed! I really recommend this hotel, you can do everything walking from there. The room was so big and clean.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: necifl
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a nicer hotel nor more convenient one. The whole staff was very friendly and very helpful, especially when trying to figure out the train system. The breakfast each morning had a very good selection. We were welcomed back every time we came back into the hotel. It also was very convenient to the train system, only 2 blocks away, and to Michigan Avenue, also 2 blocks. The rooms were very spacious and very nice. We would definitely return and would recommend to anyone going to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and stay!”
Reviews.Author: dsbeck
Reviews.Content: My mom, teenaged daughters and nieces stayed for two nights over the weekend. Great location! They were able to wander, walk and shop on Michigan Ave. Across the street from PF Changs - one of our favorite restaurants and down the block from one of our new favs - Weber Grill. Everyone in the hotel was friendly and VERY helpful. The valet Jonny was very nice! Breakfast was yummy and though busy - they kept everything well stocked and fresh until last minute. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room/Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Couscous4
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel! The suite was very spacious. Our 11 year old son was thrilled to have the pull out and his own TV at bed time. The kitchen was handy - I was icing an injured tendon, and it was great to have a real freezer with room for an ice pack. We used the kitchen a little for cooling drinks and reheating Chicago style pizza. The room was very clean and comfortable. The pool, gym, lobby, and common areas were very clean as well. We made use of the pool and gym, and we ate 2 free breakfasts and 2 free dinners in the lounge area. The breakfast was excellent the first day. The next day it was almost as good, and still better by far than most other free breakfast buffets. The dinners were good, especially for free meals. My husband is convinced that the free beer is a low alcohol version, because he drank a few and felt absolutely nothing. I tried it, and I believe it's real beer, but that the glasses are deceptively small. I wonder which of us is correct? Best of all...LOCATION! It only took a few minutes to walk to Michigan Avenue and Water Tower Place. Nave Pier was a little farther, maybe 10-15 minutes. The Chicago Art Institute was a 15-20 minute walk , including a stop at one of the many Starbucks along the way. Special thanks to Starr, the desk clerk who was on duty during a lot of our stay. She was so friendly and helpful! She gave great directions, and answered all of our questions. She was extremely pleasant, and gave us useful tips about public transportation. The hotel was a little pricey, but when we factored in the free meals and money we saved by walking to local attractions, the price wasn't prohibitive.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: chicagonative8
Reviews.Content: We stay here whenever we come to Chicago. We started coming because our favorite hotel was booked about eight years ago. Now it is our onlyh choice, be it business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: eiznof
Reviews.Content: I bring a high school team to Chicago for spring break each year. We stay at this location. They are always very wonderful to our players and parents. The location is perfect and we keep coming back, year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: pixie60
Reviews.Content: My 3 sisters and I spent 6 days on a Chicago spring vacation. We were all very happy with the accommodations. The employees were so friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Best ever. I was especially impressed with Connie in the Dining Room. She was friendly and made us feel at home, great at her job. You are lucky to have her as an employee. Having two meals most days was a plus and added to the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Mediocre Bed”
Reviews.Author: Wordrioter
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Hampton on Illinois St. but tried the Homewood Suites for a change. We'd rate the Homewood Suites higher in food variety and quality, and for having a full kitchen. Also the evening meals Mon-Thur are good enough if you are trying to economize a bit by staying away from high-priced restaurants. Service is excellent at both places, but the nod goes to the Homewood Suites for the welcoming and cheerful presence of Connie Wilson at breakfast. She obviously loves her job and greeted us daily with a genuine smile and dedicated service. Minor inconvenience with the free wifi internet. Kept losing it and having to reconnect. The only major downfall of the Homewood Suites was the bed itself - room 903, was very uncomfortable. Maybe it's time for some new ones for them. It was hard and bounced around whenever one of us turned over in bed. Not a restful night's sleep was had any of the 4 nights we were there. I am spoiled though - have a Tempurpedic mattress at home. Good place to eat nearby is Nordstrom's Cafe - right across the street. Also, Rock Bottom Grill just a block away by the Red Line Grand and State "L" stop. .

Reviews.Title: “great service, great price, kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: milotrigger
Reviews.Content: this is the spot if you travel with family. great service, reasonable prices, free food, nice views....

Reviews.Title: “The amenities and staff are top notch”
Reviews.Author: nprzybelski
Reviews.Content: All of the staff members were genuinely courteous and helpful. The suite was very comfortable, spacious and well cared for. Location perfect to get anywhere both walking and by cab. Connie Wilson is the absolute best waitress. She makes sure everyone has what they need almost before they realize the need. It was so nice to start the day being greeted and cared for by cheerful Connie. I was staying in a suite with three sisters. It would have been nice to have had a mirror in the main living room, kitchen and entrance area.

Reviews.Title: “really happy with our experience here”
Reviews.Author: rose_nostalgia
Reviews.Content: stayed here for several days during a conference with my now-husband... whilst the hotel might not look that impressive as you go out of the taxi, there was plenty i liked about it. it was cozy, and despite having a large number of guests, the staff are always helpful and friendly (no frazzled faces whilst we were there!). the rooms themselves are indeed homely, clean and large, and i found it particularly helpful that there were laundry facilities within the hotel that were easy to use. breakfasts were delicious, and i always appreciated being able to make a hot chocolate and bring it up to my room any time of day. the location is fantastic, being in close proximity to the magnificent mile and several great restaurants (we tried lawrys and a crab place just around the corner..? forgot the name now). the doormen were always friendly and had a smile despite the freezing temperatures, poor things. will be staying here again for future conferences in chicago!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: mikenalice86
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the this location weekly since December 2010 and I would just like to thank you. Everything is always wonderful and your staff is outstanding. Connie and Amer in particular. Connie is so pleasant and helpful. She knows what her guests want and makes sure they get it. She never fails to greet me by name and somehow always manages to see me come in even if I don't see her because my coffee is always waiting for me when I get back to my table. Amer is also wonderful. He is always there to help with what ever is needed. He knows about what time I leave for work every morning and if possible he has a cab waiting for me. He is very thoughtful and dependable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MAMABEAR47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in early March while in town for a Bon Jovi concert. We had no complaints whatsoever! The rooms, staff and location are all wonderful. Had a great breakfast each day. Didn't get a chance to take advantage of evening meal every night but one night we did have was great also. Pool was awesome and beautiful overlooking the city. Our room was wonderful and also had great views. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The location of this hotel is perfect for sightseeing. We would just walk a couple blocks and catch a trolley for sightseeing. Within walking distance of great places to eat for all budgets, drugstores and whatever else you would need. This would be the only place we would stay if we get the chance to come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Oasis in the Concrete Jungle”
Reviews.Author: AnotherNiteOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: I rarely write a review on a hotel - well, other than my personal hotel blog. But the Homewood Suites in Downtown Chicago was such a pleasant stay that I decided to make this one my first official TripAdvisor review. I was in town (my first time to Chicago) for a conference and chose the hotel mostly because I could cut my business cost with the complimentary breakfast. I was also pleasantly surprised to find the hotel also had a dinner as well! The breakfasts, while quite crowded were well staffed and very well prepared. We especially enjoyed visiting with the always cheerful and helpful Connie each morning. From start to finish I was pleased with this stay. The front desk clerks were just delightful (Starr was wonderful!) and extremely helpful. If I had to register one less than perfect aspect of our stay it would be with the strange occurrence each evening on our wireless internet. It kept kicking us off and asking us to sign in with the Hilton Garden Inn. Of course we couldn't sign in at that hotel, so we had to keep logging in and out until it recognized us at the Homewood Suites. Inconvenient, but not a real problem. We slept well, we dined well, and we will chose this hotel again if we return to the Windy City!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyknapp
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean, large suite (much larger than Embassy Suites), great location, wonderful staff, and a very good price (much cheaper than Embassy Suites). I'll return to this hotel every time I travel to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Totally blown away by the service.”
Reviews.Author: a2veeness
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with every single person on the staff of this hotel. From the gentleman who brought us menus, an extra chair, etc etc to the courtly and charming doormen, Steve and Abdoul who deserve special mention for their many kindnesses and courtesies this past weekend. It was ladies weekend in Chicago and after a previous stay at a different hotel we will definitely make the Homewood Suites our go-to hotel for future visits. The room itself was comfortable if consistently too warm despite having turned the heat off. It is also true that the weather was very mild, so an open window solved most of that problem. We enjoyed the hot breakfast buffet both Saturday and Sunday--nothing special but a good way to start the day in a rather expensive city. They had several fruit options both times, another plus. Bathroom toiletries were Neutrogena, and there was a sufficient supply for three women. A block or two from pretty much everything you might want to do, see, eat or shop. And we had an extra treat--the Florida State team was staying one block over, and we got to see them get on the bus for their Saturday game! Loved the staff, from the front desk to the valet attendants--we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: gslaughter
Reviews.Content: Last year some friends and I had a Chicago weekend and stayed at the Embassy Suites. Nice enough....pricey. This year, we decided to go again, and I found the Homewood Suites on TripAdvisor. The staff was fabulous, very friendly and helpful (especially Steve and Abduo, the valet guys). The room was larger than the one we had stayed in at the Embassy Suites. It was clean and well supplied with a kitchenette. The location was perfect, right downtown... walking distance from just about anything. Breakfast was great each morning. And, our weekend stay was about $300 less for a 2 night stay than at the Embassy. We know where we'll be staying next year.

Reviews.Title: “I can not wait to spend more time at Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: TwoforDinner
Reviews.Content: I have never visited Chicago before and had no idea where to stay. I got on my favorite travel site and found Homewood Suites. I read some nice reviews and saw some nice pics, but you can never be too sure. I am more than pleased with the choice staying at Homewood Suites. Lets start with the All-Star staff working the front door. These guys rock, if you want to know about the city just ask, if you need something just ask, they remember who you are and always make you feel welcome. Now lets move to the 6th floor where the lobby is....Great staff, super friendly, very very clean, nicely laided out room. right next to the lobby is the breakFEAST room. They guys know to lay a spread out every morning. They even do dinner Monday thru Thurs. Now the room, its a great suite, not overly large but large enough to have other people stay over. Great kitchen with everything you need to cook if you want (side note....Dont cook in the room there are so many resturant option all around the hotel) . I guess the only thing I can say is that the bathroom is kinda small but the tub and shower is a very nice size so I guess it all works. I loved the bed and sheets, very soft and comfy. Over all I love this place, I can not wait to spend more in my new favorite city of Chicago and stay at my HOME away from HOME at Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: rtann2
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed 2 nights at this hotel with 3 young children under the age of 4. A lot of families were there that weekend. Hotel was still very quiet, great getting kids down for a nap. Kitchenette was perfect. Full size fridge, microwave, DW and cook-top came in handy for feeding kids. Complimentary breakfast was very good and if you wanted you could get to go boxes and bring it to your room. Rooms weren't 4 star but were very clean. Pull out bed good for kids, but not comfortable for adults! All the staff were very helpful. Great location for shopping. Parking is $ but that is normal in downtown Chicago. Self park garage nxt to hotel is $38 a night. Valet is $42 but they look for tips every time they get your car. Overall a great hotel to stay at with kids but if you want a four star for a weekend away from the kids look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Special thanks to toni”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveller97
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend travel a lot and have spent nights at numerous hotels around the world but none have left an impression like this one. It was absolutely wonderful! The rooms were fantastic, the location was amazing and the best part of it all was the entire staff was so friendly and welcoming I would visit Chicago just to stay here again. I would like to thank Toni who works at reception for making our visit even more enjoyable. She helped us out tremendously and we can't thank her enough for making our trip that much better. I would recommend this hotel to any one who is visiting Chicago as it just perfect. Thanks again Toni from reception!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: SugarNomad
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the quality of the stay for the reasonable price. The rooms were clean, sizable (suite), comfortable. The kitchen was well equipped. The breakfast was very good (hot eggs (though not cooked to order), all the toast and cereal options, fruit, yogurt, etc., etc. We were able to walk up the Magnificent mile, over to the Navy Pier, down into the loop for an architectural tour, and to two fine restaurants for dinners. Not luxurious, but very nice and a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great experience”
Reviews.Author: kariejeanne
Reviews.Content: My family visits Chicago at least three times per year, and usually books via priceline or hotwire. I'm a girl who is used to getting a four star hotel for great price. This last trip to Chicago, I reserved a room at Homewood through their website, because I wanted to be sure of our location and a spacious room. We were babysitting our 15 month old niece for a night and I wanted to make sure it would be a pleasant experience. I contacted the manager with lots of questions about location and the rooms. He was great. He put up with numerous emails from me, got all of our party rooms on the same floor, etc. The rooms are spacious and clean. the kids loved the pool and the breakfast was amazing. The full kitchen was great w/ the kids. I was thrilled with everything. My favorite thing about this hotel (aside from the great location) were the valets and front desk staff. The staff here really sets the standard for great customer service in chicago. Everyone was friendly, outgoing, and helpful. I think sometimes at big city hotels you get snooty service and everyone here was very down to earth, but still professional. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff couldn't have been more helpful.”
Reviews.Author: tgoldenhersh
Reviews.Content: Everyone was there to make our stay perfect. Connie in the breakfast room is a treasure and Steve downstairs at the front door is a marvel.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations, as well as the staff, are excellent qnd a good value”
Reviews.Author: hoosierhoover
Reviews.Content: Every time we come to Chicago now, we stay at Homewood Suites. It is such a value for your money. A special shout out for Connie, who always remembers us, and is very kind and accommodating. Also one for Jonah, who always greets us when we arrive. We have stayed at lots of other hotels in Chicago and true there are fancier ones but Homewood Suites is like coming "home". The location is also perfect. I can walk just about anywhere I need or want to go. I love the little kitchen--not that I am going to cook--but it is nice to have a refrigerator for leftovers or a snack. I also like the two TV's as my husband is always watching a basketball game or other sports event and I can watch a movie or whatever I want on the other TV. Thanks for such a great 4 days!! We are coming back next month to stay and go to a Hawks game.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile and Kindness”
Reviews.Author: celiasnodgrass
Reviews.Content: Connie works in the food service and is the best! She is curtious and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: 70toes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have different views of this hotel, so I'll try to list everything fairly, starting with the negative elements so I can move on to the good stuff. :) The walls were really thin. When I woke up at 3am to use the bathroom I could hear the elevators outside and I could actually hear the person above me relieving himself. Awkward. I would suggest requesting a room away from the elevators. The building was obviously dated, judging by the faucet and other fixtures in the bathroom being very loose and/or coming out of the wall and the style and condition of the furniture. It has central air, which was great, but if you're used to sleeping with a fan at night bring one with you. There is no in-room safe and no mini-bar. HOWEVER, the location was amazing. Right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile. It was wonderful to go out to dinner and shopping then walk right back to our hotel. There was security at the door which made us feel good. Inside, the staff was so friendly. We were on the 11th floor and the view was amazing. The room had a separate living space/kitchen from the bedroom which was lovely and great for families. We didn't use the full kitchen, but plan to when we go back with our kids. There was a flat screen TV in each room and big, picture windows so we had a great view of the city. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The bedding was much MUCH softer than your average hotel bedding. I was impressed with that. The breakfast the next morning was very good, for hotel food. All in all, our stay was great and we'll definitely stay here again and recommend to friends. If you stay here (And even if you don't), check out Joe's Seafood on the corner. One of the top rated restaurants in Chicago and the food is to die for! Just make sure you make a reservation! Back to Homewood, especially for the price, it is a great place to stay and I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great family spot”
Reviews.Author: kttjhn
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly staff. Pool was great! Good value. Only complaint was that morning coffee wasn't hot

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: trishthorski81
Reviews.Content: great place and location ...beyond friendly!location location location best ever

Reviews.Title: “Gymnastics event in Chicago at Navy Pier - Hotel was perfect for event”
Reviews.Author: nicky083
Reviews.Content: The location was of the hotel was great!! I loved that the shopping was in walking distance and that we were right across the street from the Marriott where the girls party was taking place. The breakfast buffet was good and I liked the variety of food that was available. The staff was very friendly and easy to work with. I would definitely arrange for our gymnasts and families to stay at this hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: maggel
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago for the Largest Gymnastics Meet in North America. Our club stayed at the Homewood suites hotel. The stay was fantastic. The hotel staff was very accomodating to a group of folks with kids. From setting up our own web site in order to get everyone registered to a breakfest buffet before the meet. The rooms were spacious, beds were comfortable and the kitchen was a bonus! We were close to Navy pier and convient by taxi. NO HASSLES! I want to thanks Vanessa and Jennifer for their hospitality and friendliness. Would definately recommend this hotel 4 stars, for anyone traveling to Chicago with kids. Great job ladies!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Staples70
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for price and location, but got so much more! Location is Wonderful, Shopping Resurtants, wow. Price, great for a suite with full kitchen and bedroom. The staff is Great, Jennifer the General Manager along with the entire hotel staff went above and beyond to ensure that my family enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: nmartin_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here December 6th through January 25th while displaced after a fire. The staff was great- very nice, helpful and curteous. They made us feel at home immediately when we were freaking out about our situation. Toni at the lobby desk was especially nice and helpful. The suite was a great size and nice layout so that despite our sometimes opposite work schedules, we could both get good sleep- on the AWESOME bed. The sleep system they have here is great. The elevator situation is a bit crazy around dinner time but overall was ok except when kids press the buttons for every one of the 19 floors, which happened at least twice during our stay. Other great things were the proximity to the Red Line, great restaurants and shopping (and Trader Joe's!), the in-room dishwasher, free dinner M-Th and free breakfast daily, laundry on the 7th floor and the beautiful views from the lobby and the pool room up on the 19th floor. Even if you don't swim, go up and check out the view at night! We live in the city but would come here again for a downtown get-away- without the fire!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: SJudge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night (would have liked to stay longer, but had to get out before the blizzard hit), but it was a great stay. The room was HUGE. Love having a kitchen (although we didn't use it), and seperate bedroom. The bed was really comfortable and the room was very quiet (never heard anything else in the hotel or street noise). Location is fabulous. Just pull right up, valet your car and you never need it again. Just a quick walk through the mall across the street (Shops at Northbridge- visit the Lego store if you have small kids), and you're on the Magnificent Mile. Free breakfast was amazing (bacon, sausage, biscuits, gravy, eggs, two kinds of potatoes), plus the usual cereal, pastries, etc. There was also a complimentary dinner that night which we chose not to eat since we were only in town for one night, but it smelled good, and what a money saver! The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the doormen- always ready with a smile and an open door. Can't say enough nice things.

Reviews.Title: “Big bang for you buck!!”
Reviews.Author: GShipley88
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed in Chicago for 3 days and 2 nights(1/28/2011-1/30/2011) for his birthday weekend. After careful and several hotel considerations, we finally chose one: Homewood Suites by Hilton Chicago Downtown. We were greeted by valet parking and a friendly "Welcome to Chicago" as we were directed to the lobby. The receptionist was more than friendly and sarcastic while giving maps and directions of where to eat and sight see. We reserved a king suite-smoking that looked just like the pictures online, just a bit better! Living room, kitchen, a seperate bedroom accompanied by vanity section, bathroom, not to mention the room itself was very spacious! If you jump into the bed I'm sure you'll fall asleep that the bed is so comfortable and huge! The views of the city was beautiful. We had a minor problem with connecting my fiance's xbox and someone was up to fix it in no more than 5 minutes... talk about fast service! The two neighboring rooms next to us let the doors slam behind them throughout the time we stayed there which got a bit annoying, but didn't complain because I was so relaxed and comfortable in my suite! We arose for complimentary breakfast at 8:30am. To my surprise, a full dining area and seperate breakfast buffet that will make your mouth drop, (eggs with cheese, sausage patties, bagels, variety of breads, doughnuts, cereal, etc.) because anything you could name for breakfast was right in front of you! Overall, Homewood Suites by Hilton Chicago Downtown is a big bang for your buck! $88 advance purchse for a very spacious One King Suite-smoking, complimentary internet access, premium channels, and complimentary breakfast, to name a few, is very cheap!
