I am taking another trip to Chicago within a month and I will not have to search for a hotel, I've found my temporary home at this hotel. Thank you Homewood Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable! 5 Stars! The best place in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago0Traveler1234
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing hotel you can imagine. Very quiet. Less than 2 blocks to North Michigan Avenue. Less than 2 blocks from the Trump Tower. For $89/night, I got a huge room on the 18th floor with a wonderful view. 2 beds. Full kitchen with fridge, burner, microwave, dishwasher, etc. Even had dishwashing soap in the room. The kitchen was stocked with all dishes, cutlery, and cooking pots. Dining table. 2 flat screen TVs. Sofa bed. Large bathroom. An over-the-top full spread completely free all-you-can eat breakfast. At breakfast, they even give you large styrofoam containers to take more food to your room, so you can put it in your fridge and have it for lunch if you want. And then free dinner from 5:30 - 7pm. And free beer/wine included!!! I went out for the day, and when I came back, I was wondering where the dishes were that I had put in the sink, as I was going to wash them. But I couldn't find the dishes in the sink. Then I looked in the cupboards, and the cleaning lady had washed all the dishes, and put them all back in the cupboards! Amazing! Business center is free & open 24/7. Full free computer facilities with fax & scanning & printing too -- all free; Nice swimming pool & fitness center. Even have coin laundry which is only $1.50/load. Free wireless internet. I really don't know how the hotel is making money doing all this & more for only $89/night. Parking is very costly at $42/night. But I suppose this is the going rate in the area. But I didn't have a car; and you certainly don't need a car, because the hotel is in the center of everything. I will definitely be staying here every time I come to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service amongst all Hotels in the Hotel Industry”
Reviews.Author: srimathi_k
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites, Chicago makes travel and staying away from home a lot easier with their excellent customer service. Connie Wilson at breakfast is my mom-away-from-home. I look forward to coming back every week to enjoy Connie's hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: swifty134
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in downtown Chicago, with reasonable facilities. Connie Wilson remembers your name after the first day and ensures your breakfast is ready.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: UsaAng
Reviews.Content: We were so pleassed with this hotel!! We went to chicago for a short trip and we could not have been happier. This hotel was not only a huge bargain but clean very very nice the staff was amazing and so helpful and friendly!!! I had left a camera in my car and boy they went to get it and came up to our room to give it to us. Took care of cabs for us, told us clubs to go to and how to get to different locations we needed. A breeze to get to off the freeway, FABULOUS location and the breakfast was not only FREE but very very good. I would recommend highly to friends and family and will be going back in a heart beat!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thank you homewood suites!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and surprising”
Reviews.Author: enigmatic00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over new year's weekend with friends and had an enjoyable stay. The hotel is in a perfect location and is only blocks away from Michigan Avenue and within walking distance to many great restaurants. There is also a shopping mall right across the street. The room was very clean and had plenty of space to accommodate five people. Our suite also included a pull out bed. The bathroom was a decent size and well maintained. The free breakfast was an added bonus with lots of choice. Would totally go back.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed and surprised”
Reviews.Author: chicogo
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing (easy walk to both the north and south loops, and of course the Mag mile). The staff was so friendly! I'm Canadian and I can say that not even WE have people as hospitable as there was at the Homewood hotel. I'm only staying at this hotel when I visit Chicago from now on.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: gogoamy
Reviews.Content: we recently just stayed at this hotel for one night. everything about our stay was great! the rooms are very spacious, the hotel staff were all very friendly and the location can't be beat! next time we are in chicago we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BJStravels
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in Chicago to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Upon arrival the staff provided us with a complimentary bottle of wine. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast buffet was always crowded but well stocked. Every member of the hotel made us feel welcome. This was our second trip to Chicago and to this hotel. It is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great size rooms, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Brew_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over long weekend in January. The location is great and the rooms are a great size for a downtown hotel. Plenty of room for the familty to relax. Pool was great, plenty warm, plenty towels, and a great view to boot. Service was very good, breakfast a little crowded but they did a great job of keeping things neat and clean and was plenty of food and variety. Would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the newest but certainly value for money”
Reviews.Author: BusyBees04_2010
Reviews.Content: We, family of 4, stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. The decor is a little dated and the hallways were uneven but we didn't stay here for the decor! The location is perfect, in the middle of the mag mile and close to CTA buses and trains, restaurants and grocery stores. Didn't use any of the facilities like pool, laundry or fitness so can't comment. Breakfast was great and only crowded on our last day for some reason. Kickback meal at night was adequate and free so who's to complain! All day tea and coffe in lobby available and very handy. Popcorn in room was a winner for our 2 kids, 8 & 14yrs. No room safe but we didn't have a problem, just locked up our valuables in our cases each day. Fast check out service great, didn't have to go to the lobby at all! Doormen very helpful and were prompt and helpful with my few requests, even after I forgot to tip them, sorry boys! Would def stay here again for convenience and free food and highly recommend to anyone who wants value for money and isn't after just aesthetics!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice for parents with young children."”
Reviews.Author: Travelingwithkids71
Reviews.Content: First let me start of by saying I would consider myself to be very picky when it comes to hotel accommodations. So, since I do not have anything negative to say about this hotel, that should speak volumes. I have a 3 year old and 9 month old and as everyone knows traveling can be a nightmare. Our room was very clean, the bed was extremely comfortable, and most importantly the suite was equipped with everything we needed for a weekend stay. Having a separate room to place the pack and play was essential since our youngest child goes to bed well before the rest of us. I could hardly hear any noise in the room besides an occasional siren (That is expected). Our suite had cups, plates and utensils ready for our use. The location of the hotel was also ideal.....we went shopping and out to dinner with a minimal walking time. For kids try the Rainforest cafe (2 blocks away). For the price, I do not think we could have found a better hotel if I spent 3 days looking. Another excellent feature was the breakfast. We saved a bunch of money eating at the hotel and the food was very good with many options. Finally, the staff. From Abdul the doorman/valet, to the nice lady that checked us in (sorry forgot name), everyone was accommodating, friendly, and professional. We visit Chicago a few times every year and we will undoubtedly be staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and greatWe value for money”
Reviews.Author: Newton_Tony
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family (including children aged 14 and 11) from 26 Dec 10 to 5 Jan 11. We booked largely based on Trip Advisor reviews and ratings and were certainly not disappointed. The location of this Homeward Suites is ideal: one block from the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Avenue) and very close to good restaurants. Included in your rate is an extensive breakfast buffet and dinner with alcohol (Mon-Thu). Although this was very busy over the holiday period, the service was excellent and great for people watching! All staff were extremely polite and efficient and we would certainly stay here again if visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value & Supreme Service”
Reviews.Author: KankakeeCoSpeedway
Reviews.Content: As much as I'd like to find something wrong with this hotel, I simply can not. The rooms were spacious for my wife, daughter, and I. Bed was comfortable and rooms were very clean. Check-in went quickly and smoothly and lady was very helpful in helping me with where to go and what to do. Valet service, though a tad expensive, was very professional and always greeted us with a smile. Everyone at the hotel made us feel very welcome. I would definitely recommend this inexpensive hotel to anyone traveling into Chicago (River North area) for a short stay. Ranked #4 hotel in Chicago, and with good reason. The breakfast buffet hit the spot in the morning, and the Manager's reception each night also helped us save money. Don't know what else I could add. I will try another hotel in the future just for the sake of staying somewhere else for comparison, but will definitely not rule out Homewood Suites either. Very happy with our stay. The hotel puts you right in the heart of the shopping district with everything you can think of within a short walk. Water Tower Place, Hancock Tower, Chicago Theater, Navy Pier, Harry Caray's, Ruth's Chris Steak House, Horse & Carriage rides, WGN, Trump Tower, Chicago River, etc. etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Chicago and the Homewood Suites.”
Reviews.Author: ILoveVacation4
Reviews.Content: What a great location. The hotel could use a bit of updating, but the rooms are huge. The pool is great on the top floor with awesome views. We travel ALOT and are very picky and we really loved it here. The service was excellent. Everyone on staff was exceptionally nice. The breakfast and dinner were great. Only a couple small complaints...the pool had tons of sand on the bottom and the water looked cloudy. Also, our son got locked in the bathroom for a bit (old door), but maintenance came right away to help him get out and to replace the lock. Other than those items our stay was perfect and we will definately return if we are ever in Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeannealpha
Reviews.Content: My two daughters (ages 22 and 19) and I just returned from a 4 day visit in Chicago. We stayed at the Homewood Suites and the hotel was perfect. We got the park and stay rate ($194). We pulled up and the valet took our car and brought all our luggage to the room. There is no need to have a car in Chicago. The rooms were great-full kitchen (dishwasher, full frig, microwave, cooktop) and included glasses, dishes, and utencils. The breakfast and dinner menues were AMAZING-and free. I figured we saved at least $90/day on food! The meals were real meals, not just continental breakfast and heavy snacks. We were there the week between Christmas and New Years and it was VERY crowded, but the hotel dining room staff kept up with the food replenishment and the tables-and they did it all with smiles! The hotel is very clean and every staff member we encountered was very friendly. So many things we wanted to do were within walking distance, even in the cold weather. we loved it! Having free wifi in the room was a plus. We are planning a trip back in the spring and we will definitely stay at Homewood Suites Downtown Chicago. And be sure to register for a Chicago Greeter if you are planning a visit to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: tribucks
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the "Park 'n Play" package just after Christmas and thought it was a very good choice. The staff were all very attentive and friendly. The location was excellent -- about a block from Mag Mile shopping and 2 blocks from the "L." If we didn't walk, we took cabs most places (Navy Pier, Willis Tower, Hancock bldg., Water Tower) and the fare was always well under $10 for all 4 of us. With parking ($42/day) included and both breakfast & dinner (Mon-Thurs.) as well, I don't see how you could beat the value. I'm sure CHI's great restaurants are what many travelers prefer but we had 2 kids under 10 so the meals @the hotel worked out much better. Food options were plentiful and changed daily, and I couldn't believe beer & wine were included at dinner. We'd stay again with or w/o the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: oztravellers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel. Being a one bedroom apartment there was plenty of room and although we didn't use it the kitchen was well equipped. The hotel is located close to the main sights and with a shopping mall opposite it is easy to get meals if you do not want to take advantage of the free Manager's buffet offerred week nights. This and the breakfast made this a very good value. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the guest laundry also handy. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time- definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: angeljoy222
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago with my husband and in-laws. We bought the City Pass to do five Chicago Attractions. Homewood Suites was in a great location to get to the bus stop to take us each day to a different attraction. The awesome breakfast usually kept us full most of the day so we didn't spend money on lunch, and the dinner was nice as well. The dining room could get quite crowded, so we learned early on to get up early for breakfast- after 8:00 it gets bad! Connie in the dining room is amazing though, she is nice and efficient in getting people seats. The room was large and they were nice enough to put us in rooms next to each other. Having the kitchen was definitely nice! Will definitely be back there anytime we go to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “One Night in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: rnbbhs
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the homewood suites in Chicago with our four children ages 1, 6, 12, and 14. Nothing spectacular about the hotel. Close to Michigan Avenue. Nice free buffet in the morning, very busy. Fitness center was small. Pool was nice for the kids. Parking valet only for 42.00 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: chuffedwithbarcelo
Reviews.Content: Ok, the Homewood suites are only a 3*, but they are excellent. When we travel security and cleanliness are high on our agenda and this hotel scores high on both fronts. The rooms are nice, we had a suite with mini kitchen, small lounge area and huge very comfortable bed. The hotel offers a 'free' breakfast and supper. Both are OK, although it can be a bit of a scrum at the servery, breakfast is the better of the 2. The location of this place is superb, it is a few mins walk to the Mag Mile and on major bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: JAW14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to its proximity to Michigan Avenue for shopping after taking in Wicked the night before. It's just a short taxi ride from the theater district and a very short walk to the Shops at North Bridge which includes Nordstrom and Lego. The hot breakfast buffet was wonderful - the hotel was booked the night we were there but the staff did a great job keeping everything running smoothly. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel near Magnifient Mile, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Yankeeinexile
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific. The staff (front desk, bellmen, and breakfast room staff) were exceptionally helpful and friendly. We could walk almost anywhere, including the Art Institute and a full range of restaurants. I am a poor sleeper so I worry about big city hotels, but we heard NO street noise. It was great that the suite had two rooms including full-size refrigerator for restaurant leftovers. Since we stayed in mid-December, we also appreciated that the range of complimentary hot coffee and teas was available in the lobby all day and evening. The one bizarre issue (maybe limited to our room #815 since the front desk had never heard of this an issue) was that the toilet wasn't placed properly. A small groove had been carved out of the bathroom door so the door could even shut. And we had to lift up the toilet seat each time we needed to open and close the bathroom door. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amenities, and value”
Reviews.Author: conalvo
Reviews.Content: My husband, in-laws, and I spent two nights at the Homewood Suites Chicago just before Christmas. We booked two one-bedroom suite rooms at a fantastic rate, and we were impressed at this hidden gem located just steps from the Magnificient Mile in Chicago. We were right in the middle of all the action, and yet the hotel was extremely quiet. It was clean, and the service was exceptional. We enjoyed the indoor pool, and we were pleasantly surprised at the breakfast and evening (weekday) dinner that was provided at no cost. We did experience one slight problem during our stay, and the management took care of the problem quickly and efficiently, no questions asked. Most hotel managers miss the mark with customer service and begin arguing with customers when a problem arises. Not the staff at the Homewood Suites. Our problem was resolved, and we felt taken care of. The only reason I mention the issue is to describe how well we were treated. I would definitely choose this property when staying in Chicago, and I would highly recommend the Homewood Suites to anyone. We saw families, solo travelers, and international travelers at this property, and everyone seemed very happy. The Homewood Suites Chicago made it easy to enjoy the city, especially before a busy holiday.

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: juniperkay
Reviews.Content: The staff at Homewood Suites is wonderful! Everyone goes out of their way to make sure you feel welcome and have everything you need. The rooms are nice and it's so convenient to have a full kitchen when traveling with a baby. We've stayed at other hotels in Chicago, but when we return, we will definitely stay at Homewood Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “This is my home away from home and the staff is like family.”
Reviews.Author: vleckart
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites Downtown Chicago is in a great location and the staff is great! I have watched the staff treat first time guests just like those who have stayed many times, offering directions, suggestions for dining, transportation schedules. The hotel is located close to everything downtown and walking isn't far to most places for eating, shopping or tourist spots. The hotel itself is warm and comfortable, the rooms offer a homey atmosphere with your own kitchen separate bedrooms, two TV's, wake up service, etc. To name everyone at the hotel who have made my stays welcome would be difficult; from the Bell Hop and Valet Services who greet you before you even enter the door to Management, Sales, Guest Services, the Dining Room staff, Housekeeping and Maintenance everyone smiles and wants to do something for you. I have spent the past several years traveling for business in the Chicago area with most of my stays at this hotel. I have also stayed here several times for pleasure with family and friends. In the past three years they have become my family away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for weekend shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: btgm
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It has a pool but no hot tub. There is an exercise room with 2 treadmills, weights, recumbent bike, and some sort of elliptical type thing. The pool is hit or miss on crowding. On Fri at 8PM there was no one there but us, but on Sun at 1030AM it was too crowded for my daughter to want to swim. On Sun at 1140AM it was empty. It goes from 3 feet to 4.5 feet. The room has a living room/kitchen with table seating for 2. There is a 2 burner stove, good size microwave, almost full size fridge, coffeemaker, and 2 slice toaster. There is a separate bedroom with king bed and a full bath off of that. I did notice some little imperfections (toilet paper holder slightly bent, luggage rack looks a little worn), but in general the room is clean and in good repair. There is a breakfast buffet (7-10 on weekends and 630-930 on weekdays). So far they have had eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes, corned beef hash, grits, fruit, toast/bagels to toast, and tea/coffee/juice/milk. They have takeout containers so you can take breakfast back to the room. Tip for this, I brought down one of those plastic bags you get from the store and it was really helpful for carrying the food back. Usually I end up juggling the containers and drinks and everything in the elevator. The elevators were really crowded on Sun AM, but otherwise have not been bad. You enter on the 1st floor (there is valet parking which I think was about $40-50/day, but it was included in our room rate so I donâ€™t remember exactly). Iâ€™m pretty sure there are in and out privileges, but we are not driving again until we check out. There are several restaurants within a block or so of the hotel, and Nordstroms is right across Grand Ave (the other entrance to the Nordstroms Mall is on Michigan Ave). We walked to Navy Pier and it took about 30 min or so (not rushing and running into the parade on Michigan making us have to backtrack). We took the bus up to Water Tower Place, but it was certainly walkable, we just felt like taking the bus. The staff has been pleasant. The guy who parked our car has called me by name every time we have come back to the hotel (just saying hi). In fact last night when we came in he said â€œHi Mrs Xâ€� (using my last initial) which was a little disconcerting, but did not offend me. I donâ€™t know if that familiarity would offend others or not. There are a lot of families with kids staying here, but they have been generally well behaved and well supervised. Several times my daughter went to the pool and it was empty except for her, which doesnâ€™t happen often in hotels we stay at. We did have a slight problem on checkout. On the receipt they put under the door for express checkout they charged me for parking, which was supposed to be included in my rate. However, when I took it down to the desk and told them they immediately changed it with no argument and apologized, so I certainly canâ€™t hold it against them. All we lost was the express checkout. They also let us leave our car in the garage until 5 or 6 PM on our check out day at no extra charge. Overall, I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't even make it to a reservation, terribly rude.”
Reviews.Author: BradleyBee
Reviews.Content: I called on December 6th, 2010 at 3 p.m. to book a room for an upcoming weekend getaway, and was taken aback when the phone was picked up and promptly hung up without a word. Thinking this might have been a simple mistake, I gave it another try. A woman introducing herself as "Toni" answered the phone, rushed through her introduction, sounding incredibly bored and annoyed that she had to answer the phone. Barely letting a second go by after her introduction, she gave a snotty "Hello?!" before I could open my mouth and tell her "Never mind." Never has a hotel answered my call so rudely. I'd like to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt and pin this unpleasant experience to "Toni"; however I will not be calling back again in hopes to stay at this hotel during this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Deal!”
Reviews.Author: sleepy_bn
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for one night on Thanksgiving Day. It was a great deal for us. We found the Park-and-Play deal on Homewood Suites' own website so we paid only $25 on valet parking. Overall the stay was great. We enjoyed the free breakfast and dinner. Most hotels don't offer free dinners, let alone free beer and wine! The room was clean and the kitchen was great for heating up food for our baby. It was also quiet at night. The location is great and the hotel is warm and cozy overall. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: lawheel
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel while attending the magnificent mile lights festival. We had a one bedroom suite with a king bed and a sofa sleeper. The room was big and roomy as well as the bathroom. The kitchen was big and well equipped. The decor is very outdated and needs a bit of a face lift, but the place is clean and the service was great. My 13 year old daughter and her friend loved the pool on the top floor which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows and has a great view of the city, especially when swimming at night. The beds were very comfortable, the only negative was that I heard several sirens during the night that woke me once or twice, but hey, you are in downtown Chicago. The location was excellent. To get to Michigan ave we simply walked across the street to Nordstroms and cut through the North Bridge mall to bring us right out to Michigan Ave. You can also walk one block and take the steps up to Michigan ave as well. It was so easy to go back and forth and do what we wanted but go relax and get warm whenever we needed to. They had movies you could rent to watch on the living room TV. Pricey (most were $12.99) but all newer releases or some still in theaters. You could also rent games to play and the controllers are already connected to the television. There is a PF Chang Chinese restaurant across the street which we enjoyed for dinner that night, excellent food!! I would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: DetroitChicagoGuy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the HWS, 30+ nights this year for business. It's the standard I expect when I travel on business, but it also exceeded my expectations for a combined family vacation/business trip. Last week I brought my wife and son along with me for this business trip. The staff was exceptionally friendly and personal to all of us, all the way from the Assistant Sales Manager to the doorman. The assistant sales manager welcomed my family personally at our room with a personalized card and suggestions to take our 2 year-old son. Also, the free breakfast and "welcome reception" are a nice touch for families that don't want to splurge everyday during a long business trip a I could go on and on, but the staff here is like no other in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Alisa14
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellent priced compare to other Chicago hotels in the Magificant Mile area. close to many shops and restaurants. Plenty of transportation in area to get to other sections of Chicago such as Navy Pier and Wrigley Field.

Reviews.Title: “Thanking tripadvisor has found this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: Thanking tripadvisor has found this hotel. It very much was pleasant. A good arrangement. Free of charge feed with suppers and always on a reception there is a coffee and tea. A kind usual, but all was together comfortable and convenient. Hasn't regretted that in it has stopped

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all!”
Reviews.Author: PDX-TED
Reviews.Content: Where else in Chicago can you get a clean, comfortable one-bedroom apartment, with a great location and city view, two meals per day (dinner Mon.-Thurs. only), internet service, and a wonderful staff for a reasonable price? Special thanks on this one-week stay to Rose for blocking a great room for late arrival and to Toni for granting REALLY late checkout. Thanks also to Rosario and Connie in the dining room for unfailingly warm greetings and service at breakfast. There was only one, isolated incident of very poor service / security. Upon arrival at night, the cabbie "popped" the trunk and I gathered my things and exited, while my spouse paid the fare. At the trunk, I found a scruffy man unloading the luggage, including backpacks with two laptops. He said "no", when I asked if he was a hotel employee. I ran to the lobby, only to find THREE bellhops engaged in idle conversation, out of view of the front door, paying no attention to arriving guests. I dispatched the "street person" with a few coins, as the bellhops brought a trolley to the curb to load the luggage. A very unnerving experience. He could have run down the street with our backpacks. To the bellhops: stop gabbing and do your job--monitor the front door and leap to the curb when guests arrive. The answer to a request is always "yes, we can do that.", unless it is truly impossible to fulfill. Great, high-morale staff, from the cooks, dining staff, and housekeeping to the front desk staff. Very well-trained staff and well-managed operation--and it shows, with the one noted exception.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling right at HOME, in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MStangle
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Chicago, so I did a LOT of researching on hotel options and where specifically to stay. We couldn't be happier with hour choice: Homewood Suites. We were certainly impressed with how friendly and helpful the staff was. We appreciated the numerous amenities...everything from the wonderful breakfast buffet in the morning, to a nice gym (no fee), to coin-op laundry, and a full-functioning kitchen. The view from our room was of the Wrigley Building, the Trump Tower and more. A wonderful variety of restaurants were within walking distance. We were very comfortable and had a wonderful first experience in awesome Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Skyscraper Swimming to Classical Music!”
Reviews.Author: arrosage
Reviews.Content: It was time for our 9 year old granddaughter to meet her US cousins in Chicago. Homewood Suites is slap bang in the middle of the Magnificent Mile with easy access to everything in The Windy City. We had an en suite twin Queen room + living room with sofa bed + fully fitted kitchen, the basic standard before upgrading to larger suites. It was more than sufficient. The hotel provides a substantial breakfast and, on week days, a simple early dinner inclusive of wine, beer or soft drinks. On the top floor is a magnificent swimming pool, glazed on three sides with fantastic views across the city. Classical music played quietly in the background. This was particularly valued for it gave Granddaughter the opportunity to unwind and switch off after a hard day's sightseeing or family gathering. Once one gets used to the uniform decoration (? a little tired maybe, could benefit from a makeover?) in all the rooms it is exceedingly good value for money. Efficient staff and a relaxed atmosphere in the dining room. 'This feels like a community hotel' remarked Granddaughter.... No frills - ideal base for families and business people. Plenty of restaurants within a few steps and only a short walk to the Hancock Tower one way and the Chicago Architectural Society boat quay the other. A business suite gives 24 hour free access to computers. It suited us very well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View, Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTravelerTN
Reviews.Content: We are very happy that we chose the Homewood Suites on Grand Avenue for our anniversary trip. At check-in, Jennifer wished us a happy 25th anniversary and offered to send us complimentary drinks; since we donâ€™t drink wine or beer, she sent soft drinks, water, and pretzels. We had requested a quiet room with a good view of the city, and Jennifer happily accommodated us. We were extremely happy with our beautiful view of the Wrigley Tower clock and the Trump Tower; day or night, the view was great! Our suite was very nice. It was clean and inviting. For a four-night stay, it was advantageous to have a sitting area with kitchen in addition to the bedroom. The kitchen was handy for storing and reheating leftovers from oversized restaurant meals. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom has the sink and closet area outside the tub and toilet area which is very convenient for two people preparing for the day at the same time. Other reviewers had mentioned how the hotel staff goes out of its way to take care of the guests. This is so true! Everyone, from the breakfast and front desk staff to the guy mopping the floor, were so friendly. Since we had a late afternoon departure flight, the hotel was happy to give us late check-out. We were able to go on a fabulous Wendella tour of the river and lake that morning without having to deal with our luggage. Our Thursday â€“ Monday stay provided us with 5 complimentary meals â€“ dinner on Thursday and breakfast every morning. The meals provided variety and tasty nourishment, and they saved us both time and money. After hours of travel on Thursday, it was convenient to be able to enjoy the late afternoon exploring Michigan Avenue and then crash at the hotel with a good dinner. Each day got a good start with a hot, fresh breakfast before heading out to the dayâ€™s activities. Different offerings were available each morning. The location was great! Since we are avid walkers, we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go with the exception of the Museum of Science and Industry (we took the #10 weekend bus). Public transportation is not hard to figure out. I had gotten directions for using the train from Midway to the Roosevelt station and then transferring (free) to the Red Line subway to the Grand Avenue stop just 1 Â½ blocks from the hotel. The CTA personnel at Midway was so helpful that he made sure to clarify our directions. We had a similar experience with CTA personnel at the Grand Ave. station for our return trip to the airport. The hotel business center has 3 computers which seems adequate. Only one evening did I have to wait for a computer to become available. The only problem I encountered for the entire stay was in printing our boarding passes â€“ only one pc has the proper print alignment â€“ the other 2 chop off the first letter on the left â€“ might be important for getting through airport security. Iâ€™m sure the front desk would have assisted me with this problem, but another guest in the business center knew which pc would send the proper printing to the printer. The fitness room and swimming pool looked good, but we never used them. We tended to get all the activity we needed walking around the city all day. I did notice that other hotel guests used them. Our Chicago trip was fabulous, and we hope to visit again. We will certainly want to stay at Homewood Suites when we return, and Iâ€™ll start looking at Homewood Suites for other trips too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: piggyskin
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Have stayed there on multi occasions. Room suites are extremely spacious & beautiful with near full size kitchens. Separate bedroom makes you feel like you are at home. Short walk to Navy Pier & Michigan Avenue. Hotel free breakfast is very good. This hotel is extremely clean & all staff are very friendly & they all go the extra mile to make your stay the best that it can be. Grocery store just a short block away for items you might need. Hotel will even shop for you if you wish. Tons of good restaurants in this area to pick from. Hotel is also very quiet. Never been disturbed by noise from other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: londm21
Reviews.Content: Nothing flashy but a nice hotel with very friendly staff and free coffee and tea all of the time in the lobby. Our room was big, with two TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_Traveler3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location. One block from the red line and one block from Michigan Ave. The room was fine. It did not appear to be worn or dated as some of the other reviewers have remarked. One of the elevators was not working during our stay, which made it a little time consuming to get to our room, however, the wonderful staff was there to help. They gave guests rides up the service elevator, which allowed us to avoid long waits. The thing that makes this hotel excellent is the staff. They are genuinely friendly and go out of their way to help their guests. The breakfast is okay, but if you are in Chicago you really should be trying out the local restaurants since that is half the reason to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place for business travel and to bring the family along”
Reviews.Author: hamptondragon
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better hotels I have stayed at. I had a 5 day business meeting at a downtown Chicago hotel but this hotel was cheaper and I am an Hhonors gold member. Additionally, this hotel was the same price whether I brought my wife and kids or just myself so, as Chicago is within driving distance of where I live, this hotel got my business and my family got to come. Being family friendly was a huge plus. Also interesting to meet some patrons who had been staying in the hotel weeks or months. I agree with most of what has been said about this hotel. The staff are nice during the meals and at the front desk. My toddler doesn't like elevators (he got used to them during this 5+ night stay) and they saw him crying and they gave him a toy rubber duck with "Chicago" on it and a cubs hat on the duck. Nice touch that he liked. Apparently people don't look too closely at websites as all Homewood Suites (HWS) have free breakfast every morning and a free dinner M-H (some patrons are surprised by this). Yes, as with all downtown Chicago hotels parking is ridiculously overpriced but such is life in that location. This hotel has standard HWS amenities including the free meals, hot chocolate at night, DVD players in rooms and such. The lobby on the 1st floor and 6th floor are rather underwhelming as is the place where one drops off their car, but this is not an issue in my mind. I love the breakfast and the ability to take extra food upstairs and store it in the fridge, something Embassy Suites often won't let you do and should. Those with kids will understand the beauty in this. The views of downtown Chicago in the midst of the skyscrapers are excellent, as is the view from the pool. Loved it up there. The pool is OK, nice size but no real shallow area for kids about 2-3. For some reason, there was some sand that came out of the water jets in the pool, and that was odd. I think this HWS should have a hot tub, but oh well (i.e. there is no hot tub). The hotel insulation is very good as I couldn't hear noise in adjacent rooms and the loud downtown Chicago noise was nicely muted when the windows were closed. The bed is nice, liked the pillows and I found the hide-a-bed sofa comfortable. The hotel could use a shuttle as the trolley rarely runs after mid September but the hotel is near the red line of the L and is near some great downtown attractions and restaurants. The breakfast food is very good, although I think they should have waffles (or possibly french toast or pancakes) every morning. They seemed to like to serve biscuits and gravy at this hotel. Dinner is simple (great for kids) and there is a menu so you know what will be served each night. Fitness center is adequate, but one gets access to the better center at the nearby Conrad. As with any HWS, there is no onsite restaurant, but there is a snack shop and of course nearby places to eat at times when the hotel is not serving free meals. Internet is free and is of reasonable speed. Yes, there are only two elevators but I never waited more than 30 seconds. A few minor negatives. I asked for a top or near top floor, a few days in advance, and they didn't commit to one. Doubt it is that tough with notice to reserve a top floor room for a gold member, but such is life. I did get a 14th floor room and the pool is on the 19th floor. The pool area could use a hot tub. Figure out the sand issue with the pool. Have some fruit (like bananas or apples as most Hamptons and HWS do) or snacks out after 7:00 like more other HWS do (hot chocolate isn't quite enough). Bathroom is a bit small. However, these are minor. Overall, bigtime thumbs up and I hope to come back. I had a great time in Chicago, as did my family. Thank you HWS downtown Chicago. My favorite HWS.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location two blocks from Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: BigSantaMonicaFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 2010 Chicago Marathon. Great location: 2 blocks from Michigan Ave, 1 block from Red Line "L" stop, and easy walking distance to tons of great restaurants. The staff and management are very friendly and helpful. Safe location. Clean, nice rooms with microwave and full-sized fridge. Standard HWS breakfast and beds. Highly recommended for biz travelers and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable hotel with impressive views”
Reviews.Author: CristinaNavas
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago last september to work. I am a Spanish researcher who visited the city to work in two libraries. As it was my first time in Chicago -and also in the States- I searched much in the web to be assured I chose a comfortable hotel. I found Homewood Suites. It was in town centre, quite near from the libraries, and also it looked like a very nice hotel. So I decided to book a room there. I have to say that all my expectations about the hotel have been fulfilled. The hotel is in the core of Chicago. It is surrounded by lots of restaurants and Michigan Avenue is just two blocks from the hotel. The room is quite big. It has a living room with a kitchen fully stocked with all appliances. The bedroom is separated from the living room and it has a big bathroom. Everything is quite clean.The views from the room are impressive, it is surrounded by skyscrapers. At night it is just incredible!! I would like also to say that breakfast (a cumplimentary buffet) is excellent. Not only the meal was superb but also the staff who work in the Dining Area, such as Rosario Figueroa and Ivan. Both have been always helpful and made me feel as if I was at home. Without any doubt if I return to Chicago I would book again into this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidTraveler11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for two nights last week, and it met every expectation. I picked the hotel for location only, and it was perfect! I wanted a quick walk to the boat tours, to Michigan Ave. shopping, and to the three restuarants we had reserved (Prosecco, Bistro 110 and Sixteen) for a quick stay in Chicago. Valet was very attentive; on our way out, he held our bags while we went two blocks up to Starbucks, and upon return, our car was ready, and the bags loaded! We booked online and found a package that included parking, which was quite a savings. To go on about the room, location, etc. I would be repeating most of the previous reviews--suffice it to say that the service is wonderful, the staff is very kind and attentive to needs, and has many good suggestions for touring, eating, and shopping. The rooms are VERY clean, and it is nice to have a full size refrigerator, dishes, glasses, etc . though our stay was so short, we didn't get to utilize many of the extra "perks" of this hotel, such a free breakfast, and dinner!! I believe this hotel would be very good for a family, or several people traveling together, people on a budget, as there is a nice grocery store around the corner and you can load up your fridge with necessities, and perhaps someone staying on a bit longer. We were VERY pleased with everything about this hotel, but what really sells it is the attitude of the staff----they are very, very kind and accomadating, and they should be proud of the top=notch services they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Carmel67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just one street away from Michigan Ave...The Magnificient Mile and a great location for getting on tours and seeing the city on foot. The morning breakfast on the 6th floor and evening light suppers days Mon-Thur are very convenient as well. It was served in a beautiful room with view of the city. We would difinately used this hotel again!! There are a number of good restaurants in the area as well and it felt safe to be out in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet refuge after a day in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: yeahcardinals
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for accessing the red line which took us to Wrigley Field. One block form Michigan Ave and walking distance to the Navy Pier. Being a suite hotel, we had room to relax after jam filled days sightseeing. Room was very quiet and the staff was very helpful making reservations. They gave us a late checkout which allowed us to visit the aquarium the morning we left. By serving a free breakfast, we did not have to get ou just to eat before getting ready to leave for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, full breakfast”
Reviews.Author: siena97
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be better between the heart of downtown and Millenium Park, close to subway and bus stops. Easy to either walk or take mass transit. Good size kitchen, free internet. The breakfast was substantial, not just coffee and pastry. The free dinners offered during the week looked like standard fare but ample so a good budget choice if you traveling with family. Chicago has so many great restaurants that I never ate dinner at the hotel. Only oddity is the lobby is on an upper floor, not street level but because of that the rooms are all on higher floors so I had a great view of Chicago skyscrapers.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine, Caring, Considerate, Tasty B'fast, Kind, Friendly, Clean and more...”
Reviews.Author: Opal10
Reviews.Content: OK, so the sofa bed got stuck in mid pull out. Result, better room and corner to boot! Many thanks to Jonah (a humble, gracious bellhop with a hearty laugh) who helped us "lobby" for a different room, rather than wait on engineering to fix the sofa when it was obvious it would take much longer than 4 very tired travelers should have to endure. Room 1018 has one of the best views in the building - TrumpTower, Wrigley bldg looking S. and looking w., a rooftop beer garden (block away) and sunsets. Just for fun, patronize the beer garden. But only if you want to have fun. HomewoodSuites is within walking distance of numerous attractions besides the beer garden. Due pizza, Howling at the Moon dueling piano bar, shopping, even a grocery store around the corner (jewel). A short taxi ride can take you to even more. The signature bus tour (dble decker) tickets can be had at a discount from the front desk. Luvinia is most helpful for this. Jennifer has to be mentioned also, as she contributed to making our stay (3 couples) most memorable. Hey, ya can't go wrong staying here. Stayed 2 nites, 10/1-3/10. Glad to give H.S. 5 of 5. Oh, and the sofa bed rivals the king.

Reviews.Title: “Not the fanciest hotel - but the best service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: DixieIpsit
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a really posh, glitzy hotel in Chicago, you might be a little disappointed in the Homewood Suite Hotel. The furniture is a little worn, and the colors are warm and soothing, rather than bright and "modern". But the service is dazzling - from the valet who took our car to the check-in clerk to the waitstaff in the dining area. The food (breakfast for two days and dinner for one) was the best surprise - and a real deal. We figured that our party of four saved almost $200 on meals. Again, it wasn't the fanciest nouvelle cuisine in town, but it was really good food - particularly the biscuits at breakfast and the hard rolls at dinner. Super location for anyone touring downtown Chicago. We had a spectacular view of the Wrigley Building (and its big clock). Our only complaints (and they were very minor) was that we had some trouble with the remote control on one of the TVs and that the flat sheet for the sofabed had a rip in it. I would certainly stay here again and so would everyone else in my party. A really great value for the money - I would describe it with just one word: "nice".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: b1941
Reviews.Content: On September 19th we made our first trip to Chicago and our first stay with Homewood Suites. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Our suite was on the 17th floor and very comfortable and clean. The hotel has a wonderful breakfast each morning along with a manager's dinner on Monday - Thursday. No problem with elevators being busy and having to wait on them and we didn't have any noise problems from the street. The staff was very helpful in letting us have a late checkout time. This hotel is in an excellent location with the red line about one block down from hotel; restaurants (Joes is great) and grocery store close by; within walking distance to Michigan Avenue (you can go across the road to Nordstrom Department Store and go up to the first floor and out the front door and you're on Michigan Avenue or you can go a few yards down from the hotel and up some stairs to Michigan Avenue). A liesure walk to Navy Pier takes about 15 - 20 minutes. Our cab ride from Union Station to hotel cost about $5.55 plus tip. Thanks to the wonderful staff who may our stay a great one. We will definitely stay here again and tell our friends about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Toni and Starr at Homewood Suites Downtown Chicago are the Best!”
Reviews.Author: dks0303
Reviews.Content: I travel at least once a month to Chicago for business and I always stay at the Homewood Suites. What makes the trip enjoyable is the service I receive from Toni and Starr at the hotel's front desk. They are always very helpful and accommodating, and will always do their best to help make your stay more comfortable. This is the only hotel I recommend to friends and co-workers when they travel to Chicago. D. Smith Springfield, Illinois

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place and staff!”
Reviews.Author: JEG54
Reviews.Content: Wow, I don't very often get the names of the staff of where I'm staying but in this case they were so awesome I wanted to be sure and mention each by name. The service, location, food, staff and rooms were amazing. Thank you, Star, Connie, Kristy, Vanessa, Alfredo and Luis for your help and assistance during the week. Each one of you went out of your way to help make our meeting and stay a success. Well done! Janet

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast. Ok service. Room a...”
Reviews.Author: roadtested
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast. Ok service. Room a little worn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanp_117
Reviews.Content: First of all the rooms are excellent, kitchens are cleen and well maintained and thee staff extremely helpful. Hotel is close to Michigan Avenue shopping and a number of good eateries. Breakfast is ok. (i'm a toast and coffee type of guy), the evening reception could be improved, however was ok. Sole complaint - arrived on monday 13/09 to find thety overbooked and there was no room available. That to me is unacceptable expecially when they send you off to another hotel in the depths of south chicago, that looks as if it had seen much better days. But apart from that gripe - the HomewoodSuites are a good place to staty.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent with good location, great rooms, breakfast and good value”
Reviews.Author: aabbccddhgf
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. All the staff was outwardly friendly and helpful. All you had to do was ask if you needed anything. Breakfast was great and plentiful with a good variety. The managers free reception from 5 to 7pm each weekday with complimentary beer and wine with some great snacks, could almost be called dinner. The suites were spacious and clean. The bed was very comforatable. Overall I felt safe and was very pleased with my stay. I would call this gem a great alternative to it's large overpriced neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, and perfect for kids”
Reviews.Author: biz_nasty
Reviews.Content: We have a 16 month year old boy and needed an affordable suite in Chicago. Finding an affordable suite shrinks the search dramatically. This was my first stay and from the very beginning things went right. The valet parking was a breeze and the parker brought our luggage up to the room. We checked in quickly and our son got a yellow rubber duck from the receptionist. The building was clean, and when we arrived at our room it was larger than I had hoped with a full kitchen, and a large flatscreen tv. The room even had a decent view. Also, the complimentary breakfast in the lobby dining room is well worth it...wide assortment of hot and cold foods that are fresh and the area is kept tidy by a staff of 3 or 4. Pricing was reasonable, we got the Park-n-Play package for $199.99/night and that included the $42 valet parking. Taxes were $25/day. For a suite in Chicago...that sounds pretty good to me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel163
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels throughout the years, but the service and value of this hotel are outstanding! We were celebrating our 35th Anniversary with our children. While dining at a local restaurant, we were surprised by a complementary bottle of wine sent over from the hotel manager, Jennifer. Now that's service! The food, wine and beer were included in our visit were more than generous and allow the stay in Chicago to be more affordable. The only change we would like to see is a more comfortable mattresses on the fold out couch.

Reviews.Title: “Staff exceeds expectation”
Reviews.Author: elainefoxy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice. Both sames were excellent. Front desk Clerk Starr Stovall handled all my concerns with great professionalism. Starr is an asset to Homewood Suites Hotel. The breakfast and dinner buffet were great also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: IGAK
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how big the room was, especially the kitchen area. It showed a little wear but was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful, and a small problem we had with the door lock (dead battery in the card reader) was quickly repaired. Our week-long stay included Labor Day weekend, during which the wait for the elevator was sometimes long as was the wait for a table for breakfast, but the rest of the week was fine. Location is very convenient to most attractions, either on foot or by public transportation (including Wrigley Field). We felt comfortable walking around at night and when taking a train or bus. Lots of good restaurants and nightlife nearby - we enjoyed the music at Andy's Jazz Cafe. I highly recommend this hotel. Terrific location and great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: hasbeanshockey
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights over the labour day long weekend in Chicago at the Homewood Suites. Service was exceptional by all employees. The free buffet breakfast was quite good. The free internet and free business office was an added bonus. Also the view from our corner suite was beautiful. Three blocks from Michigan Ave and 3 blocks from Trump Towers make this a central location, surrounded by dozens of great restaurants. The only downfall was the elevators were slow during peak hours. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, all what we need.”
Reviews.Author: Mercy417
Reviews.Content: We couln't ask for more, the hotel is one block from the metro station, a free trolley to Navy Pier is just a few steps, walkable to almost every site and restaurants. Front desk ladies were very nice and accommodating( they allow us to check in earlier and check out late), the employes at the breakfast and buffet area always ready to help, food was good and help you save some money. Room was big and clean, we had a two beds accesible suite and it was huge, only problem the internet connection at room is very slow,but they have a conference room with 3 computers, fax , printer and all you probably need, beds were very comfortable. We definitively will stay in this hotel if we come back to Chicago again( and we will ). There is a supermarket 1 block west of hotel ( E. Grand & N. State) were you can buy some groceries if need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Newbie123
Reviews.Content: This place turned out to be awesome for us. We stayed in Chicago for a week vacation during the July 4th holiday. The hotel breakfast saved us a lot of money as well as the in room refrigerator. There was a grocery store down the street, so we were able to stockpile snacks and leftovers. The location was awesome, could walk or hit the subway to go almost anywhere. One complaint I had was the sleeper sofa was very uncomfortable. They did provide a blow up mattress, but it was almost as bad. This hotel is a no frills kinda place, but if your looking for a nice place to sleep and hang out as well as a great breakfast every morning then consider this place on your next stay in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Good for family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: pickymoms07
Reviews.Content: Nice to have suite-fridge handy. Two rooms worked well. Pull out ok for kids-blow up "roll a way" deflated each night and became a source of etertainment for kids who didn't seem to mind. Aside from a bit of grout in the bathroom, room very clean. King bed very comfortable. BF very good-evening meal adequate for kids "fuel" not flavour-however very handy, much appreciated and helped with holiday cost. Able to pack peanut butter sandwiches and fruit to go. Staff great, woman in dining room for breakfast VERY nice- stay ended up costing less than expected-valet parking included. Good location. Will stay again! To get to MIchigan Ave, walk back a block (Ohio) to avoid going under street and up the stairs-took a day for us to figure this out :) Free internet in business centre for research bus times etc... including freee printing wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: family5tx
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip to Chicago and our time at the Homewood Suites Chicago Downtown. We came to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and had our nursing infant with us too. Everyone was wonderful...Starr at the front desk was great and helped us out a lot....also all of the bellman at the desk when you walk in and out were very friendly and nice to us throughout our stay. They were always very complimentary of our infant daughter and were willing to take photos for us when asked too. The housekeeping staff were wonderful also. Since we had our infant daughter with us, it was nice to have such a nice room with a seperate bedroom for us and have the pack -n- play they provided for her out in the living room area. We enjoyed having the fridge and kitchen too. We had a great room with a wonderful view on the 17th floor. We had a corner room, so we had a little bigger room and wonderful views out our windows...I especially like the clock tower. We needed dish soap, not dishwasher soap, so that we could wash our baby's dishes and they were quick to bring us a small bottle so that we could do that. We would be very likely to stay here again, if we come back to Chicago, especially if we had our other kids with us too. The service was great and we enjoyed it very much and the location was great also. Although we did not always take advantage of it, it was nice to have the breakfast available each morning and the meals in the evening...to help save money. I would recommend this hotel greatly to anyone going to Chicago and wanting to be in a good location downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Star-Framily
Reviews.Content: The good: The hotel is close to Michigan Avenue and shopping. The free trolley that takes you to the Navy Pier is just outside the hotel. The one bedroom suite was clean, large and had a wonderful kitchen. The staff were knowledgeable and friendly. The cleaning staff - friendly and hardworking. We had a missing piece to our coffee pot and it was sent up to our room almost immediately. The breakfast was good (waffles, toast, bacon, eggs, cereal) and the staff were very welcoming. The "light dinner" (weekdays) was great too - beef stew, pasta, etc. - we choose to eat in 3 of 4 nights. We had an exteneded check out time. The OK: Main reception in on the 6th floor. Elevators are busy - especially at check-in/out time and meal times. The bathroom is huge, but the toilet and bathtub/shower are in one room and the sink is outside with the bedroom which can be a little noisy to use at night - especially when you are sharing. The internet kept dropping off our ipods. Not sure what this was about and we were using it for directions and checking email only, so we didn't report the problem. The bad: To the woman who screamed at her 6 year old son in the pool because he wouldn't jump in the deep end and dog paddle: It might behoove you to actually get in the pool with your son. You told him that "he didnt want to be a failure?". He was crying. Your children and my children were upset. My husband was there alone with our children. He didn't want to insert himself into an already bitter situation. He and my children were disgusted with you and left. I hope you see this and upgrade your behaviour ! It was the only bad spot in the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cawwac
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days. Arrived early on Amtrak expecting to have the hotel hold our luggage...but we were thrilled that our room was available. (booked specific room we wanted the night before on Hilton's web site - very convenient) The staff at this hotel were simply the best. From our first entrance at the front door, to the check in staff, dining room staff, cleaning staff...all extremely helpful and kind! Star (from front desk) and Connie (dining room staff) you two were amazing....not with just us...but with everyone. The location of the hotel is so convenient. The restaurants and shops are an easy walk. The Red Line is a one minute walk away - a super fast and cheap way to travel....24 hour pass for $5.75 - we used it to go to the theatre district and out to Lincoln Park area...super easy. Our room was very clean and comfortable. It is an older property but is kept up well. Two flat screen tv's...one in bedroom - the other in the living room. Kitchen with full size fridge was great to have...breakfast was great...only had the evening meal once - it was good...complimentary cold draft beer or wine - perfect...beer with nacho chips and salsa before we went out for a late dinner...perfect. Free wi-fi We did use the pool....great view of city on 19th floor. Overall - loved the hotel...missing Chicago already.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rain7711
Reviews.Content: My husbandand I stayed at the Homewood Suites Chicago Downtown along with our two years old daughter. We travel three to four times a year. I have been to Chicago several times and I have to admit that the Homewood suites excells in the Cutomer Service department. The location was good, shopping and resturants in walking distance. The rooms were spacious and clean yet standard furniture. We had a great view from our room, the bed was comfortable and they made sure that a crib was available for our child. Check in was smooth. Our interaction was mostly with the Concierge/bell men who were very charming, helpful and friendly in particular Amir. I applaude the hotel for recruiting such personnel. The Homewood Suites offers a breakfast daily and dinner from M-F. The breakfast and dinner were average as far as selection and taste, lacked creativity and flavour, but gracious enough from the hotel to offer for free. It helps a lot if you have kids with you and if you are traveling on a budget. I highly recommend gettng rid of the carnation plant, it gives the room a very cheap look, could very well be replacebale by something more modern. I also believe that the manager can certainly bring some outside-the-box creativity to the hotel," a balloon to a child could equal a basket of chocolate and champagne to an adult :)The Homewood Suites Chicago downtown is not the J.W. Marriott or the Ritz Carlton, its not the plush and elegence that you'de experience in the Sutton Place, it doesnt have the striking architecture and the contemporary design, but I can gaurantee you that the staff at this hotel have the spirit to serve.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for families!”
Reviews.Author: John43214
Reviews.Content: Decided to go with this hotel after seeing it was the best rated for families on TripAdvisor. I would agree wholeheartedly. Location is excellent. Included breakfast is excellent. The rooms are excellent - having the suite allows you to close the door and let the kids go to bed without having to sit in the dark. Full fridge, microwave dishwasher, sink, table so you can easily keep milk/food for the week or just get takeout and eat in the room when you can't face another night of waiting for a table with hungry kids. The valet/concierge staff was the best I've ever experienced. They were all extremely nice and helpful, it was the same crew every day so we felt comfortable with them and most importantly, they very friendly to kids. Especially a man named Adbul - he remembered our kids (4 and 6) every time we came in or out and joked around with them, which made them feel very special. Room was clean and well maintained. To be honest and objective, the first day we were there there was a hair on one of the towels which freaked my wife out, but I didn't think it was a huge deal and it didn't happen again. We had to call for extra towels every night instead of them just leaving them for us when they cleaned the room, but they always brought them up right away. But these are minor points - overall excellent. The pool is on the 19th floor with big windows with city view. The kids were excited but with the sunshine it felt like a sauna so we didn't spend time there. But it was as nice as any hotel pool I've seen. Read the comments about the fact that they only have 2 elevators which caused some people delays, but I have to say we didn't experience that at all - the elevators always came right away even during peak times. Shuttle to Navy Pier drops you off right in front of the hotel. We walked into Phil Stefani's Italian restaurant around the corner and while it was a higher end restaurant, they welcomed us with our kids in our shorts and we had a great meal. The hotel is right across from a hotel with great shopping. Highly recommend the Lego Store. We went to the Legoland play center in Schaumburg the next day (highly recommend) and you can buy tickets at the store in the mall for a great discount. Saved us $28. Easy walk to Michigan Ave. My wife and daughter did the whole American Girl thing and had a great time. Overall a really excellent hotel that we will definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “A great value right in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: d13Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our family reunion and a wedding from reviews on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. The location was perfect and the staff friendly and helpful. We enjoyed both the breakfasts and the evening meals, a plus for budget-conscious families. The kids especially enjoyed the pool.

Reviews.Title: “This place feels more like home, than home itself..........”
Reviews.Author: Onemiamiman
Reviews.Content: I have been a road warrior most of my professional life. Hotels that I have stayed in range from The Peninsula in Hong Kong to a half-star motel in Red Oak, Iowa. All that being said, I have got to say that nowhere have I felt more welcomed, looked-after and important as I did in this wonderful Chicago hotel. The staff is multi-ethnic and multi-cultural, but you feel like one of them, regardless of who you are or where you are coming from. Three people come to mind that I would like to point out: Lorena, at the Front Desk, Rosario, in the Guest Dining Area and Ivan, in the Lower Lobby Entrance.This hotel works like a symphonic orchestra conducted by Leonard Bernstein. Everybody, and I mean everybody is a virtuoso and I am a better person for having met and stayed at such a wonderful establishment. If you could rate this hotel 12 stars, that would have been my rating.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: Kay1210
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel and everything was wonderful. Great location walking distance to most everywhere. Navy Pier shuttle came right down our street. Breakfast and supper buffet delicious, with many choices all included in price and served on regular dishes not paper. Staff very helpful in every way. Our one bedroom suite was roomy and equipped with all that was needed to make it a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: bretts11
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the size of the standard one-bedroom rooms at this hotel. The room has a small kitchen fully stocked with all the appliances you could ever need on the road. The living room area is also in a separate room from the bedroom. This hotel offers free dinner on weekdays that includes beer and wine. However, the food is sometimes a little suspect and I wouldn't recommend eating there each night. The breakfast on the other hand has always been positive. The hotel is located several blocks north of the Chicago River and is only one block away from a red line stop. There are tons of restaurants with several blocks, and Michigan Avenue is only a couple of blocks away as well. Highly recommended. I've had very little interaction with hotel staff during my stays here, so I can't attest to their helpful ness. The rooms have always been very clean, no issues there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: vacationtraveller_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything other Trip Advisor users said it was - clean, comfortable, fantastic staff. The pool has a great view and is WARM. Complimentary breakfast and dinner are more than just toast and cereal - very good! Location is terrific - easy walk to heart of Mag Mile and less than two blocks from the train. Only downsides were the size of the living area - the fold out couch literally scraped against the TV stand, the lack of counter space in the bathroom, and the slow WiFi (but slow and free WiFi is better than none!)

Reviews.Title: “Overall great price”
Reviews.Author: clarkj3
Reviews.Content: Where else can you stay in a suite in Chicago 3 blocks from the Pier and get 2 free meals a day? This hotel offers breakfast and dinner(w/ wine or beer) during the week & pretty good too. The Free Pier Bus stops 1 block away and Joe's famous seafood is a few doors down. The staff was absolutely wonderful; they bent over backwards to accomodate quests. The neighborhood seemed quite safe and we were able to walk to a nearby jazz club. Great prices for AAA members.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the $ and great location”
Reviews.Author: Shawn R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May of 2010 and . The staff were exceptional from start to finish and any questions we had were answered by the friendly door and front desk staff. The hotel is located very close to most major tourist attractions and we walked to all of the places that we wanted to see downtown without much trouble at all. We checked out the downtown area and visited Millennium Park, the Art Museaum, and many other places. The bellhops were always a great place to get information about the popular bars and hang-out places in the area. This area is also very close to public transportation should you need to go a bit further than walking distance. The rooms were nice. Although you could tell that not everything was brand new, it was all in very good shape. The beds were super comfy and the suite we stayed in had a full kitchenette including microwave, fridge with freezer, some cooking utensils, etc. There was a tv in the bedroom and one in the living room type area off the kitchenette. The bathroom did not have much in the way of counter space, but it was fine and served it's purpose. The view from our particular room was not the greatest, but that was okay as we had other options for taking in the view of the city skyline by visiting the pool on the upper level or just off of the lobby during breakfast and happy hour times. They also have a checklist on the fridge where you can have the staff pick up a few items from the market for you that they bring to your room. I believe there is a small fee for this, but am not positive as we did not use this service. The beautiful pool was located on the 19th floor and afforded a fantastic view of the skyline, especially at night. There was usually nobody or just a few people in the pool when we visited and it was nice and relaxing - very clean and well maintained. There was also a small fitness center right off of this that we did not get the chance to use. This hotel serves a full buffet style breakfast that was positively delicous with something for everyone's taste. They also serve a happy hour "snack" and drinks during the week, which was more of a meal than a snack with unlimited wine and beer in addition to the "snack." There was more than enough included with this to count as a full meal. We stayed for happy hour twice and could not believe the set-up they provided (see pics). There is also a business center that I had used to map out some places for us to visit while here and a small gift shop type of area that had a few misc. items for sale. Parking was a bit expensive, but it is like that everywhere downtown. We parked in the self parking area next to the hotel and saved a few dollars over vallet parking, but even figuring in the price of parking, we felt we got a great value and have already recommended this place to friends. All in all, this was a great value and I would not hestiate to stay again if we wanted to be near downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: amandajs80
Reviews.Content: Everything was top notch, the location is perfect, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the breakfast was delicious...but go early to avoid the crowd. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do. There is a trolley a block from the hotel to Navy Pier, Blue Chicago is an awesome blues club right around the corner...and dining at Quartino and Phil Stefani's was unforgettable! The rooms have great views and were extremely comfortable, we had 2 rooms and there was 7 of us, everyone loved it. Add valet ahead of time with their park n play package if you are driving from nearby, but if you are flying in...don't even bother getting a rental car...you wont need it. Homewood Suites was the best deal and the best location!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: toga1k
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property in April on business, but wife and teenage son also tagged along for the trip. There is not much that had not been said by other reviewers. So I'll just summarized our experiences at this hotel was much more than I had expected, with great service, location, decent room,wonderful breakfast and last but not least, the happy hour food and drinks! What a great value in Chicago. Would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: amofam
Reviews.Content: My family and I hv visited Chicago many times and all agree Homewood is the best. The staff is wonderful, but Jennifer at the front desk was outstanding. She went out of her way to take excellent care of my family's needs (thank you!) We took the free trolley right on the corner to Navy pier, walked one block to catch the train for a Cubs game, and walked to Am Girl and nearby restaurants. We found the elevator wait time par for a downtown hotel and, in fact, better than some hotels we have stayed in. The free breakfast is a great value, and although it did get busy, Connie cheerfully kept it moving. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, in fact when we got in the cab my husband decided we should turn around and stay another day - wish we could have, but we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: willsjams
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites is on my list to return to on our next visit. We were 1/2 a block to the free trolley to the Navy Pier and within a block to the best shopping around - Nordstroms, Macy's, Sacs, Neiman Marcus, etc. We had a queen suite w/a full kitchen, living area and separate bedroom. Living room furniture was a bit worn, but sleeper bed was comfortable as could be - great pillows and bed was comfy too. The biggest surprise was the Welcome Home reception from 5-7 - it was a full meal, not just snacks and drinks. Deli sandwiches, soup, salad, beer & wine the night we were there. The monthly menu is posted on the fridge. What a great value for families who have spent the day running around and spending their money at all the attractions or business people who just want to stay in after a long day. Very easy to get to and the staff was helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location, staff!”
Reviews.Author: bhdevault
Reviews.Content: We went on a family weekend, and I booked hotel for the location to the Mag Mile and transportation, little did I know how great the staff would be also. The hotel is clean, has wonderful breakfast/dinner, AMAZING employees, also the location is great too. There was an employee named Connie that greeted us in the morning for breakfast and was an absolute wonderful person, made you feel right at home, hopefully the company realizes what an asset she is. Our room was right across from the elevator and never heard it once, probably the best night sleep I have had in a hotel. The staff at the front desk was also very helpful with questions about the city. I will have a hard time staying anywhere else when visiting chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there for our daugther's Chicago wedding”
Reviews.Author: HappyAnniversary
Reviews.Content: WOW! This hotel was AMAZING! From the time I began talking with Vanessa who helped us plan the hospitality room, to the minute we walked into the hotel and were greeted with a bottle of wine with Vanessa's, "Don't worry, I'll take care of getting the note in the hospitality bag," to the delicious food and fabulous service we received, we knew we were in good hands. This hotel caters to people. We had a fabulous hospitality room in our son's room where there was plenty of room for guests attending the wedding to meet and greet each other. The staff was wonderful. They brought up extra chairs. We needed ice; they went into the kitchen and got us ice. There was a delicious dinner at the hotel-FREE!!! The breakfasts were delicious!!!
