After the wedding, we returned to the hotel. Guess what was there? Cheese and crackers and champagne, congratulating us on our daughter's marriage! Vanessa thought of everything!!! This was a wonderful experience! We loved the hotel. The location is great-only about 15 minutes from Millenium Park, near Macy's, right by Nordstron's and Magnificent Mile, and near terrific restaurants. It was a tremendous experience-probably the most accommodating hotel I have ever been to (and I have been to many hotels). Thank you for making the weekend so special!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality”
Reviews.Author: pikappdmc
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. I came in for a wedding and after a horrible experience with United Airlines it was nice to be around people that actually understood what customer service means. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could stay longer!!”
Reviews.Author: Ginny1126
Reviews.Content: The title of the hotel says it all-- this hotel feels like home! I loved the large suites with pull-out couch with a door separating the living room/kitchen from the bedroom. The bathroom was spacious and luxurious. Also, the service was impecable. We arrived late at night (or morning as it were) and the concierge greeted us and offered us complimentary water since we had such a difficult time traveling! Also they allowed us to check out late since our flight wasn't until Sunday evening. Overall, I wish I could have stayed longer to enjoy the amenities and comfortable setting.

Reviews.Title: “(Almost) The best part of our first visit to Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: lisamarieFLA
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and still want to feel totally spoiled-stay here! Awesome breakfast, great room, super nice staff, and great view! Even a free dinner Mon-Thurs-food being pretty good with free beer and wine, if you are tired and just want to eat in at the hotel or want to save your cash. Lots of Europeans eating it-doing the European plan thing! Nice room with living room sofa bed for my college age son, and luxurious bed in the bedroom with bath. Two nice flat screen TVs, and in room coffee. Used our Hilton Points-40K a night-a lot for points but well worth it for our two nights. Parking was $42 extra-and that is the usual rip off price for all of Chicago-not the hotel's fault. My only complaint would be that there are only two elevators and you have to wait a few minutes to get around since the place is always packed-and people as always will be rude and will smash you in to get a ride-we joked that maybe they need to police the elevators? Try to get the 7th floor and you can just take one flight down to eat etc. since lobby is on 6th floor. Great location-close to Michigan Ave and you can see pretty much all on foot from this base, or if your feet wear out-taxis are plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite Downtown”
Reviews.Author: bjpremierontheroad
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our teenage son so we try to look for suites when we can. We've had good luck with Homewood Suites as well as most Embassy suites. In this case the location was excellent and it was a little less then the Embassy Suites. Everything was like new and comfortable. The staff was nice. Like all downtown hotels it's still expensive but not more than anything else that's decent. The breakfast was good, though a little crowded. Again, if you are not used to it be ready to pay dearly for valet parking and help with your luggage. The only problem we had was that we got some poor advice about how long the wait would be at some of the nearby restaurants. It was the 4th of July weekend and the city was really crowded so maybe it was worse than it would normally be. Get restaurant reservatiions early when you can to be safe. From the hotel we walked to Millinium Park and the Art Institue to the south. Walked north up the magnificent mile to the Hancock building. Walked east to the Navy Pier. Good location. Note: of all the things we did we enjoyed the architechural boat tour on the river the most.

Reviews.Title: “Great homebase at Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: WakingLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood suites July 9th-11th. The hotel was a little tricky to find, just a small red awning to mark the entrance. The entrance is not much to look at but don't let that deter you. The main check in is on the 6th floor and is very nice looking. The layout of the room was great. Plenty of room, a living room area, a kitchen area, a table. Plus the bedroom/bathroom. The beds were comfortable. Showers had good pressure. Toilets flushed well. The subway system is only a block away. It's the red line 'grand' stop. There are plenty of sites and restaurants within walking distance (P.F. Changs, Rock Bottom, Shaw's Crab Shack (great!!), the Lux Cafe, just to name a few). Completely walkable to the Magnificent Mile. We walked to the Architecture walking tour meeting place, the Art institute, and The John Hancock Observatory. We took a cab to Zanies to see some stand up comedy, the cab was about $10. We also took a cab to the United Center for about $15. Also, about $40 cab ride from/to the airport. It was very convenient. We had breakfast two times at Homewood. It was good. Adequate for breakfast. Eggs, pastries, bacon/ sausage, fruit, cereal. We did go to West Egg for breakfast one morning, which is about 4 blocks away. Also, very good (if you want more options for breakfast). We did not have dinner at Homewood, so I can't speak to the quality of dinner. The staff downstair were great. Very helpful with getting cabs and offering advice. One gentleman recognized us every time we passed. He talked with us about our plans and offered very helpful advice. Really excellent service. We were able to use the computers and print our flight boarding passes for our trip home at no extra charge. Comfortable computer room. The only drawbacks: I would have liked a second sink for the room/bathroom area. The elevators were very crowded in the morning. The breakfast area where the food is located is a bit small (but the staff were very good about crowd management). Overall, I thought this was a great hotel for sightseeing as a couple or with family.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Uskottumies
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 9 nights in May. Overall, I'm very pleased with hotel. The rate was great ($ 139 per). The suite was very spacious, it had a separate living room and a bedroom, and a kitchenette. The kitchenette was very useful. Every appliance (dishwasher, 2-burner stove, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker) functioned properly. We didn't encounter any problems during our stay. A flatscreen tv in both rooms was a plus. The location is perfect, if you want explore the city. River North is a great neighborhood. Michigan Avenue was about two blocks away, Nordstrom and the Shops at Northbridge mall was across the street. Shopping options are limitless in downtown Chicago, the Mag Mile was excellent, as was Macy's on State Street in the Loop. It was an easy walk to the Loop across the river. A Red Line subway stop was one block to the west on Grand Avenue. Jewel Osco (grocery store) was one block away from the hotel, and it was convenient to buy groceries there and keep the refrigerator stocked. The clerk at the check-in was professional, friendly and welcoming. The personnel in the dining room was friendly when we went to the complimentary breakfast. Housekeeping did a great job. Overall, the personnel did a very good job. Often hotel elevators work only with a keycard. Not with this property, anybody could enter the elevator and use it. But there were always hotel personnel downstairs near the elevator entrance, and we didn't see any unwanted characters wandering in the hotel. But I would prefer a keycard system for the elevator or something like that. During busier times the hotel could use some more elevators. Overall, Chicago is a great city, and this hotel is a reasonably priced, good quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The service was as if I was staying at a luxury 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bdevries411
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Comfortable, Spacious Room. Great View. Decent Food. Incredible Service. I travel frequently and HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The great reviews set my expectations too high”
Reviews.Author: Liz1030
Reviews.Content: Based on all the great reviews, I think my expectations were too high for this hotel. It's certainly clean and the breakfast was a plus. However, if you generally stay in better hotels, this hotel will be really disappointing. I should have known based on the good price we got ($188 a night AAA rate), but the reviews and the website were both so good, I thought I was getting a much higher end hotel for a bargain of a price. While the staff tries really hard and is very friendly, the services and amenities at the hotel are really lacking. We arrived at 10 pm when the hotel was relatively quiet but our bags did not make it up to the room for close to an hour (and only after I called twice and offered to come get my kids' bags so I could change them into pjs and put them to sleep). My young son wet the bed during an afternoon nap and I called the front desk to advise them and ask for it to be cleaned as we were leaving the room at 4:30 and would return later that evening. When we arrived back in the room at night around 10 pm, no one had come to change the bed sheets and the front desk told me that they had forgotten about it. We again waited about an hour for someone to come a change the sheets (again only after I called 4 times and offered to come get the sheets myself to change the bed so that I could put my kids to sleep). The hotel comped us a nightâ€™s stay for the hassle. The pool area is in need of repair and only sometimes had towels stocked. Each time I called for towels it took at least an hour for someone to come. Our shampoo was not regularly restocked and we ran out on the last night of our stay. We called the front desk and asked for more shampoo, which the front desk advised would be outside our door by morning -- it never arrived. The bedroom is too tight as is the bathroom. The living area is spacious. All in all, while this is a neat, clean and very reasonably priced hotel, if you like amenities and service at all, this hotel will disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel as if you are right at home!”
Reviews.Author: LauraRoyFink
Reviews.Content: As soon as you enter the hotel, the aroma of cinnamon & apples surrounds you . There is certainly a small town feel to this large hotel located in 1 of the best cities in the world.Staff are attentive and courteous, and will assist you with whatever your needs may be. The location is excellent, with many restaurants & shops within walking distance. Our room was equipped with a full kitchen which would make it a great situation for a family who may not want to spend a ton of money on city meals. Additionally, a generous breakfast is served every morning; dinner ( beer & wine included) is served Mondays-Thursdays. There is a server named Connie, who goes out of her way to make you feel special. She went above & beyond to make our stay as comfortable as she possibly could. What an outstanding woman & assett to this establishment! I would highly recommend this hotel, particulary if you are traveling with children. By the way, the hotel does have a pool & gym which I did not use, but heard good things about.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a terrific position in central Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LynnManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week in this Chicago hotel which surpassed our expectations and is fantastic value for a central position close to all the superb attractions of this wonderful city. We were given a terrific suite with a large lounge and kitchenette with TV. Very good bedroom with a wonderful view over the cityscape - which we never tired of looking at - also with TV. NIce bathroom and separate area with wardrobes/washbasin. We were very happy there. The breakfast was extremely generous and well-cooked. For 4 evenings there was supper included (with wine) which was very welcome. There are constant free hot drinks available and a small shop which comes in very useful - all this helps to keep the cost of the holiday down. Every member of staff was unfailingly charming and helpful. So, we have very fond memories of this hotel and would like to thank everyone there for helping to make our holiday so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, as usual”
Reviews.Author: sue-manchester
Reviews.Content: Our third stay at the Homewood Suites Chicago proved to be just as great as the previous two. The staff are consistently friendly, polite and professional - and this applies whether they are working at the front door, servicing the rooms, managing the breakfast room or on the reception desk. They genuinely seem happy to be working here and can't do enough for their guests. The rooms are large and clean and seem to have good insulation from each other (we didn't hear a thing from our neighbours and the hotel was quite busy). The hotel is well placed for walking to the shops on Michigan Ave, or catching a bus or subway. There is a Jewel Osco and a Trader Joes each within a couple of blocks, which are perfect for stocking up on groceries etc. My husband heartily recommends 'Binnies Beverage Depot' for a huge variety of beer. Now all we need is an excuse to return to Chicago next year - then we can make it four years on the run at the Homewood Suites, because we wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: travellove28
Reviews.Content: This is a great place tfor everyone. I was here on business travel and found that this hotel far exceeded my expectations. The business center is great and has free computers with free internet access, as well as printers. The fitness center and pool are on the top floor and, at night, have fantastic views of the city lights. Both breakfast and dinner (with beer and wine) are complimentary. The location is great -- one block from the Red line, and walking distance to just about everything. It appears to be a very safe area. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a clean, incredibly comfortable, roomy suite with lots and lots of free amenities. . And, yes, you can believe all these favorable comments.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, met all of my needs, staff extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl59_10
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a week of business travel. I had never stayed at a Homewoods Suites before but will not hesitate to use this Hilton chain in the future. This is not a 'fancy' hotel, with over the top decor or unnecessary potted plants and the like. The suites are equipped with a kitchen, and essentials to maintain a normal living enviornment, for singles and family. Meals are served in a central area, both AM and evening, with wine and beer, and are certainly sufficient to maintain anyone's nutrient needs. This comes as part of the room costs. The staff, all of the staff, I found to be friendly, accomodating and made my stay feel like I was almost in a 'neighborhood', not a hotel! My room was clean. The halls are not air conditioned, and the carpet is a tad bit worn, but don't let this dissuade anyone from not considering this hotel. It is in a good location for seeing Chicago for out of town'ers.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood has excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: M_G155019
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to enjoy our honeymoon in a city that neither of us had previously visited - Chicago. We had a lovely room with a fantastic view. The staff (and Toni, in particular) was exceptional in orientiing us to the city and its finest attractions. We were amazed at how accessible those attractions were from the location of the hotel. Thank you for assisting us in having a wonderful honeymoon. We plan on returning to Chicago and your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites: location, location, location; and a home away from home. Delightful in every way.”
Reviews.Author: barbarabaumann
Reviews.Content: Our son and daughter-in-law live in Chicago. They recommended Homewood Suites as the best place for their extended family to stay during our family reunion. We were delighted with their choice for us. Our room was perfect, even included a kitchen with daily popcorn supply! When we went for breakfast, we were able to join other family members who were also eating at the same time. A real plus. There was a large gathering place on the 6th floor where we could all hang out together. There were 28 of us! The staff seemed to get a real kick out of our reunion with people ranging in age from 87 to 6 years old. Jennifer was beyond wonderful. She booked our rooms on the same floor which was great. And to top it off, Nordstrom is just across the street. (An unexpected pleasure and bonus!) We'll definitely return to Homewood Suites the next time we're in Chicago. Maybe for another reunion sometime soon! We hope so. Barbara LesStrang Baumann, Indio, CA

Reviews.Title: “Perfection for the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: laceandwit
Reviews.Content: My 6 siblings, our spouses, and kids and my parents came to Chicago for the July 4th weekend and wedding celebration of my brother. At first we'd planned to stay at the Ritz-Carlton, but decided to stay at Homewood Suites and later commented it was the perfect choice for all. What did we like about it? It was clean, comfortable, accommodating, had a 2 room plus kitchen feature, fold-down couch, a great complementary breakfast, good value, the perfect location a block down from the train access and across from Nordstroms, near great restaurants like Rock Bottom, Joe's for crab, Cosis for casual lunch, the Weber Grill for steak and burger dinner, Quortinos for wedding dinner, Buccas on cattycorner for Italian dinner, (most of these were within a block) and Starbucks for morning coffee which was 2 1/2 blocks away, although the hotel supplied it for free in the lobby all day. Heather, the manager, was so warm and welcoming. The bellman located a 30 passenger kind of private bus for our family to do a 90 minute tour of Chicago and take us to the waterfront for a family picture and on to my brother's apartment. Connie, in the breakfast room, greeted me every morning with a big smile and even noticed when I was away a day. The food was plentiful, tasty, replenished quickly and our dishes cleared away. Outstanding service--I've worked in a restaurant so was impressed with how the buffet was managed. Enjoyed the casual sandwich dinner available the first night we were there. The bed was so comfortable, with great pillows. The maids were great, and worked with our schedules and needs. There was an equally comfortable lobby area where we could sit, chat and congregate as a family. Loved the kitchen feature in the rooms. Homewood Suites totally exceeded my expectations--it's not luxury, but it's all you need and actually had features that were more important to us than poshness and glitz such as location, accessibility, the breakfast, friendliness of staff, welcoming comfort and affordability so you have money for activities and fit different families budgets. Our family likes mass transit--by taking the train which was one block away to O'Hare we avoided all the O'Hare traffic and the train fare was $2.25 a person compared to $15-20 per person on a shuttle. We figured the train was quicker than taxi/shuttle as the traffic was slowed up due to the holiday weekend and our train was moving faster than the traffic when we passed it. All of my siblings were pleased with Homewood Suites as well. My sons and husband totally loved the Segway rides in Chicago, the Science and Tech museum.....it was a perfect vacation and we'll definitely stay at Homewood Suites in Chicago again. It seemed like home. My son brought his computer and was able to use it from the room to track down activities for us. Enterprise Rentals was a block away from the Hotel and was great for a day trip to Lake Geneva, Wisconsin.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel that could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel was very good during our two day stay. The breakfast was good as well. The reason I can only give it a three star is because the room (#1312) are in need of updating. The carpet is worn in places and the bathroom shower wall was in need of regrouting as evidenced by the mold and mildew in a few places. The room as a whole was ok, but just needing a little tlc. I would probably look elsewhere my next time in Chicago for a suite hotel that is a little more updated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: OhioJoAnn
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be a model for how all hotels should be run. Every member of the staff, no matter what their job was, had an excellent and friendly attitude. The rooms are extremely nice and clean. The location of the hotel is optimal for any sites and shopping. The Navy Pier is easily within walking distance but there is a free trolley just a few steps from the hotel that will take you to the Pier. I had interaction with the manager, Dave Prentiss, prior to my arrival and he could not have been more accommodating and willing to assist us regarding our inquiries. This hotel easily deserves its number one rating.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: legacy59
Reviews.Content: Hello! My name is Gary Johnson from Kentucky and I would just like to say that my family had a very comfortable stay during June 23-26. From the time we arrived at the entrance there were service with a smile! Checking in was very fast and explanatory. Auditor even took the time and asked if we needed any directions around the city. She was VERY helpful. Rooms are very clean! Not one problem. Each morning as my family entered for breakfast, we were always greeted and seated by a sweet lady name Connie. Connie was very welcoming! She even noticed that our teenage girls slept in one morning. The food was hot what needed to be and cold what needed to be, very satisfied. This is by far one of the best hotel we have stayed.We hope on our next trip that we see you all. Thanks for a relaxing stay. Sincerely, The Johnson Family

Reviews.Title: “We hit a home run with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenwill409
Reviews.Content: Our company housed personnel (some with family members) at this location while attending an annual convention. The breakfasts were right on for what people wanted and the evening receptions are a great place to relax. The rooms were clean, the personnel were friendly and professional and the location was accessible to area restaurants and entertainment. Parking was a bit expensive. Our staff highly recommends this location and when we return to the area we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids!”
Reviews.Author: TCRoadTrip
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Chicago to check out the sights with our (3) little girls, we decided on Homewood Suites - Downtown for the amenities of a suite and the convenience of the location. We were not disappointed. The hotel worked very well for a young family. The kitchenette in the suite came in handy for snacks, the complimentary breakfast was a good start to the day and the choice of the complimentary dinner at the hotel or all of the restaurants within walking distance kept us from going hungary. Getting to attaractions was relatively easy. There was a lot within walking distatnce and even more within a $10 cab ride. If you want to try something a little different, the Water Taxi located only 3 blocks away was a great way to get out to Navy Pier or the Sears Tower (sorry ... I can't bring myself to call it the Willis Tower). When we needed the car, the hotel's valet service was freindly and quick. I do have to admit that the hotel did have a problem with our reservation when we first arrived, but they quickly resolved it and went out of their way to make up for it during the remainder of the trip. Overall, we were very pleased with this Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: WHW
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times. It is number 1 on TripAdvisor because the employees are wonderful. It was like going home to see Sergio still working at the Manager's Reception. He and the others just make your day with their sincere and humble hard working ways. I must say that the young blond, female manager greeting people at the reception on the night of 6/17/10 didn't quite blend in with the rest of the employees. Maybe it was because we were so tired that her very ambitious greeting and questioning and talking hit us wrong and didn't seem very sincere. Or maybe it was watching her check herself out in the mirror each time she passed it. The work ethic at this hotel is so exemplary that we expected a manager to reflect the same. We did have to pay $200 more each night than during our last stay. We wonder if it was because it is #1 in Chicago now. We are thrifty, but still booked at the Homewood because it just makes our Chicago stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: I showed up at this hotel, and I really had a reservation at the Hilton on Michigan Ave. Within 5 minutes, they switched the reservation and got me squared around. Great Front Desk! The hotel is on a great location, clean, quiet, and has a great dinner (FREE), and breakfeast (FREE). Self parking is $35 per night (in line in downtown Chicago).

Reviews.Title: “#1 rated hotel in Chicago?? not hardly”
Reviews.Author: bookseller123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, but that is all I can say about it. Not much staff available to help with issues. Room was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToilsToTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Homewood Suites in Chicago for a conference in June 2010. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is 1 block from a subway station, which allows for quick, inexpensive transfers to O'Hare and Midway airports. It is also a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue and within walking distance or a short cab ride of major attractions. Check-in was quick and efficient. We arrived at early at 2:00, but our 1-bedroom king suite on the 17th floor was ready. The room itself was quite nice and very clean. There was a small kitchen, work table, living area with couch and flat-screen TV, a tiny separate bedroom with king bed, and a small bathroom adjacent to the bedroom with a vanity separate from the WC. We had a nice view of the Trump Building and were able to see a sliver of the river between other buildings. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was very quiet. Free WiFi! A daily buffet breakfast was included in the rate. I think it is a bit better than Hampton Inn, and has the standards including a few hot items, juice, coffee, nicely cut fresh melon, cereals, and pastries. All in all, this hotel is very respectable and a great value. Good service. At $259/night, it was among the least expensive of the convention hotels, despite being an excellent 3* property in a good location. Some of my colleagues felt a little snookered spending a lot more to stay elsewhere after hearing about our stay. I liked the fact that there were no extra expenses on our bill, as everything was included in the rate. We will likely stay here next year when our conference comes back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: klsrd
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay. The staff was outstanding. The rooms were clean and quiet. Two small suggestions: the wireless internet speed was a bit slow, I could not watch a Netflix movie, an in room safe would be a nice touch. Fitness room was small but clean. I would definite stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Now we have a Chicago Home”
Reviews.Author: ArtsAmerica
Reviews.Content: You cannot say enough good things about this hotel - hard to believe that Hilton runs it. The rooms are great - with large, complete kitchens and very comfortable beds. The hotel is not that big - so you get a lot of personalized service. The location (right downtown, near the Red Line and a great supermarket) cannot be beat. And your price includes large free breakfast, free dinner (four nights a week) and free internet. There is also a small laundry room and other amenities. We will be back - and signed up for the Hilton Honors and Credit Card to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to go "home to" at the end of the workday”
Reviews.Author: BetsyFromMiami
Reviews.Content: Everyone that works at this hotel property was super friendly and available to help us. We had a group of approximately 22 people from my company, and everyone's needs were met. The team of concierge and doormen were extremely knowledgable, and everyone at the front desk was helpful as well. We were greeted daily with smiling faces. The free breakfast and internet are an added bonus, as they were both convenient and cost efficient. This was the third time that I stayed at this property, and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay any where else”
Reviews.Author: mjacl
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest at your property. I have been staying at your property exclusively when I travel to Chicago. I have even rearranged my schedule to be able to stay at your hotel versus other hotels.The accomodations are always very nice. But my reason for choosing your property is the food and the staff. The food is always good and ample. I didn't realize how good your food was until I took a trip to Florida and stayed at four other Homewoods. Without exception, not one of the properties can compare to yours in the quality of food and the variety of foods. As for your staff, you have an excellent team from the front lobby to the front desk, to the Dining room. Jennifer, Star, and Connie know me by name and always greet me and make sure my needs are met. You can train employees on the business end of hotel matters but if they don't have those peope skills they won't be the sterling employees these three are. It is that extra touch that they all give that makes me come back time and time again. (Connie knows I like Raspberry Yogurt and always makes sure I get some and I know Jennifer will go the extra step to try and get me in when rooms are tight) There are others whose names I do not know or remember who also add to the great team you have there. In particular, the food manager (Louis?)always takes the time to stop and welcome me back and chat. I think you know you have a great team but it always is nice to hear it from someone else. the best to you MIke Stehlin

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price & location”
Reviews.Author: jcesana
Reviews.Content: It was in an ideal location for accessing restaurants, the subway lines, & many of the attractions such as Navy Pier, etc were within walking distance. The buffet breakfast & dinner Mon thru Thurs make it an ideal place for families or those on a limited budget. Having a kitchenette helped reduce expenses. The room was a nice size & the washroom was spacious. Enjoyed the pool. The decor is dated but who cares.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ruth
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel from tripadvisor reviews and I must admit when We first arrived I wondered how on earth it could have possibly got such good reviews.On first impressions the Hotel is very dated and in need of refurbishment but that said it is spotlessly clean and all the staff very friendly. Homewood suites is in an excellent position minutes from magnificent mile and all the bus routes.We bought a 7 day CTA pass for $20 so we could just hop on and off buses as we wanted. The Hotel provides free breakfast but we prefered just to have coffee and yougurt in our room. We would stay here again and would recommend it to others as long as they are aware that it is dated with old fashioned wallpaper in bedroom and bathroom but you can not beat it on housekeeping and service.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. NICEST STAFF ALL THE WAY FROM THE SALES MANAGER WHO BOOKED OUR GROUP OF 32 PEOPLE TO THE FRIENDLY DOORMEN!”
Reviews.Author: LemontLynne
Reviews.Content: Kristy - The sales manager who booked our company outing , was proffesional , polite and helpful from my initial phone call.The hotel is clean, convient and friendly. Breakfast is fresh, Staff is helpful and friendly - Especially the tall dorrman with the accent and glassses - What a great guy! My group of32, HAD ONLY COMPLIMENTS!

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: JanG3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 suites - 7 of us total. It was a real value believe me. Mon - Thurs we stayed when full hot buffet breakfast, evening cocktails & light dinner were included. Our suite was extremely clean and seemed to be cleaned as soon as we left out rooms for the day. We had plenty of towels to go around and didn't have to call for extras as we've had to do in other hotels. A plug was fixed immediately when we called it in as well. When we went to dining room, helpers went out of their way to ensure we sat together and that we had what we needed. Our overall experience was over the top. Thank you to Homewood Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherylcos
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Chicago staying here. It was located in a great spot within easy walking distance to many attractions in Chicago. Breakfast and dinner were great. All of the staff were polite and friendly. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Expat52NewMexico
Reviews.Content: stayed here 3 nights monday to thursday breakfest and evening hot snacks beer and wine inclued in price.close to very good resturants and shopping mall.went on boat tour with wendella tours got ticket then about 50 children came from school trip .we went off but came back and picked another 100 children up then it was mad.we complianed they said it was on the window that there might be children on board.we got our money back .but would of liked a quite tour.could not hear the docent .so check before if there will be lots of children on.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: el264701
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay in hotels for business, usually for weeks at a time. And Homewood Suites in Chicago really set the bar high. The entire staff at Homewood Chicago was extremely welcoming, accomodating, and went above and beyond to meet my needs. During my 5 week stay, every member of their staff was pleasant and friendly- from bell stand, to front desk, to housekeeping. I highly recommend this hotel for its great downtown location, nearby attractions, and excellent accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT ROOMS, GREAT PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: HoffaChicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the room amenities are very good. Prefer higher rooms, since the elevator arrives first. The front desk personal (Lorena, Jessica, Lisa) are great people and always ready to make you feel at home. Breakfasts are wonderful and the workers are very friendly. Congratulations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Commendation for great service given by Connie Wilson”
Reviews.Author: Visby98
Reviews.Content: While stranded in Chicago for 6 days due to the Iceland volcano activity, one of your staff went above and beyond her job description to see to it that I was well cared for. Her name is Connie Wilson - and she was my angel! My luggage had been lost in transit to Chicago by the airline, and I arrived at the hotel with minimal personal items. Connie helped me secure some basic things to get me started. Connie even gave me a bus pass so that I could easily travel out to the airport to check on my lost baggage! Every day Connie would check in with me to make sure I had all that I needed. She was always so kind and willing to listen! Her help and kind generosity and assistance really turned my stressful ordeal into a manageable stay! Heartfelt thanks to Connie!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: alank1101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Homewood suites for a short break. Staff appeared to be really concerned with your satisfaction, and complemented that with a friendly and down to earth attitude. The only problem I encountered is that the A/C did not cool, due to the exterior temps being around 40 degrees. But the room was stuffy and warm and when the window was opened, the noise from the outside was too much. So I didn't get much of a restful sleep. Maybe should visit here when the A/C is turned on, like during the summer. But then, will the a/c cool the room sufficiently if the outside temps are hot?

Reviews.Title: “Favorite, Affordable hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KermitNC
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a conference over a weekend in late April. I chose to stay here (and not at the conference hotel which is a 10 minute walk) because my family and I have stayed here before and had a great experience. And the price was very reasonable, $129 for a 1 BR suite. This hotel is located in the heart of Chicago. It is only 1 block from the subway and 2 blocks from the famous Michigan Avenue. Navy Pier is about Â½ mile away, but certainly walk-able on a nice day. If not, buses or trolleys are easy to catch. Hotel Amenities Check in was quick and easy. Parking at the hotel and anywhere downtown is very expensive, so I highly recommend getting a very affordable public transportation pass so you can take buses and trains (including to/from airport) everywhere. The hotel has a pool, workout room and laundry facilities. As with all Homewood Suites, breakfasts are good and free. There is also free good food in the evenings Monday through Thursdays. There is not hotel restaurant but tons of restaurants are within a few blocks. Accommodation I stayed in a 1-BR suite by myself so had lots of room. It had a kitchen with full-size refrigerator, granite cook top, coffee maker and microwave. Furniture and dÃ©cor were not fancy but pleasantly adequate. Bed was quite comfortable. There were flat-panel TVs in the living room and bedroom. Room was clean and everything was in working order. Wi-Fi / wired Internet was reasonably fast and free. There was no safe in the room. I did not notice any noise from the hall, especially if I closed the bedroom door at night. Noise that came from outside (e.g. police sirens and cars honking) was an unavoidable part of being in any major city. Summary This is my favorite hotel in Chicago. Prices are very reasonable, especially given the size of the accommodation, location, and amenities. It is a great place to stay for families and business people alike. I would not hesitate to stay here again next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price - family vacation with small kids.”
Reviews.Author: TeamIguana
Reviews.Content: All of the previous positive reviews of this hotel were quite accurate. We just spent a week in Chicago for a vacation travelling with two kids, one of whom is just a toddler. This hotel met our needs perfectly as it is in a very central location: Just a block from the metro Red Line and a few blocks (cutting through the mall across the street) to the Magnificent Mile and all the bus lines available. We avoided the $42/day valet fee and just used those funds and the car rental funds to pay for our airport shuttle and transit passes. We came out well ahead that way. This hotel also comes with a microwave, stovetop, toaster and full refrigerator. It also comes with a daily breakfast consisting of scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage/bacon, cut and whole fruits, bagels, etc. And on Monday through Thursday they provide what they call a light meal from 5pm-7pm. This was something simple like make your own fajitas one night or pasta marinara another night. As another reviewer commented, it is free and if you don't care for it, simply head out and get something else. The hotel is literally within a block of multiple restaurants including PF Changs, Buca di Beppo, ESPN Sports Zone, Pizzeria Uno, a food court in the Nordstrom mall across the street (which oddly seemed to shut down around 6pm) and a bunch of fairly high end looking steak houses and other restaurants. If you want to use the kitchen facilities in the room there was an Osco Jewel affiliated full grocery store a block and a half away to the west. The staff was extremely helpful. They front desk staff were always extremely helpful and took note that we were a family and catered their advice to us based on this. I was surprised when I mentioned food allergy concerns and they whipped out a list of restaurants in the area that would be preferred. They also gave us great tips on using public transportation in the area and simply navigating Downtown. The hotel itself is a bit old but seemed to fit in to the area as Chicago is an old city. There were some quirks about the room such as the dishwasher not draining fully or the doors to the bedroom being a little off center but nothing we could not live with. Interestingly, the hotel lobby is on the 6th floor and the rooms continue all the way up to the 19th floor. We never figured out what occupied floors 1-5. The 19th floor also housed the swimming pool and small fitness center. The swimming pool had a fairly panoramic view of the northwest and southwest ends of the hotel. We intentionally chose a corner room on the opposite end (southeast corner) which had views of the Trump Tower and Hancock Building. There are many other tall buildings in Downtown so do not expect a great skyline view but it was still great for the kids to look our at day or night. Overall, this hotel gave us great access to all the sights we wanted to see with all the ammenities we needed at a price we were very happy with. What more could we ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: yoshi81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites in Chicago for 3 nights in March 2010. The hotel was great at all levels. The location is great (just one street off the Magnificent Mile), the suite was big, with a kitchen and really clean. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was perfect (included in the price, like the dinner). And the view from the suite was just amazing :-) Stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our purpose!”
Reviews.Author: therevTampa_Florida
Reviews.Content: We had a block of 10 rooms for a family wedding. The suites, breakfast buffet, location to the Midway airport, and location for tourists to walk the city could not have been better! The staff was pleasant and accommodating. The brunch food was very good and especially bountiful! The suites allowed family to gather together to visit and share stories. A private room was allotted to us to hold a family (about 30) brunch before everyone departed for home. Our weekend could not have been better and the Homewood Suites was one of the main contributors to our very pleasant stay in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Ruddiger23
Reviews.Content: Really friendly and helpful front desk staff. The breakfast is pretty good and the if you stay Monday through Thursday you get dinner as will. The dinners are simple but you also get free wine and beer. Just one street off the Magnificent Mile and right next to the "Grand" subway station. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me a lot of trips to disney...lots of kids, mediocre food, crowded”
Reviews.Author: aporshin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice (bearable) for what it seems to advertise...space for families, food served, clean, pool on the top floor. In addition, the staff is very, very friendly and seems to keep up with the guests needs. Here are the drawbacks we found traveling with three of our children, 1) the lobby is almost non-existant so you are confined to your room when in the hotel, which is a small hotel. 2) Possibly because it was spring break for some, the hotel was crowded with families and small children. This makes breakfast troublesome and the elevators very slow and packed with strollers. 3) The food is kid-friendly but not what adults might like (frozen pizza) and the breakfast is the same everyday. There is box wine and draft beer for happy hour. On day three, we couldn't eat another scrambled egg with cheese or danish from a box. The cereal was all stale everyday and seemed to be a value brand of frosted flakes, froot loops. 4) The rooms are not as spacious as they appear online. They do have a nice set up with the kitchen but most of it seems like overkill. A dishwasher... there are only four plates in the cupboard so who needs to run an entire dishwasher? 5) It's just not a tall enough hotel to have a good view from windows. We were told we would have a lovely view of the tribune building but we just saw a parking garage out the window. Normally, not an issue but there is nowhere else to go in the hotel to hang out. We have stayed at the embassy suites in dwntn. Chicago and the hotel is much nicer in terms of space and breakfast. If this hotel had great rates, it would be worth it. But in my opinion, if you take the time to get away with your family, other hotels in Chicago have a much nicer appeal for about the same money. In all, this hotel screams value from the interior so if the rates are a value too and you are looking to save some money on a clean room, go for it. But if you like something comparable to a Marriott, Westin, or even one of the finer Chicago hotels, you will not like this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: CrissyB
Reviews.Content: We visited the Homewood Suites for a three day weekend trip to Chicago. We specifically chose a hotel with a suite set up as we were traveling with a 5 month old and 17 year old. We needed a little extra space and kitchen facilities to prepare bottles for the baby. The room worked out perfect. Was a little tight to fit all our many baby related items but was just what we were looking for with accomodations. The daily breakfast provided was an added bonus which we thoroughly enjoyed. The hotel location was great. Centrally located in the downtown area. Easy to walk to surrounding areas as well as easily accessible to buses, taxis, subway, whatever means of travel you want. :) The main reason I felt it necessary to provide a review of the hotel was the staff. They were just fabulous! So friendly, helpful and thoughful. The bellmen staff was particulary wonderful, always welcoming us back, asking how our day was and providing assistance when needed. The front desk staff was also very helpful answering questions. Every time we would see any of the hotel staff whether it be in the hallways, elevators or at breakfast they were all so friendly and making sure that we had everything we needed. We will definitely stay there again based on such great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to bring the kids!”
Reviews.Author: taseas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, Lorena at front desk was outstanding. Close to American Girl and other shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Made me look good in front of executives during our training seminar.”
Reviews.Author: DetroitChicagoGuy
Reviews.Content: Last year, I stayed over 60 nights at the Homewood and I already have 15 nights this year. Recently, we hosted a training seminar about two weeks ago with 25 attendees. The attendees came in from various parts of the U.S. and they were impressed by the location, the hotel and the staff. During our event, the staff was overwhelmingly accommodating to our needs including the set up of the training room, receiving and storing materials and welcoming the group. When it came to making adjustments to snacks and lunches, the staff responded quickly and effectively regardless of their title or position. All the attendees, including our executive members, complemented me for choosing the Homewood Suites. Their comments included "friendly staff", "excellent location" and "great value". From someone who works on developing teams in a manufacturing environment, I saw firsthand the how the Homewood's teamwork fulfills their guests expectations and requirements. Thanks to the Homewood staff form making me look good.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: p4nna
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic, and i mean it when I stay that I won't stay anywhere else when I visit Chicago again! The hotel was great on all levels. All staff were friendly and ready to help if I needed anything. My room was great - it had everything I coud need for a 'home away from home' and was clean (and I'm very fussy on this aspect!). The breakfast buffet was what you would expect , with enough variety for people to find something to start their day off with! I have read from people that they weren't overly impressed with the evening buffet, and though It wasn't the best selling point of the hotel, I definately wouldnt rate the hotel lower for this reason as to be honest, the fact that it is even offered in the first place is an added bonus as I have never been to a hotel before that offers this! It is one of those things that is there - if you like it, then that's great, but if you dont, then you go elsewhere for dinner and you're not really at a loss as you wouldn't have it at any thoer hotel anyway - so no loss either way! In addition, i loved the fact that it wasn't a problem if you wanted to take your breakfast/dinner up to your room. this wouldnt really be acceptable in most hotels and you might get some funny looks, but perfectly acceptable here :-) Location of Homewood Suites was brilliant. Most tourist attractions were easily reachable either by walking, or just a short distance away on a bus or the CTA. I was a bit worried about safety, being a girl on my own, in a city i didn't really know, but I felt surprisingly fine, and the staff were great with advice on any concerns i had. I am usually quite a difficult guest to please but I couldn't have been more pleased with my stay at this hotel - full marks - plus they have the most amazing pillows and gave me the best sleep i have had in ages! I might have to go back to Chicago just to stay here again!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place, especially for families”
Reviews.Author: Midwest maiden
Reviews.Content: My husband I had a room plus we got one for his son, who joined us for the weekend. The rooms are actually suites, with a microwave, full refrigerator w/ ice maker, a 2 stove top burner, kitchen sink and dishwasher and a table with chairs in the kitchen area! This is a great hotel for families who can save money by stocking the fridge & cooking for their children. There is a TV in the sitting area plus one in the bedroom. The room was immaculate. An added plus was the windows opened slightly to get fresh air! I loved that amenity as one who smokes. The free breakfast in the morning offered an array of eggs, fresh fruit, cereal, muffins, Danish rolls, sausage, milk, coffee & orange juice. Homewood Suites also offers a light dinner Monday through Thursday but because we stayed only the weekend, we did not have this. This is another plus for families. The staff was friendly and courteous! This hotel does not have a restaurant nor a business center nor lounge. I prefer to stay at hotels where I can check my e-mail and not to have to leave the premise to have a glass of wine or grab a sandwich. Still, it was nice and very reasonable price-wise when we stayey d3/26-3/28/2010.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: indyhappyd
Reviews.Content: Wow, from the start I knew it would be great, I called my boss asked for additional time off work spring break with a 10 and 5 year old. We felt so at home my kids want to move to Chicago, (can't afford it) but was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved My Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: ericalee23
Reviews.Content: I moved to Homewood after staying at another hotel nearby from co-workers talking of how great this hotel was, and I agree. You wake up every morning with a free breakfast that not only has cereal and bagels, but fruit, potatos, eggs, waffles, etc. In the evenings Mon-Thurs there is a menu of what is served each night from meatball subs, to cajun food, and the best part is free wine and beer! The people are very friendly and the atmosphere is wonderful. I will be returning and will be booking here again!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: CTRS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is of the highest quality. The staff-WOW! From the minute we pulled up to the hotel and was greeted by the bellman, to the front desk, to the housekeeper, and don't forget the hostess in the breakfast/dinner room we felt like royalty! Everyone was SO nice and friendly. The food is wonderful too! My next trip to Chicago will start with a stay at this hotel for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: ajshirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 weeks for business/leisure. The staff was extraordinary!! Every member of the staff went out of their way to make every guest comfortable. The room was always clean and was the closet thing to being home. Would recommend this hotel to everyone who visits downtown Chicago! A complete large breakfast and dinner M-Thu made the value even more worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and free Internet connection in the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BSJSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: Next time we're back in Chicago, we will stay at Homewood Suites again. It worked out so well for us on our Spring Break vacation. We have a 12 yr. son and wanted a bit more room as opposed to being crowded in 1 room. Having the separate bedroom gave us all more privacy. The room was very clean and the kitchenette worked out great for us. While we didn't do any cooking, it was great having the refrig and microwave. They even supplied us free microwave popcorn. Every morning and every evening Mon-Thurs they have an area with food set up. The breakfasts always had some kind of eggs, meat, cereals and breads. For dinners, you could definitely make it your meal, but because Chicago is known for great restaurants, so it was nice to get a "snack" and then go out for dinner later. There was always plenty of food and they even had styrofoam containers to use to take up snacks to your room if you didn't want to eat in their dining area. One of the biggest perks staying at this hotel was free Internet in the rooms. We brought our lap top so we can research restaurants and sites we wanted to visit. The location is great, just 1 block from the subway system and 1 block from Michigan Avenue, very close to the river. It was a hike to Navy Pier, but we did it, though we took a taxi back! The only complaints I could give was parking our car was expensive, but the valet team was so courteous as was the entire hotel staff. And parking in Chicago is expensive everywhere. This place was no more expensive than other hotels we stayed at in the past. Also, our shower didn't have a way to keep water from going all over the bathroom floor so you needed to pay attention. Nothing several towels couldn't sop up, but definitely weird. This hotel had everything we needed for our family vacation and we would definitely come back. Highly recommended from very particular customers who are used to staying at nice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY! Will definitely stay here again when we return not IF we return.”
Reviews.Author: twin1mom
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. It was super close to the red line and everyone from the bell hops to the front desk to the wait staff were awesome. Very nice and very helpful. I've stayed at a lot of hotels in my life and this was one of the best. The room was great for the price. Lots of space which is hard to come by downtown and close to everything. Kids loved the pool and the great views. We were on a high floor so it was very quiet which gave us all a great night sleep. The breakfast and the dinners at the hotel were fantastic. Big selection and very fresh. The kitchenette came in handy since we were staying for a week. It was our home away from home. We'll be back for sure and I will for sure recommend to business travelers and families alike. Kudos to all staff there.

Reviews.Title: “There's No Place Like Home”
Reviews.Author: NoPLaceLikeHome5678
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler in both business and with my family I have become sensitive to recognizing great customer service in hotels. When checking into Homewood Suites on East Grand Avenue in Chicago I am always greeted with a big and warm smile. They explain all their many amenities and finish with â€œWe Just Want You to Feel Like You Are at Home.â€� Jennifer Kerr, Front Desk manager makes it her business to make sure all requests are addressed in the best way possible. The staff works so well together toward making me feel comfortable and welcome. This starts with being greeted with a warm hello at the front door and next the front desk and is then experienced with any TEAM member you see at this hotel. The breakfast and light dinner offered is wholesome and rooms always tidy. As a Wizard of Oz collector one of my favorite sayings is â€œThereâ€™s No Place Like Homeâ€� and by all means Homewood Suites here in Chicago makes you feel like you are at home away from home. Great job! Dr. Hal Ornstein Howell, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. . .”
Reviews.Author: Destend2b
Reviews.Content: I forgot that S.t Patrick's day was around the corner and everyone celebrated the weekend we were there - both Friday and Saturday day and night. We arrived on Friday late afternoon, walked to Jewel-Osco to pick up some munchies then walked dinner to Joe's Steakhouse (pricy, casual, but fabulous!!) around the corner from Homewood Suites. We went early enough (5:30ish) and was able to get in to Joe's right away but reservations are best if going later. The bell hop/greeters at Homewood were very nice and knowledgable of where every thing is. There were no delays obtaining a taxi either. The breakfast was very good. I am lactose intolerant so I had fruit and bagel each morning, but my husband ate the eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy one morning, and the next morning were eggs, sausage, and hashbrowns. He said they were delicious. Plus I like that they seat you and people can't just walk in and sit down. Hotel was quiet even though the Houseware Show was going on, the City turned their river green, and being St. Patrick's Day celebration weekend. It is very close to Michigan Road down where Bloomingdales, Macy's, Borders, Niketown, Apple store, and Nordstrom Mall. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jibby1uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites for six nights at the end of February and the beginning of March. I can say without reservation that this is by far the friendliest hotel I have ever stayed in, from the check in to the dining room the staff were incredibly warm and welcoming. The rooms are well equipped and well proportioned and the rooms ending in odd numbers have superb views of the Wrigley Building and the Trump Tower. There is a decent sized pool and gym on the 19th floor and the lobby is on the 6th floor along with the dining room and unlimited tea and coffee which is available 24 hours a day. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful and included fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereals, bagels, pastries and hot food such as eggs, bacon and biscuits. The â€œWelcome Homeâ€� reception Monday â€“ Thursday has a decent selection of salads and hot food with the bonus of self serve wine and beer. We would not hesitate to stay at the Homewood Suites Chicago Downtown again if we were in the city and will seriously consider Homewood Suites on any further trips to the US.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating, comfortable, friendly, and free food!”
Reviews.Author: medmike07
Reviews.Content: Rose and Toni at the front desk were very friendly, accomodating, and helpful. They located a great restaurant for my friends and I (Brazilian Churasco) and even got us a coupon for the place. The rooms are huge and very clean and comfortable. A full-sized kitchen was more than what I needed. The continental breakfast is the best I've ever had - what a great selection! One of the nights I was there, they had a fix your own hot dog dinner included. Hotel is very close to the Navy Pier and other local attractions. My cost with a group (conference) discount was good for the location and amenities. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched personalized customer service provided”
Reviews.Author: icemancb
Reviews.Content: I wanted to thank you for the special care and attention you provided me during our most recent stay at Homewood Suites Chicago downtown. I really appreciate the personalized customer service that was provided me to ensure my stay was productuve and allowed me to achieve my business goals. Everyone extended alot of effort to please this guest. which was very much appreciated. It is because of your gracious attention to my stay I will return to the your hotel and consider staying in Hilton hotels in the future. I would especially like to thank I wanted to thank Jennifer, who I believe was a service supervisor, for her gracious efforts to accommodate my every need. Lastly, David Prentiss went out of his way to ensure I was taken care of as if i was a dignitary.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: snapintoaslimjim
Reviews.Content: Took a "staycation" with our family to chicago from the burbs. Beautiful pool up top! Watched the sunset over the skyline. Close to fun stuff for the kids. Went to Navy Pier. Valet recommended wonderful italian restaurant nearby. Breakfast buffet was great. Hospitality #1 - down home friendliness from staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Resglad
Reviews.Content: As I used HHPoints to pay for my stay I can't evaluate the price/performance. Staff was nice and helpful, room ok (nothing fancy), Breakfast good, Welcome home reception not so good. Location is perfect just off the Magnificent Mile

Reviews.Title: “Great peaceful getaway”
Reviews.Author: asti2000k
Reviews.Content: It all started at the front desk with Lorena and continued to get better until she checked me out 2 days later. She made me feel special and her assistance and smile could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect Stay At A Perfect Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: looieville
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here at Homewood Suites. Once again I was very satisfied with the overall experience. The beds were very comfortable to were i hated to get up the next morning. The breakfast buffet was delicious were as at other hotels its bagels and muffins. The buffet had hot and cold to accommodate everyone. This hotel is at a great location for dining, entertainment, shopping, and site seeing. The staff went over and beyond and was very friendly to my family and friends. We had a group of 45, and still no problems for this hotel. For example, my sister -in-law left her cell phone in her room. We made it all the way back home to Louisville and bright in early Monday morning the hotel called to confirm our stay and get an address to send out the phone. I will recommend this hotel to anyone going to the Chicago area. I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: JLGsMom
Reviews.Content: We felt welcome from the minute we walked in the door! Everyone was extremely friendly, helpful,professional,and went out of their way to take care of you. We received wonderful treatment the entire stay. The breakfasts were fantastic with many choices including fresh fruits, yogurt, and hot items - something for everyone! We went with our 3 kids ages 4,7,and 9 and our room was plenty spacious and comfortable for all and our bed felt like heaven! We were in the middle of all the downtown activities and could walk most places - Michigan Ave, Navy Pier, Hard Rock Cafe, and Rainforest Cafe. Sears Tower and Shedd Aquarium were a short cab ride away. Would definately go out of my way to find a Homewood Suites whenever we travel and will be the first place I look to stay the next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “You really don't need to look anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: ElektricMD
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how long this review will be, but I will attempt to keep it short. This hotel is fantastic. You see all those positive reviews on this site? Believe them because you cannot get a much better value for the money than with this hotel. Or maybe you can, but I'll make it easy for you and say that you won't. For starters, this hotel is perfectly located to just about everything. While this may seem like a bold statement, it really isn't. If the place you're trying to go to is not physically near, a mode of public transportation is very near for you to utilize to help you get to your destination. The Red Line subway is literally one block west of the hotel and can be used as your means of getting to and from O'Hare International Airport after utilizing the Blue Line. If the bus is more your thing, the stops are near here as well. What is also very near is the fantastic Magnificent Mile shopping district. You won't be in the hustle and bustle of this district with this hotel, but it'll be close enough for you to reach without using a bus, train, or taxi. The hotel itself if admittedly humble, but this works to its advantage. It's almost as if it is a hidden gem amongst the rest of the hotels that have huge signs begging for your attention. When you walk inside and go to the 6th floor front desk, you're greeted by a very knowledgeable and helpful staff that make the check in process way too easy. Before that you are always greeted by the very friendly doormen on the 1st floor who not only hold the door open for you, but will also give you tips on where to eat or what form of public transportation to take for a given destination. But back to the front desk, from the moment we said "hello" we were literally checked in in less than a minute. From the check in process you of course proceed to your room and with our particular room we had a view that was nothing short of stunning. My advice is to ask for a high floor if you are not afraid of heights because that will give you the best view possible. Along with the great view, we had a great room. Clean, spacious, homey, and the big thing...complete with a kitchen! The sofa bed was at first suspect feeling, but once I actually slept on it overnight I did not want to get up from it the following morning. The bathrooms are well lit and appropriately appointed with enough towels and soaps and all the stuff you would expect to see in there. The room is relatively quiet and not much outside noise comes in to cause a disturbance. Lastly, the food. The breakfast and the 'light meal' in the evening were well above average and should satisfy even the most critical of good food. The selection for both of these meals is wide enough given that they are included at no extra cost. The staff who are there when it is time for you to eat are extremely courteous and are always ready to assist you. Seriously, I can go on and on about this hotel, but the time has come for you to stop reading this and book your trip to Chicago with your hotel choice being this one. There is a reason why it is currently number 6 and climbing in the ranks on this web site for the simple fact that it is that good. I challenge you to not have a good stay here. If you don't, well, that's kinda hard to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: beverlyprojansky
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter downtown Chicago for a 17th Birthday overnight stay with a few girlfriends. Many hotels were booked up, so we stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton on Grand Avenue. From the service to the comfort and quality, I must say I was very impressed. Not only was a buffet breakfast included, and free coffee and tea available 24/7, the Concierge gave us a free movie rental for the special Birthday occasion. We found that the location was excellent for shopping (across from Nordstrom's) and dining out (so many choices, we had a hard time deciding). After dinner, the girls swam in the very nice pool atop the hotel (with a fabulous view). When we wanted a pick me up; free coffee, tea and hot chocolate were abundant in the lobby. All in all, the Homewood Suites was the perfect choice for a getaway with teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyLeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Valentines weekend with our two teenage boys. We had a king suite with a pullout couch and they provided us with a rollaway- no extra charge. The room was very spacious with a full kitchen. The location is fantastic- we walked everywhere. Located between Michigan Ave and Rush Street, it's close to Ginos's Pizza, Navy Pier, ESPN Zone, Trader Joes, etc. The breakfast each morning exceeded our expectations. Full hot breakfast including bacon, sausage, hash, biscuits and gravy, eggs potatoes and more. The staff was very friendly and helpful- everyone from the desk staff to the valets. Our room was very clean and because it was a corner room, we had a fantastic view of the city. We would definitely stay here again and commented all weekend about what a find this hotel was. It was not upscale- but it was very clean, spacious room, friendly staff, pool for the kids and great free breakfast. Great hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Andy_T5
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Illinois from the UK on business, and booked Friday and Saturday night at the Homewood Suites so that I could have a weekend in the city. The location was perfect, walking distance to Michigan Ave for all the shopping and touristy stuff, and literally 100 yards to the L (red line) for getting out to the surrounding areas. The room was great: not exactly 'wow' decor but clean and really well stocked. I was expecting a 'suite' to be a larger than average hotel room with seperate sitting area. It was actually a 3-room mini-apartment, with an open lounge/kitchen, bedroom, and bathroom. Two flatscreen TVs and a huge bed. Breakfast buffet eggs and bacon were great for the hangover(!), and the kitchen meant that I could cook up some lunch rather than eat out if needed.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than Homewood Suites!”
Reviews.Author: zoonkauj
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 night and 4 days at the Homewood Suites with our 3 yr old and it was bliss! Where do I start? The hotel staff greeted us everyday. Breakfast and dinner was great (and didn't cost extra!). The pool area was extremely well kept and the view was beautiful. I can't praise the valet service enough. They were prompt, with a great personality, and even kept an extra eye out for our daughter to make sure she was safe from all the downtown Chicago traffic. Free WiFi, and in and out parking privileges are sometimes hard to find in this town, so it this was a huge plus!! The suite was VERY nice and the housekeeping was great. They even did our dishes for us! Michigan Ave was just down the street and up a flight of stairs, while Millenium Park was a quick walk away. We come to Chicago often and will definitely ONLY stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: dubsman
Reviews.Content: Hi,Stayed here for three nights recently,From check in to check out all Staff members went out of their way to make sure everything was ok and if there was anything they could do to help us,directions,restaurants, transport,nothing was too much trouble,The dinner from monday to thursday 5-7 was a wonderful surprise,also the breakfast was more than adequet,Stayed on the 15th floor and slept soundly,Hotel close to everything for the tourist or business traveller.Restaurants and shopping all within 5-10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of home, on the road.”
Reviews.Author: JEM68KS
Reviews.Content: I had to be away from my family for 5 nights. I dreaded staying in a hotel room, but the Homewood was wonderful. The living/kitchen area was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. It was nice to be able to spreadout. The staff was very friendly. It was nice to have breakfast provided in the mornings and the meal in the evening. I would easily book another stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, facilities and the best staff !”
Reviews.Author: 5Hamburgers
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying here! We love it. It is located 1 block off Michigan Avenue in the midst of many fun restaurants. The bell hops are extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. We're a family of 5 and on 3-5 minutes notice they got us a minivan cab easily day or night. They were very helpful and attentive when my handicapped brother-in-law came to stay with us for several days. We had made reservations through Hotels.com but ended up not needing one room two of the nights. They said they'd be happy to refund the room charges, but because we booked through Hotels.com they could not do so without approval. They gave us the number, we called, and voila, the money was refunded. Wonderful service. The front desk staff has always been very helpful and courteous. The business center has free printing and easy shortcuts for airline check-in and boarding pass printing. The rooms are clean, quiet, have good mattresses and plenty of space. We used to stay with 5 people in one suite but now that our kids are 8, 10 and 15 we get two connecting rooms (call the day before you arrive to remind them what you want). The pool and exercise room are on the 19th floor with a stunning view. The breakfast buffet is extensive and well prepared. We have made the Chicago Homewood Suites our home away from home (much cheaper than a condo!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service and great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SweetsChicago_Ill
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Homewood Suites Hilton several times. I have never had a bad experience with this hotel. The employees are GREAT. They make you feel right at home and always so very friendly! The manager Jennifer Kerr always makes you feel welcomed and makes sure that you enjoyed your stay. She is very personable and so helpful! The breakfast is amazing. I never got a chance to take advantage of the "welcome home" dinners but I heard from others it is great! I would recommend this hotel to anybody and I will only stay at this hotel when I want to enjoy a great time downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Friendly Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: peanut28512
Reviews.Content: Several of our employee's stayed after our Holiday party at Maggiano's. I worked with Kristy Fender and she was great. She was so helpful with everything. The hotel staff is so friendly and helpful. We will definitley stay again and refer this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuffettFan1234
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago was amazing. The room was spotless and smelled great when I checked in. The staff was unbeleiveably personable and friendly. I did not expect such a warm welcome in "The Big City." The breakfast was also terrific, exactly what I needed. Thank you for such a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for everyone!!!”
Reviews.Author: grapes81
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give a 6-star rating!!! We were very impressed with every aspect of the hotel. The location is perfect- right downtown!! The service was wonderful, complete with smiles! The rooms are incredibly clean, quiet, and perfect for any length of stay. Plus, the beds....VERY comfortable!!! I couldn't stop looking out the windows- a great view of downtown. I felt very much at home the entire time I was there. To top it all off, the breakfast in the morning is delicious!!! All around, this hotel is a winner and we will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price, accomodations and location”
Reviews.Author: Cappy536
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 4 year old daughter stayed here for 1 night for a min getaway before baby #2 arrives. The king suite was perfect for the 3 of us. The mini kitchen made it easy to bring and store beverages as well as order in dinner. My daughter loved the pool though it did get a little cold and the ladders were hard for her to climb up and down. Older children there didn't have a problem at all. The breakfast buffet was great with lots of healthy choices - no doughnuts or muffins in sight. Check in and check out was effortless. We did park across the street in the Nordstrom parking garage to save $7 overnight, but we did hear you can leave your bags with the valet after check out if you are shopping in Chicago. Our only complaint was the temperature in the room - it either went hot or cold with no number gage. My all ended up sleeping without covers that night. Highly recommend for those coming to Chicago and want a family friendly hotel at a great price and location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value & Service”
Reviews.Author: TiffinTravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed stayed here Jan. 7th thru Jan. 12th 2010. We both were more than pleased with our experience at this hotel. We have stayed at downtown Chicago hotels on 4 previous getaways and this was the best by far. The staff at the front desk, (Rose) was very pleasant and helpful. The other desk staff were also very pleasant. The overnight lady was more than accommodating when we told her our key cards didn't work, she asked for my ID before she encoded them again to verify that we were actually booked guests, it was somewhat refreshing that someone would actually take the time to check the guests security. The bellman at the front door greeted us each time we left and also welcomed us back every time we arrived. The bellman also helped us with our key cards when he noticed we were having trouble getting into our room (he was down the hall helping another guest when he noticed us and excused himself form this guest to help us out also). I can't say how surprised we were that he took time to help us out. The staff in the breakfast area (Connie) greeted us by name each morning and would always ask how things were going and if we needed anything to let her know. Our room was cleaned each day with fresh towels and the bed was made and the few dishes we had were washed. The breakfast was great!! Each day you had hot items along with fresh fruits, cereal, oatmeals, danishes and a lots of other choices. The evening receiption was just as great with hot foods, snacks and wine/beer. AWESOME!! It really helps a person stay on budget with amenities like that!

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Nana002
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent deal by going in January and had a wonderful time. The staff was cheery, efficient, and helpful in every way. They guided us to places we wanted to go and helped us navigate the transit system. This was our first visit, so we needed it. Our location was perfect--two blocks from Magnificent Mile and all the bus lines, one from the red line, and near many restaurants and the infamous Howl at the Moon. Great entertainment!
