Trader Joe's and Jewel-Osco are within two blocks. We got a one week CTA pass from Jewel-Osco that allowed us to go to all the museums and Shedd Aquarium. There was a large menu for breakfast, and a small meal was served weekdays in the evening. Since we were gone most of each day and some evenings, the room size was more than adequate. It's not a new building, nor one of the most plush, but it was exactly what we wanted. The full kitchen allowed us to get soft drinks, snacks, and lunch items, so we could spend our money elsewhere. We'd like to return in the warmer weather and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: TorontoToo
Reviews.Content: This property is our "go-to" accommodation when visiting Chicago, we've stayed here on numerous occasions over the past years. The location is ideal with great shopping, restaurants & entertainment venues within a short walk. The Shops At Northbridge are literally right across the street which is especially convenient when temps drop below freezing!! Groceries,beer & wine (Trader Joes or Jewel Osco) are 2 blocks away for those who choose to self-cater. Breakfast is provided daily and there's a "Manager's Reception" Mon thru Thurs - while we don't always partake, we appreciate the option and convenience when we do, especially since you can get all items in take-away containers and return to your room with them if you'd prefer not to eat in the dining area(s). Breakfast selection was not as varied this visit though (no more do-it-yourself waffles or yogurt on a daily basis) coffee/tea is now serve yourself as well. High speed wireless is free and reliable and there is a good business centre on-site. Laundry facilities are also provided on the 7th floor - only negative here is that this is the hotel's only designated smoking floor and the odour is strong and tough to take if you're a non-smoker. Desk service is always friendly and welcoming, especially at the bell desk. Room service has always been spotty in our experience (garbage not always picked up, dishwashing detergent or other items not always left) These situations are always rectified quickly with a call to the front desk though. Air conditioning is not functional in winter/early spring months so for those who like a cooler room, you'll need to have the windows unlocked to let the fresh air in. This option has always worked well for us. Overall a terrific property with good, friendly service in a perfect central location - great value for the price. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this Homewood.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding facility with great staff”
Reviews.Author: RobertaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I am a grandmother who travelled with 2 granddaughters to see the sights in Chicago. I was so happy to have booked this hotel. It had the most gracious, accomodating staff I have ever encountered in a hotel of this price range. The location is perfect-close to Magnificent Mile, shopping and all buses to all the museums. The breakfast and dinner buffets were well-prepared, very satisfying, and a great savings. The suites are perfect for a family with 2 TVs, and full kitchen. The sleeper sofas are hard to open, but the front desk would send a staff member every night to open it. Special recognition to Luis , F & B manager, Rose at Front Desk, and all the guys at 1st Floor Valet/Bellman station.

Reviews.Title: “"Not worth the money"”
Reviews.Author: shaneal718
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled to Chicago for the first time this December and we were not happy with this hotel. The friendliest people on the staff were the bell boys. They greeted us with a smile and gave us lots of great advice throughout our stay. The rest of the staff however was terrible. When we first checked in, I was instantly discouraged. The front desk person was not in a good mood and I couldn't wait to leave the lobby. Having not traveled here before we were looking for exciting places to eat and to go sightseeing. We asked multiple staff members at the front desk of places to go and see and never got any good recommendations. We felt as if we were an inconvenience to the staff. At one point, the front desk person was on the phone while we were waiting to talk to her, as she was on the phone a family of four came up behind us waiting to talk to her as well. Even though she saw us standing there, after she finished with the phone call she ignored us and helped the family first. Yes, we are in our mid 20's, but we are still paying guests and there is no reason to be treated like we are invisible. For how much money we paid for each night, I would have rather stayed somewhere else. We decided to go with this hotel because of the location and the great reviews, but we did not experience any of this during our stay. The rooms were alright, but nothing special. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS PLACE !”
Reviews.Author: CCStrong
Reviews.Content: Best staff I have ever come across. This is our 2nd trip to Chicago, 2nd time staying here and we just love it. Beautiful spacious rooms, spotlessly clean and well kept. I can't say enough about the great staff, they are the make it or break it and the Homewood staff makes it fabulous. 5 stars all around - THANK YOU !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: agibson23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October. We were two couples who shared a suite. We would probably opt to have our own suites next time but that's not the responsibility of the hotel. The location is fantastic, close to everything including subway stops to get you to other areas. Lots of restaurants and shopping close by. The quality of the room was average, nothing super exciting and average on the furnishing and style matches any regular hotel in this category. The bathroom was very stark. The best part of the staying here was the location as mentioned and the fact that your meals can get included, things can get expensive here, especially with all the shopping. The staff was friendly and the morning breakfast which was included was fantastic, both in value and quality. Would definitely stay here again next time we visit the Windy city.

Reviews.Title: “This is how the hotel is supposed to be!!”
Reviews.Author: jords_westside
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Chicago and can't wait to write a review to show how happy we were staying in this hotel. Let me review some of the highlightes: - Location. You can't go wrong with this hotel. It's on perfect location if you want to stay in a nice hotel without breaking your bank account. Few blocks away from North Michigan Ave, Rush Street, and State Street. You can even catch a free ride to Navy Pier from one of the trolley stops nearby. - Free nice hot breakfast. You can even box the food and bring the food up to your room. how nice is that? -Very nice and care hotel's staff. I should give two thumbs up for the service and courtesy of the staff, especially the vallet parking staff. This kind of courtesy is a rare nowadays. Hilton group should take care of these people. This kind of service is mostly found in hotels in Japan or Singapore...he..he.. - Close to so many restaurants.. Try Big Bowls restaurant....Their ginger ale ice green tea is a heaven on earth.!! Opps.. I should keep my mouth shut because I don't want everybody to pack this hotel. People.. Don't rush your reservation' yet... I am planning to come back in a couple months.!!!

Reviews.Title: “beatiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TayfunC
Reviews.Content: i can recommend all of my friends to stay in homewood suites hotels. they are a member of hilton group and they have maybe better quality than their sisters :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Frivolous
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Chicago and I really cannot wait to go back. The hotel was in a great location and every member of staff we had contact with were exceptionally helpful. Particular mention should go to the door staff who were amazingly helpful. The room was clean, quiet and spacious, if only every hotel were like this.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: g0lden17
Reviews.Content: everything that i read from other reviews was pretty much on the money, they have excellent customer service, the employees there really cared about their guests, there was always coffee, tea, hot chocolate in the lobby, good hot breakfast and dinner with wine and beer, the doormen were nice and willing to help out for directions, the room did the job, there was a kitchen, 2 flat screen tv's, and a pullout couch included, it was close to the "eL", but for us we found the buses to be more useful. I would recommend getting a pass, we got a 3 day pass and it was well worth it for $14 which we got at jewel osco, not too far from the hotel, for the most part the majority of the people that were there were older people on a business trip and families, but us three girls didn't mind, so i would definitely recommend this place, it was one of the cheapest places were found out of all the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and free breakfast and dinner”
Reviews.Author: my2centstx
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed in The Homewood Suite. We've got a good deal and did not expect much. The hotel is right in the heart of Downtown. Nordstrom is right across street and the Mag Miles is only a block away. What surprises us most was, in addition to free breakfast, the free dinner buffet which saves us a bunch. Food is just average but the savings help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! The staff and care far exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: HFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We traveled with three children ages four and under and the staff consistently went out of their way to make our stay convenient and enjoyable. The men at valet always jumped at the opportunity to grab the door or cab for us and would nearly stop traffic to ensure the kids got into the cab safely. The front desk staff were always kind and even gave our kids freebies from the gift shop. The breakfast buffet was great and the staff eagerly helped us set up high chairs and watched our kids for me when I had to leave them to get something from the buffet. Maintenance gave us a roll of free industrial plastic wrap so we could wrap up our stroller before checking it at the airport (the post office where we planned to buy bubble wrap was closed). EVERY time we interacted with a member of the staff they went out of their way to assist us and it was a huge blessing!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: hoteltraveler40
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else. Lovely hotel with wonderful staff in downtown Chicago. Hotel has full kitchen. Beds were comfortable. I asked for a quiet room in the back of the hotel and never heard any noise. After going up to the rooftop pool, I wish I had asked for a higher floor to get a view. The best thing about the hotel is the wonderful staff. They go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lindhod
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing. The breakfast and dinner was perfect. Saved us tons of money and was perfect for the kids. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel right in the center of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: luischable
Reviews.Content: Really made welcome from the moment I arrived. Lobby is on a higher floor so rooms have a good view. I was on the 16th Floor and the room was incredibly quiet for being in the center of a city. You can take breakfast to your room and everything is available to do that. If there was one little defect it would be the swimming pool which looked like it needed to be resurfaced- the paint is peeling from the sides. Every morning while we stayed we went to Swim and no-one else was there. Nice that it is indoor and right on top of the hotel. Staff were very friendly and they also have a great Business Center where you can print your boarding pass for free. Internet is also free in your room. Would definitely stay in this hotel again. It is right by the Hotel Garden Inn if you are comparing hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Boring but comfortable, roomy, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: 3rdAlfa
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like it was originally another hotel where they joined two small rooms to make each suite. Half of the suite is a kitchen and sitting area and the other, the bath and bedroom. Two TVs, plenty of nearby restaurants, view of the Wrigley building. Breakfast and dinner are included weekdays, but I preferred buying fresh veggies at the grocery store a block away to the comfort food they served. My client got me a great deal on the room given its location and amenities; my "value" rating would have been significantly lower if I'd paid rack rate. Note to light sleepers: there must be a fire station near by, as I regularly heard sirens in my south-facing room.

Reviews.Title: “Felt so much like home...”
Reviews.Author: planetrainautomobile
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago with my two teenage daughters. Homewood Suites is amazing. The complimentary breakfast and receptions offer so much variety. The hotel was within walking distance to many places to eat and shop. We got caught in a thunderstorm, and got soaking wet. I dried all our clothes in the dryer right in the hotel! The Homewood Suites was so much like home. The suite was very spacious and had everything we needed. The hotel had lots of brochures and suggestions for dining and activities. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Chicago is an amazing place and the Homewood Suites is the place to stay. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: jmg5768
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights and could not have been happier. We had a corner room with a wonderful view. The staff was polite and very helpful. The complimentary breakfast saved us time and money. Two blocks from MM and a short bus trip away from the theatre and art museum. We walked to the Navy Pier and road the free trolley back to the hotel. We would stay here again on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service at Valet and at Check In”
Reviews.Author: BusyBeeMichigan
Reviews.Content: Dissatisfied with the service upon arrival at the hotel. In the pouring rain, 3-4 valet employees watched from 15 feet away in the front door as my colleague and I unloaded our vehicle of 6 bags, a laptop computer, rolling file box, etc. in the pouring rain. I complained at the hotel 'sfront desk clerk and requested to speak with the manager. Well, it's been nearly two hours since we checked in and no one has spoken to us about or addressed our complaint yet. Needless to say, we are hesitant about any future stays with Hilton and will probably not be uning them and this hotel for any future business or pleasure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, amenities”
Reviews.Author: fishbone96
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights while visiting friends and site seeing. The location is perfect - very close to the El and within walking distance of all the downtown sites. The suite was comfortable and well appointed. The wifi didn't work in the room, but I was able to use it in the lobby. I appreciated the breakfast. A light dinner is offered Mon - Thursday, but I didn't take advantage of it. The staff were friendly and helpful. Best of all, I had the most wonderful views of the city skyline from my 19th floor room. All in all, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel. We will return.”
Reviews.Author: Rdrs
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of downtown. Spacious rooms. Full kitchern. Wonderful breakfast and evening meals. Awesome staff. We will return here when we visit Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “In The Center Of It All”
Reviews.Author: KSVtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very beautiful. I went with a group of 4 friends and we had a blast. It was very centrally located and was close to all sorts of transportation. The Continental breakfast was magnificent! I didn't see much of the staff but all of the men at the front door were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for family in a terrific location! Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: luckyno39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in July with our two small children for our summer vacation. I am a fan of Hilton hotels but had never stayed at a Homewood Suites, it is now our favorite chain. The large room gave us plenty of space but privacy at the same time. Having a kitchen was convenient but between the warm breakfast every morning and complimentary dinner we hardly used it. The hotel staff was great, there was a mix of guests, both those on business and families with children but the hotel was perfect for both groups. This hotel is in a great location and is just a few blocks away from the Double Decker tour bus stop. Next time we go back to Chicago we'll be sure to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Location ,Location”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTraveler09
Reviews.Content: Nice facility that was perfectly centered for our various activities.Perfect for those who want to park their car and use their feet while visiting Chicago. The staff was very obliging and our only complaint was that they seemed to be overwhelmed by the weekend crowd at the complimentary breakfast,which was quite good by the way.All said, we enjoyed our stay very much

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: DJFan8
Reviews.Content: I am a corporate travel consultant and book this hotel often for my clients. My family and I stayed over Labor Day weekend and I now know why it is so popular with my clients!! The hotel is in a great location and the staff is OUTSTANDING. I was very impressed with everyone from the front desk to the server's at breakfast. Everyone was extremely friendly and always willing to help. The complimentary breakfast is a great value when traveling with a family. My teenager's loved the freedom to go to breakfast or bring it back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiFanOregon
Reviews.Content: Just back from a business trip. The Homewood is in a great location just off the Magnificent Mile, includes a great breakfast, heavy hors d'ouevres for dinner with beer and all for a pre-paid rate of $129. Without a doubt the best value in Chicago for a long, long time.

Reviews.Title: “Rough start but overall a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: iwillnotdoit2000
Reviews.Content: A little bit of confusion at first but things settled down and all in all a good place to hang your hat. Checked in at 4:00 PM, donâ€™t expect an earlier time. I requested an upper floor and was given the 10th of a 19 story building where you check in on the 6th? I just got comfortable in my room and a couple walked in on me. They complained Iâ€™m in their room? I called the front desk and they had me checked out rather then in? Well the couple did eventually vacate, after all, I was completely unpacked while they were still wheeling their luggage around. I left for the House of Blues and got back late that same evening. The keys did not work to my room? Went to the front desk and they disabled my keys in the confusion of whether Iâ€™ve checked in or out. I recommend using the swing latch on your door, because if it isnâ€™t for strangers surprising you or housekeeping letting themselves in 5 seconds after knocking you might be caught with your pants down. Now for the good stuff! Excellent free breakfast and light dinner. The location is great; you are only a block away from the EL Red Line that took me to Wrigley Field, museums, the bean and Chinatown without transferring. The rooms are spacious and the full kitchen (less oven) came in handy, as did the grocery store only a few blocks away. Service was friendly and attentive. My front end experience was an isolated case and should not reflect on the big picture so I give it good marks and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Home Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: MimiJWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Chicago to reacquaint ourselves with this fabulous and vibrant city. We chose the Homewood Suites because of its location, my Hilton Honors membership, and the reviews here on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed! The staff was friendly. Jonah, John and Starr were tremendous, and I felt I knew them because of the reviews here. They did everything to make our stay comfortable. They valet parking staff was efficient and friendly, and I wish I could recall all their names. We had a wonderful suite with a great view. There was plenty of space. Having a full kitchen was a plus, and we stocked up twice on healthy foods at Trader's Joe's just two blocks away. We also enjoyed the complimentary dinner our first night, and breakfast every day. The breakfast is very filling and is just what you need for a long day of walking, shopping and sightseeing. The elevators were speedy. The hotel was clean. The maid service (the only name I recall is Norma, which was the name on the cart) was top notch! They even aired out the room for us. Everyone was friendly, including the other guests. There was a lot of friendly chatter in the elevators. Here's what makes this hotel such a gem: It is unpretentious and down-home, like Chicago itself, but still attractive with more than a dash of style. People feel comfortable here. And the people who stay here run the gamut of types: Business people, couples, families. The location is excellent: The area is full of shops and restaurants to suit all tastes and budgets. We shopped at Nordstroms, Water Tower Place, up and down North Michigan and loved the Apple store there. One more word about the location: It is relatively safe, and teems with life from early morning until after midnight. Chicago is a very friendly city, and everyone who works in a frontline job must have taken a guest relations course. Somebody is doing something right here! By the way, nothing wrong with the parking fee here. It was actually less than we expected. You're in a city, for heaven's sake. We will certainly return to the Hilton Homewood Suites on Grand Avenue. The sooner, the better!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zanika2005
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Homewood Suites for 6 nights this September. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience there. The location is superb! We walked practically everywhere: State street, the mile, Hancock tower, the bean and museums. The restaurants in the area are also great, and there is plenty of variety. I enjoyed having a kitchen and full refrigerator for heating up leftovers and cooking a few meals. The room was fairly spacious for a downtown Chicago hotel. I thought the valet parking was extremely overpriced ($43 a night), and most parking garages in the area are about the same price. Oh well, that's what you get for being in the city. We had a couple of friends stay with us one night and they had their car parked in the valet lot as well. They paid for their one day of parking, only to discover that they had been charged the entire hotel bill two days later. When I spoke with the front desk about this mix up they were not too friendly about my confrontation. I spent a half and hour with them trying to resolve the issue, which should have only taken a few minutes. Overall the experience was good, and I would plan to stay there again when I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: pacificmgc
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites is a great bargain by its nature. Big rooms, kitchens, bedrooms. A great deal for the price. One might expect that service would suffer to in proportion to the value. Absolutely not the case here. Star pre-registered us and she was funny, charming and very helpful. Upon actual check-in later in the day, Lorena made us feel right at home, she was sweet, knowledgeable and a real professional. Toni was especially helpful in getting us into a very busy restaurant near the hotel - they knew her there and treated us like VIP's. A real treat after a long day of sightseeing. Making sure the entire machine keeps running is Manager Jennifer Kerr. She is nice, funny, and very ,very hands-on in assuring tha ther guest are as happy and aswell taken care of as possible. We give it an A+ and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extremely friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: MarylandSpartan
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in downtown Chicago. Walking distance to all major sites. Very friendly and helpful staff. Decent complementary breakfast. Clean, spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: 24NYCVAC
Reviews.Content: First time in Chicago to celebrate our 19th wedding anniversary. Homewood Suites and the staff made it a perfect trip. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Thanks Jennifer and John for giving us a wonderful stay. The room was roomy and very nice. The breakfast was an added bonus. They had a lot of choices to please any palate. Good job Homewood.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LizandGov
Reviews.Content: Another trip to the Windy City, this time in the late summer, proved to be wonderful again. I have stayed at Homewood Suites several times before and this time had friends/co-workers along for the trip. The hotel staff and services, as usual, were great. I've heard guests commenting on the slowness of the elevators, especially around check-out time, but that has never been that big of an issue with me. (Just wait for the next one!) The comp. breakfasts are filling and a great way to start you off on a day of sight-seeing or conferences. You cant beat the location!! The hotel is literally sandwiched between Nordstroms and Bloomingdales! The Weber Grill is a block away as well as many great restaurants on Rush. There is even a Trader Vic's Market 1.5 blocks away if you just want to fill up the kitchen in your room and eat in. I've always recommended this hotel to friend traveling to Chicago for the first time or for return trips. The employees are friendly and very helpful, they'll provide suggestions and even get you tickets for shows or clubs on a moments notice. I will be back again. Love the city, love Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Lifesaver!”
Reviews.Author: T24kball
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our mini-moon stay at Homewood Suites. It helped tide us over until our honeymoon to Australia in November. Here are a couple things I'd like to highlight. Customer service - Everyone was friendly and helpful. The front desk gave us a map of the city and pointed out nearby attractions and the supermarket around the corner. On the day of our departure, I realized I had left my wedding band in the room. As we were heading to the airport on the train, we called the front desk to search for the ring. They found the ring and mailed the ring overnight to our address. I would have been dead without the great service. I'd also like to mention that the prompt service, whether providing additional towels or wine glasses and a bottle opener. Other things we liked about the hotel: free breakfast, full size fridge for storing leftovers, one block from the red line, comfortable king bed, and free wireless internet. The pool and fitness center were a bit small with lots of kids around, but at least it was on the top floor of the hotel. Overall, I thought it was a great deal at the price. We were able to spend less on the hotel and more on food. Tim

Reviews.Title: “Great in house staff . . . But . . .”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly972
Reviews.Content: This review has two parts. . .I advise reading both. Chapter One: The actual hotel and staff I found the in house staff to be very friendly and accommodating. The room was nice and clean as well. I have no disagreement with any of the other reviews regarding the hotel room or the staff. This is a great location where you can walk three blocks to to the South to reach the riverfront, or a few blocks to reach the water tower to the North. Very easy (one block) walk from the subway (Red line). The morning complimentary breakfast is substantial. Not just muffins and coffee. You can have a complete breakfast here if you want. And, even the breakfast servers were really nice and efficient. I would recommend this hotel IF based solely on the physical location, the room, and the staff. Chapter Two: The nightmare I booked this room through central reservations in July for a mid-September arrival. The rate was quoted to me as $159 per night for four nights. When the confirmation was emailed to me, it was incorrect by over $300. I immediately called the hotel. They said they made the correction and emailed a new confirmation with the correct amount. I did receive the corrected confirmation email. . .All done? NO. One week later, my credit card statement arrives with the old higher amount having been charged. I called the hotel and was transferred to central reservations to resolve. When I explained the error, I was literally called a liar by the person in reservations, and told "That's not my problem. I can't help you". . . and then told that I have to pay the higher amount. Excuse ME? Now, I go back to calling the hotel manager to get some assistance. After a few left messages, I get the general manager to call me back, and discuss the issue. After taking down all of the names of people I spoke with, he assures me that he will credit the account immediately. I even get a call from someone in his accounting dept to confirm my credit card etc. . . One week later, still no credit. So, I call the general manager again. Oh, this might take up to 72 hours to process, I am told. So, please give it another week. Another week passes, still no credit. So another call to the manager. I am told now that the credit HAS been processed, and he even sends me an email confirming our "agreement" for the credit, just to appease me. Another week passes. Still, not seeing that credit that was "definitely processed" a week ago. Yet another call to the general manager on the day before I am to leave on my trip to Chicago. I told him I will be arriving, and at this point, I want to see him personally, and he can physically use my credit card to process the credit while I am there. Remember, we are now talking SIX WEEKS and this is still not resolved. I arrive at the hotel, and to make a long story short, the general manager was NEVER available to see me, nor did he make any attempts to schedule any time to see or talk with me. The only person I spoke face to face with, was the assistant general manager. He was completely unconcerned with my situation, and made the completely inappropriate statement to me of "you realize this boils down to a matter of 'he said she said'". . . WHAT???? Today, my trip is over, and I have flown back home. I STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED THE CREDIT TO MY ACCOUNT!!! I will absolutely be reporting all of this to Hilton Corporate Customer Service, and will absolutely be disputing the entire amount at this point. Take this little adventure into consideration when dealing with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: caz1949
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on the 19th floor great view and spacious room with kitchen facilities. Free breakfast every day and dinner Monday to Thursday the great thing was they provided take away boxes so you could take the food back to your room. Location is very good. Staff are very polite and very helpful would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: joeandterriroche
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in january when it was -20. but even then we enjoyed it so much we could not wait to get back. chicago is a great town to visit and the homewood suites is the place to stay, period. now we stayed from the 9/5/2009 to 9/5/2009 and enjoyed every day. (p.s. the weather was in the high 70s). to get back to the hotel, it was fantastic, it has everything you need and its write in the heart of the city. two seperate rooms were very handy as we had our teenage son. full kitchen, (laundry on 7th floor) seveal foodmarkets within walking distance, everything within walking distance. you wont need a car and at $42 for valet parking you wont want one. dont take my word for it , check it out you wont be disappointed. oh and did i mention free breakfast and dinner . job done. its a no brainer book now. p.s. theres also a beach within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Chicago with a 13 month old”
Reviews.Author: tnshsms
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite which was very nice with our toddler. I had requested a crib and had even called the day before our arrival to confirm the crib and ask if it was a portable or a full size so we could bring the approriate sheets. I was informed it was a full size crib. It was a pack n play. Its not that the pack n play was bad, it was clean and put together, but it was not the full size crib I was expecting. The living room was roomy for a hotel suite, however, the bedroom was too small for our pack n play so it went in the living room. Not a big deal but something for you to consider. The Homewood suites is in a great location. We went to the Navy Pier on day and walked there and took the free trolley back. The walk took about 15-20 min with our stroller in tow and the free trolley back was nice but be prepared to wait. The first trolley came and it was full before we got up to the door so we had to wait 20 min for the next one. We drove to Shedd and it was about a 20 min drive but make sure to ask directions. We tried to follow a map and since we didn't know for sure where we were going it was hard for us to get to the roads we needed due to construction and one way streets. Since it was only a blcok and half from michigan ave we walked up and down for shopping. All in all, I liked the location and the staff was friendly. We needed a few things brought to us and they brought them promptly. I was a little concerned when we were right across the hall from the elevators but I heard nothing so the rooms were quiet. My only two complaints were the pack n play and the shower needed to be wiped down again. It just looked like housekeeping was maybe in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, friendly, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: azinca
Reviews.Content: The only thing I would add to the many benefits that recommend this hotel, is that we experienced an inconvenience on our first day that is likely beyond the control of the hotel. John at the front desk immediately moved us a different room where we were very satisfied. When you stay here, ask for John if you are not completely satisfied. He will make you happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: SJ123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in August/Sept 09. The good points: The location is excellent, close to the Magnificent Mile, the Grand Ave El, lots of restaurants and shops. The rooms are fairly spacious and we got an excellent room rate. The staff were friendly and helpful. The kitchen is fully equipped with a full sized fridge with ice maker. The bad points: The breakfast room had an awful smell about it. The food at breakfast was very average, and they ran out of some things every morning. There was always a massive queue to get a table at breakfast, and there were endless screaming kids about. The room was very dated, and needed to be revamped. The bathroom was small and a bit grubby, and the shower didn't have a lot of pressure. The sheets didn't fit the bed properly and every night they came off the sides of the bed so we ended up partially sleeping directly on the mattress. The bedding also felt very cheap, with what felt like nylon sheets. The lift was slow. The windows in our room were so dirty, you couldn't see out for the smears all over them. If you are looing for a cheap place to stay in the middle of things, this is the place. If you are looking for a sophisticated hotel, this is not the place to stay. There are plenty of other nicers places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Staff, Location - All the comforts of home.”
Reviews.Author: Lizard70Detroit_MI
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a family trip to Chicago. My husband and I were traveling with our 10 month-old son and 3 year-old son. From the moment of our arrival our experience was completely positive. The valets were very helpful with unloading the kids and luggage from the car. The staff at the front desk was fantastic. They had a crib delivered to our room within 20 minutes of our arrival. The complimentary dinner the first night was great. After traveling all afternoon, it was nice that we didn't have to try and make arrangments for dinner. The staff in "the lodge" where dinner and breakfast were served was very friendly and attentive, as well. It was nice that they had carry-out containers available to take dinner and breakfast back to the room if you don't want to eat in the dining room. Throughout our stay, all of the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was great. It was like having an apartment, and gave us plenty of room for the kids to spread out with their toys and play. It was nice to have the kitchen, especially for preparing bottles, and for having dinner in the room which was generally carry-out from area restaurants. The hotel has a room service arrangement with P.F. Chang's, and is within walking distance of a lot of nice restaurants. Great location for walking to area attractions - the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier. We are already planning to retun next summer, and will recommend the Homewood Suites to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood made son's Wedding weekend smooth and stress free”
Reviews.Author: Nina_Cuckoo
Reviews.Content: The staff at this Homewood Suites made a wedding weekend trip for my family stress free and smooth. We had 6 suites reserved at the prepay rate of $129.00 each for the weekend of August 28-30. The front desk was happy to give wedding goodie and snack bags, which I made up at home, to each member of our group as they checked in. When we detected a faint cigarette smell in our room when we first arrived, the front desk was prompt in moving us to a different room. They even gave us the largest suite avaiable on our floor, so that we would have a larger gathering place for our entire party of 13 people. Then, Rose, at the front desk, asked if we would like to have our whole party on the same floor. This was great since some were elderly and there were children, also. Some of the many extras the staff helped us with: bringing extra chairs to our suite, fetching items for the wedding from our valet-parked cars, rounding up mini-van taxis for our large group twice, bringing us extra towels and ice within minutes of calling for them. The hotel was sold out for the weekend, so the breakfast room was crowded and they had an overflow room opened, but they never ran low on food. On Saturday, they had a broken water pipe in the kitchen, so there was no hot food, but they were sincerely apologetic. There was a wait for an elevator at busy times, but we never waited more than a few minutes. They could have given a little more thought to which families got which size rooms. A couple using a crib were given one of the smallest rooms on the floor, which made it very tight in the room, while our single, senior citizen great-grandma got a corner unit with windows on 2 sides and a very large, uncrowded living area. We were close to everything we needed at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great, except when you leave!”
Reviews.Author: uncledave33
Reviews.Content: Recommend everything about , except when i got home, started get tons of sales calls on my CELL PHONe from Hilton Honors and they were annoying, pushy and non stop. For this reason, I would never stay at a hilton hotel again! Google...you will see thousands of similar complaints against them. SOOOOO frustrating

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend !!”
Reviews.Author: Herbeverschmel
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, clean and courteous staff all added up to a great stay. Its in an area with plenty of stores ( The Mile) and restaurants. Hotel lobby is on the 6th floor and the elevator to get there was annoyingly slow but overall I would highly recommend this place regardless if your there with a family, friends or on business. The subway to Wrigley is a 1/2 block away from the front door.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service at this Great Homewood Suites Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: SKSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the fourth time from July 26 to Aug.3 and had a wonderful time (as ususual!). We did encounter a few problems but they were dealt with quickly and joyfully. This suite hotel is fab, but it's the people that work there that make this the BEST hotel in Chicago. Kudos to these wonderful people...John, the assist. General Manager, who took a personal interest in our stay,and the problems we encountered. John, went beyond the call of duty. When my room key wouldn't work for the 3rd time, he PERSONALLY escorted me to my room...NOW THAT'S SERVICE! Thanks for all that you did John, I will always remember your kindness and understanding:D Jonah, one of the best bell men ever always had a smile and kind word, he really did make me feel like I was coming "home" after a long day of shoppping/sightseeing. We shared more than a few restaurant reviews...thanks! The wonderful ladies who manned the front desk...always friendly and helpful! No request was ever too big to be accomodated. Connie that worked in the lodge...a smile every morning! along with that free breakfast!. I had gotten a touch of food poisoning one night and told Connie about the experience...she offered to get me some ginger ale to settle my stomache! Connie was working here that last time we were at the Suites in '07...and she remembered us! Suggestion to all visitors: leave these hard working people a cash tip! Yes the breakfast and manager's reception is free, but the people that seat ya and clean up after you are in the service industry and deserve a tip for their service...I know that they even appreciate a dollar or 2! It's not a lot when you consider how much that meal for the family would cost in a restaurant....free wine & beer...enough said! I just can't say enough good things about this place! They really do stand behind their 100% Satisfaction guarantee. Don't know when we'll be back in Chicago but do know that this is the ONLY hotel we would ever consider staying at. Great location. great facility, great food and drink and most of all, the best group of people you'd every want to meet! Thanks for another wonderful holiday...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RiverOaksReviewer
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites were a perfect central spot for exploring all the Chicago highlights. We were close by to shopping, the theatre, and plenty of good restaurants. Trader Joe's was just around the corner so we picked up some bottled water, wine and fruit on the first day. The free trolley was a great option to get to attractions and tours near the Pier. The only thing I would not recommend around the hotel is the ESPN Zone bar/restaurant. The free daily breakfast was convenient and had plenty of options. The free wireless in rooms and business center were also nice. Our room was very large, but could have used some updating. We would not hesitate to stay here again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, convenient to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: chs80
Reviews.Content: We arrived too early to check in, but staff secured our luggage and we started discovering Chicago and came back at 4pm and had no problem checking in. Room was lovely, complete with stove top,dishwasher, full sized refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave. Would be great for families to cut down on dining out expenses. The full breakfast everyday was wonderful and yes you had to wait for a table, but that cut down on the confusion of everyone wanting to find a table at one time. The lady that worked 2 of the 3 days we were there was very friendly. The breakfast had a huge selection and was very satisfying to get fueled up for a day of walking and site seeing. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful. Three ladies getting away for a girls weekend had trouble getting the cork out of our wine bottle and the valet attendant was oh so nice in getting the cork removed for us! Kind of embarrassing to admit that :). Anyway would definately stay again at this hotel. Everyone was very friendly and helpful with any and all questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “food odors!!”
Reviews.Author: lakelover1950
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the Homewood is right down the hall from the kitchen and dining room(actually more of a grade school cafeteria type set up). The odors from the kitchen were disgusting, and indeed reminded my of that of a institutional kitchen(I.e. hospital). The free breakfast and free dinner were not at all palatable. I suppose that if you are traveling with a young family as many guests were, that makes this hotel a good value. But i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyInMissouri
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites, Downtown, was great. Toni, checked us in, and she was great. She gave us a room on the 17th floor because my son want to see the skyline at night. They serve breakfast everyday, and it was delicious. Plus, its Free. The staff in the dining room were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. We never ate dinner at the hotel, but one night my husband brought me carrot cake and it was great. The hotel is within walking distance to Grant Park. We would definitely stay here again, and I hope we can go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service & Amenities for our Mom's 90th Birthday Week for 40”
Reviews.Author: apjp3
Reviews.Content: Forty members of our family attended a four day/night 90th birthday week and party for our Mother (Grandmother, Great Grandmother, Sister, Aunt, etc.) and it couldn't have been better. All staff were more than helpful and courteous and friendly. In addition to full kitchens, a full hot breakfast and dinner each day we were able to keep expenses down for everyone. Our hotel contact, Alec Schraegle, worked with us over a year's planning and not only met but exceeded our expectations. Our family has stayed at this hotel for several years and have always been delighted with our choice. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasFamilyMan
Reviews.Content: Pretty much ditto with everything everyone else has said. I will add one comment that I think family's with small children need to be aware of. I was sitting on the floor with my 2yr old watching the scenery from our room and noticed that there are handles about 2 1/2 ft above the floor. I turned the handles and the window opened up from the top inward. My wife kinda freaked thinking how dangerous it was. There was actually a sign above it to warn guests. Of course my little girl wanted to open it again, and I told her not to and didn't have any more issues. We were on the 17th floor. Not a huge issue, but definitely something to be aware of if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Great Location, friendly service!, Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: mz15
Reviews.Content: Been to Chicago about 5 times so far... & by far the Homewood Suites was our favorite hotel we have stayed. It's only a block away from the subway/ L . The breakfast was great! Pretty busy. We didn't take advantage of the Happy hour, but I am sure it was great as well. We had a great view from our Room as well. This hotel has a perfect location. very close to Mag Mile & centrally located in downtown Chicago. The rooms were very clean. full kitchen w / utensiles as well. we couldnt believe we had a full fridge too. Worked well w left over food (deep dish !) and for any drinks as well. Can't say enough about this hotel! We will stay here again. Highly recommended ! Free wi-fi was very nice. also had a (free) full access business center w printers.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: sue-manchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed, for the second time, the last week in June and till 4th July. We stayed here the same time last year and had such a great time we decided to return - which can sometimes be a disappointment, but we needn't have worried. It was great. The one bed suite (2 x doubles and a large sofa bed) was large, clean and comfortable (and brilliantly appointed). We found the hotel to be comfy, the staff (door, reception, housekeeping and dining room) are the nicest we've come across in a hotel, the place was quiet (husband a very fussy / light sleeper, and even he was happy). This was the first stop on our USA trip and the little coin laundry was a huge bonus (everything washed and dried, in 2 hours,for $3). Jewel Osco supermarket & California Pizza Kitchen, both just round the corner, kept us going for conveniant, cost effective meals and snacks and the nearby Binny's Beer Depot kept my husband very happily in beer! Chicago is a wonderful, vibrant city and we will return - and when we do, we will definately stay at the Homewood Suites

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsClean76
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time at this hotel, and once again it was a great stay. This time I brought some family members who had their own room. The staff is friendly and never seemed stressed even though the hotel was filled to capacity the night we were there. Breakfast is crowded on the weekends, but having to wait for the host to seat you is a nice touch - no one takes your table and it seems more like a restaurant. This time we had a huge room, but it was very oddly shaped. Get a corner room if you can, they are small, but have 2 windows in the living area. The location is perfect, right across the street from Nordstrom and Shops at Northbridge. The fitness room is small, but does the trick. The only downside is that there is a pool, but no hot tub. There are plenty of restaurants within a block or two. It's not the fanciest place in town, but it is certainly the best hotel for the price ($99 pre-paid). I'll be back again next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: laurenyulan
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience from the moment we pulled up in front of the hotel. The valet/bellhops are so friendly. Check-in was a breeze. We had a one bedroom suite with a pull-out sofa. The kitchen was well equipped. Breakfast was great - everything you could think of and they changed it up each day. The hotel was packed but they did a great job of getting people in and out. We never waited more than 5 minutes to get a table. The pool was clean and warm and our kids spent a lot of time in it. The hotel is in a great location - central to the miracle mile and navy pier. If you are going to be there for a few days, get the bus pass - it's worth it. We used the bus a lot. Everytime we had to go somewhere and didn't want to talk, we just went to the front desk and the girls would tell us exactly which buses to take. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Suziboo
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites Chicago was a new find for us on our annual siblings reunion weekend. The hotel was running a weekend rate special in May, and it looked nice in photos, so we took a chance. The hotel is in the River North section, and parking is expensive - $34-42 a day, depending on whether you choose garage or valet service. But, the location is worth it, it's a block from the Loop train (underground at State and Grand). And, you can walk everywhere in Chicago from this hotel, which is nice on a wonderful summer weekend. The suite is arranged with a kitcen, dining table for 2, a sleeper sofa and chair is one room, and a king size bed and the bath in the other room. The bathroom sink is separate from the toilet and shower, which is convenient. The kitchen has a dishwasher, serveware, coffee maker and toaster, plus a microwave and a 2 burner stove. And it has granite countertops, a nice touch. This hotel is thrilling all of the little ones, and fitness freaks. The 19th floor has a very nice pool,, 4 feet deep and long enough to do some laps. I have never seen so many well-behaved children under constant parental supervision in a hotel before, which I loved (thanks to parents who understand it's important to watch your kids at all times). There are lots of towels and tables and chairs for parents to relax, looking out over the city to the west. The fitness center has nice free weights, heavy balls and treadmills. If you prefer, there is a complimentaty pass to the health club Crunch next door. The full breakfast is a full breakfast - sausage and biscuits, corned beef, bacon, scrambled eggs, pastries, french toast, cereals, yogurt and cottage cheese, fresh fruit, toasted breads, coffee, tea, juices. They serve the breakfast in a dining hall that is crowded at peak times, so you can pack a box from the breakfast buffet and take it back to your room. No dinky cups, either...everything is full sized, and they keep replenishing the buffet until closing time. Outside the hotel, Nordstroms across the street has great sales, and you can walk inside through a mall to get to Michigan Avenue 2 blocks to the east - convenient on a rainy day. Restaurants in the area offer every kind of food. We tried Shaw's Crab House and Rockit and were very pleased. Be sure to try Ina's on W. Randolph for breakfast, too. Also not to miss in the area are Millennium Park - what a fun place for kids - and the beaches along Lake Michigan. We tried a street fair to the north and had a nice walk after having lunch there. Last but not least, the wireless access to the internet. It's free, and there's a router in each room above the kitchen cabinets. We had to reboot the router each time we signed on - unplug the power for a few seconds, then reconnect it. It worked each time we tried that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kcroadtripper
Reviews.Content: This was the first of two hotels we stayed at during the week during NPE Week. Overall, the three day stay was very good. Room was large, very clean, bed very comfortable, free internet, clean kitchen and kids enjoyed the pool and breakfast was a huge convenience. Dinners are provided in the evening during the week even though we didn't take advantage of this. Staff response upon arrival and check in was luke warm, but so were we after an 8 hour drive. We tried to switch our room from a default king reservation to a double, but the front desk wasn't too responsive about our request. They offered a roll a way bed, but we used the sofa bed for the kids instead. I would have preferred they rectify the situation, but I let it slide. Workout room is very nice, but it was 80+ degrees. They also offer a free pass to Crunch Gym next door. Great location! 24 hour business center was a great feature too! I was able to use the facility to print discount tickets to an attraction. Loved this!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: martinez121
Reviews.Content: Great staff, location, rooms and breakfast!!!!!We stayed w/ our 15 yr old daughter and our 7 yr old son and had plenty of room in our 1bedroom suite. We arrived 2 hours early and we were able to check in at no additional charge. Every staff member was so helpfull. The ladies at the front desk were always giving us great directions! We can't wait to go back to Chicago and this is the ONLY place we will stay. Martinez family (st louis)

Reviews.Title: “Just another YES vote”
Reviews.Author: DivemistressofthDark
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to what others have already stated - it's a terrific hotel. The rooms are immaculate and large, the location is outstanding, it has gorgeous views of nearby architectural marvels, it's walking distance from the Art Institute, which for my money is the best museum in the USA. It's also less than a block from the subway, right on top of worldclass shopping and dining, and a 10-minute walk from the fabulous House of Blues music venue. On top of it all, it's quiet as a churchyard so you sleep like a baby in the awesome padded mattresses, there's great water pressure, and no worries buying a snack - even in the middle of the night, as there's a vending area in the lobby. The ventilation is excellent - we were neither too hot nor too cold. The room darkening shades were 100% with no rips or other gaps for light to blaze through in the morning. (I'm a super light sleeper and quiet/dark/ventilation are all important issues for me - Homewood passed with flying colors.) Also! Free wi-fi, which is often the reason Hilton steals me away from my other loyalty program at Sheraton - who wants to be nickel and dimed? The ONLY reason I'm not giving this place five stars is I think $42 is too much for valet parking and the rooms themselves are expensive, at $189 for a king suite - this is before taxes. Also, one of the elevators was broken during our stay and even though we could use the service elevator, there was a 10-minute wait sometimes to get downstairs. Still, the service was excellent and combined with the other pluses of this property, we'll be back for 100% certain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Right in the Thick of Things”
Reviews.Author: lamist
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at this hotel and we had a great time. The suite was really nice and it was fun to look out the window and see all the high rises. It was a wonderful location - there was so much you could walk to! We walked to the river and took a cruise and we walked to Harry Caray's for dinner. There was also a red metro right by there and we went to a game at Wrigley Field. It only took about 20 minutes to reach Wrigley. I would stay here again next time I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jojo316
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood suites in Chicago for a quick family trip. I cannot praise it highly enough ! The room was clean with contemporary decor. We stayed in a King Suite, which had plenty of room. We arrived before check in time. However, they checked our bags and parked our car allowing us to explore the City until we could check in. When we did check in, they brought our bags to our room within minutes. Everyone was so nice and helpful..from the valets to the bellmen to the front desk. Breakfast was complimentary and was more than adequate for our family to start our day. Sure it was not the $20 a head buffet at the Hilton, but nobody walked away hungry. The pool had a spectacular view of the city at night. The hotel is conveniently located to everything the city has to offer. The Valets are quick to hail a cab for you or provide information to get you anywhere you need to go. The best part of the service was that when we accidentally left our car key at the valet station when we left ( I thought they gave it to my husband and he thought they gave it to me...my husband used his key to start the car) we called the hotel the next day when we discovered it and they promptly fed-Exed the key back to our house,,,it arrived home before we did !!! The Homewood Suites is going to be our choice in downtown chicago with that kind of service ! ALso the price was right,too. We paid $139.00 for a King Suite. Yes the valet parking at $42.00 is a bit steep, but this is downtown chicago. YOu could use one of the many self parks in the area and save about $10-$15 bucks and carry your luggage about 2-3 blocks to the hotel...but the convenience of the valet was well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “I'll try to stay here every time.”
Reviews.Author: Lisamarch
Reviews.Content: For the same price as nearby hotels, I got a 2-room suite. Bedroom with king bed, bathroom with toilet and shower separated by a door from the sink and closet. Also a big kitchen/living room and desk. Free wireless didn't work in my room but did work in the lobby. Staff was VERY helpful and offered to have me move rooms but the wired internet worked so I stayed in my original room and it worked great. Kitchen had everything you would need for an extended stay. Great location by restaurants, shopping and bars. FULL breakfast is free in the morning, as well as FULL dinner every evening. I'm going to try to stay here every possible time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites is affordable, centrally located, and offers great service.”
Reviews.Author: Brad1974
Reviews.Content: When making my reservation, I made it for one of the most busiest weekends during the summer Memorial Day. The staff was able to get my family in at an affordable rate. The suites are very spacious, clean, cozy, and comfortable. Upon on arriving staff were friendly, willing to exceed expectations, and serve me with enthusiasm. The Hot Breakfast was delicious each morning. The beds are very comfortable and provided a good nights rest. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and anyone who need additional space when traveling and on a budget compared to other Chicago hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location is what makes this hotel shine”
Reviews.Author: TouringSam
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Friendly staff. Decent price for the room is you book early. The hotel's location is great, which I think is the major attraction here. Plenty of restaurants all around: Weber Grill Restaurant, OYSY (sushi), Joe's, Flemings (steak), a few blocks down on Rush is Giordano's. Nordstrom's is right across the street. Michigan avenue is a block or two east. The Red line for the El is just around the corner. The hotel itself isn't what I'd call 'incredible' (a few nicks and dings on the wall, some wallpaper starting to peel in the corner) but it's clean, the staff is friendly and accommodating, the "Welcome Home" is nice (M-F 5 pm - 7 pm), the free breakfast is great because it runs late enough for late sleepers and its a hot breakfast - not just cereal, fruit, and toast. Free WiFi in the rooms. Only negative here is the $42 valet parking. Plenty of parking garages around the hotel but they run roughly the same cost for overnight parking. I recommend this hotel, and if I visit Chicago again, I'm staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: oldpatrol
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Homewood Suites Downtown. The breakfast is good. It has eggs , sausage, biscuits, cereal etc. Then the managers reception was wine or beer, but they also had food that if you are on a budget could double as a meal. The rooms were good sized. It had a livingroom, kitchenette, and nice sized bedroom. I had a corner room that had a window in the living room and another in the bedroom. The kitchenette had a full sized refrigerator, stove/oven, microwave and a diswasher. The weight room is located on the 19th floor and what a view of Chicago. The windows are ceiling to floor and are an awesome sight while excercising. The had treadmills (2), eliptical and a bike. Additionally they had a good variety of freeweights. Great restaurants are located withing two blocks or less (ESPN Zone, The Weber Grill, Rock Bottom to name a few). Additionally the Miracle Mile is only about two nblocks away as well. The thing that really endeared me to the hotel were the friendliness of the workers. It's apparent that a lot of people are returning customers because the workers were calling them by name and they'd see them again next week etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference at the Marriott across the street. This was cheaper and more comfortable. As other reviewers have noted, this is a gem of a hotel. It's a true suite, with living room, full kitchen, and bedroom. The living room has a sofabed, sitting chair, coffee table and 32" LCD TV. There is a small dining table/desk next to the kitchen. The kitchen has microwave, two burner oven, dishwasher, coffee maker, fridge. Also plates, pots/pans and silverware. The room was clean and comfortable with no obvious signs of wear. The king size bed was also comfy, though not as high end as you would find in a nicer hotel. There is a regular tube TV in the bedroom. The free buffet breakfast had scrambled eggs, meats, cereal, make your own waffles, etc. There is also a dinner with a different menu Mon-Thurs but I did not have that. There is a gym inhouse, but you can use the Crunch gym next door (same building) that is much bigger and has everything. The entrance is not much to look at; just an elevator to the sixth floor where reception is. But the bellman was friendly and the reception desk was efficient and very friendly. It does cost a lot to park here (I think $42/night so don't bring a car). There is a small store next to reception, open 24/7. Free wired and wireless internet in the room. Only minor complaint is that the walls are somewhat thin so if the neighbor raises his voice I can hear it. Also, I can hear water running next door. But all in all I would definitely stay here again. It's much more comfortable and better value than the big hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “best feeling”
Reviews.Author: rdakers38
Reviews.Content: Just a really nice place, great service, big rooms, excellent value, everyone seemed to be having a good time , loved the buffet meals,

Reviews.Title: “Super location with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: ealu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate a wedding anniversary and found these suites a fantastic place to stay. The location couldn't be better - a stone's throw from the magnificent mile and loads of restaurants. The facilities in the hotel are great - there's plenty of variety available for breakfast and they make it easy for people to bring food back to their suites for later (handy if you want to go to the gym / pool first and might not be back in time for breakfast). We popped down for the complementary food / drink one of the evenings also and there was a lovely atmosphere in the dining area with some groups just enjoying a few drinks, others full dinners etc; we were very surprised it was free! The pool was grand though the changing room was small. The gym was small too but that shouldn't bother too many people as you've free access to Crunch Fitness anyway. We heading down each morning and had the pool and gym to ourselves. The pool gets very busy after breakfast though with lots of kids and parents enjoying themselves. There are lovely views over the city there too. The free wifi was handy too. The staff were very friendly and happy to help out when we needed anything. There are no real negatives apart from the fact that the decor was a bit dowdy looking on our floor but in fairness, they are in the process of doing up some of the rooms at the moment anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel and Super Location!”
Reviews.Author: freeflykym
Reviews.Content: My kids, ages 10 and 7, are still raving about the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! We stayed Thursday-Sunday, and enjoyed complimentary breakfasts (which offered many selections, not just continental). We also had a complimentary dinner on Thursday, which included burgers, fries, coleslaw, soda, beer and wine. The location was great. A free trolley just outside the front door, took us to Navy Pier. I would highly recommend this hotel for families. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites Chicago is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: imacubsfan
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. I stayed with some friends and family in middle April for my bachelor party. The location of the hotel is great with multiple restaraunts nearby and only 1/2 a block to the red line train. The included breakfast in the morning is great and free wifi is also included! Everyone at the hotel is extremely friendly and you cannot beat the rates. I will definately stay at this hotel again in the future and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are taking the kids.”
Reviews.Author: kimbill97
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel if you are taking a family vacation. We went on a Wed. - Sat. so we got to enjoy not only the breakfast buffet, but also the afternoon buffet. Our children are 8 and 6. They loved the ravioli and the hot dogs and the fountain drinks. My husband was ecstatic to find beer on tap. (Note that this is only offered Mon. - Thur.) The location is wonderful. We walked to the American Girl Doll store and also Garrets Popcorn which we highly recommend. Staff was always pleasant and helpful. The pool was great as it was only 4'6" in the deep end so we were able to let the kids swim while we sat and watched. The rooms are clean and spacious but I would never call them romantic or extravent. We had a king bed and the kids slept on the sofa sleeper in the main room. Perfect. If returning on a couples weekend, I'd try for a different style hotel but this was an awesome family vacation. The kids had a blast. Directly across the street is a mall with a Legos store.( didn't find it until the last night or the kids would have dragged us there everyday.) Also near the ESPN Zone restaurant and game room. The boys went nuts. Again, would return Homewood Suites on next vacation with the children.

Reviews.Title: “Made our experience in Chicago wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: watergirls
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff, bellman and valet staff were wonderful! They totally made us feel welcome and at home. The rooms were better than expected! Our children enjoyed the pool and the view was astounding! We really enjoyed being in the "middle of it!" It was within walking distance of Rainforest Cafe, Ed Debevics, Hard Rock Cafe & Water Tower Place. We were constantly asking staff questions and they always went above and beyond with their answers. The complimentary breakfast was delicious! This is probably the most welcome we have ever felt at a hotel and will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice with kids”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSunlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights recently and had a fantastic trip. The hotel's location is the biggest plus--so close to so many amazing restaurants and lots of great shopping. The free breakfast and supper were a huge hit with our 3 kids, although it was quite busy, especially at breakfast time. However, there was always lots of food being replenished. The pool was a big hit with our kids, and they didn't complain at all about the temperature. Staff was helpful and friendly, the rooms were very clean and spacious. The kitchenette with full fridge, microwave, dishwasher etc. was great! Parking is expensive, but so are all the chicago hotels downtown. We will definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: donkin
Reviews.Content: Weekend trip to celebrate our anniversary. Location was great with a wide selection of restaurants nearby. Another plus is that Trader Joe's was within two blocks. With a full size fridge, it was easy to shop and keep items cold. Suite was very clean and well appointed. Fridge with icemaker, dishwasher, microwave, 2 burner stove, Only reason for the 4 rating was one elevator was temporarily our of service on Sunday. Great room rate of $99. - but $42/day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds223
Reviews.Content: We were so happy we followed the advice of other TripAdvisor reviewers and booked this hotel. The location is perfect, and everyone that worked there was so nice, so helpful, and seemed genuinely happy doing their jobs. The room was very nice, and extremely clean. My only complaint was that the walls were a bit thin-or the children across the hall from us were a bit loud. Maybe a combination of both? Also, the hotel website noted 2 flat screen TVs in each suite, which we didn't have, there were 2 TVs, but only 1 was flat screen. The breakfast was wonderful-can't say how much we liked that, and the location was near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location. Very good value.”
Reviews.Author: ck1220
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for 1 night. We just wanted to stay in downtown Chicago. This hotel is right next to John Hancock building. Walking distance to many shopping, restaurant, and everything else. From valet people to front desk people, they were all very friendly and helpful. The best thing about this hotel (other than the awesome location) is that all rooms are suites. You can choose 1 king or 2 double which will be inside the room and you get another sofa bed in the living room area. You get 2 TVs also. The roof top pool over looking Michigan lake was lovely also.

Reviews.Title: “It's all in the details...”
Reviews.Author: XOXOGossipGirl72
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and have stayed in every type of hotel from luxury boutiques to chains... and I have yet to ever find such a great mix of service and ammenities as I have consistently seen here at the Homewood. As everyone mentions, this place is in a fantastic location. Anything you could want to do or see is either within walking distance or by nearby public transportation. But what really sets this place apart is in the details. The people that work here do their jobs well- but with the added detail of actually enjoying it. Everyone was so helpful but most importantly - sincere. The suites are fantastic with the added details of soft linens (I have never in my life felt such a soft towel) and thoughtful ammenities. The free food at breakfast and cocktail hour is a great value add with the added detail of take away containers for those that want to eat in their rooms. Everything about this place is perfect. Also - it is great for families - my daughter adores swimming in the very nice indoor pool (with an awesome view of the city) and the food and location make it just perfect for fun family time. We ate at Rainforest Cafe and the Melting Pot which are both a few blocks away. We had a total blast. Can't wait for my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: cgaston86
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites is a grat hotel overall, and the location is perfect. Roomy rooms with full kitchen was perfect. Only complaint I have is that the housekeeping came to our room TWICE in the morning while we were still in the room. Didn't knock, AND we had the "Do not Disturb" sign on our door. I'm not sure what the problem was, but it was really annoying and rude. Overall, the hotel was nice and the breakfast was good. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: candi-lee
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Attentive service. Clean, attractive, comfortable. Beds very comfortable. The pool is a little small and pretty cold too. Would have loved a hot tub after being out exploring all day in December. Nice gym next door that you can use. Grocery across the street and also a mall across the street. Short walk to Magnificent Mile and public transportation. The entire stay was great. What I really loved was returning to the hotel at dinner time with our group of seven (four teenagers) and having a hot dinner buffet waiting. I wanted to throw my arms around the staff and thank them. It was healthy, hot, delicious, and oh so convenient. Would definitely stay again. A big thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: doctorjr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago and wow, were we impressed! This is a great value for a downtown Chicago hotel. The location is wonderful. We walked everywhere from the Magnificent Mile, to the Navy Pier, to Millenium and Grant Park, to the Field Museum of Natural History (that was a pretty good hike though!) The downtown trolley stop is right around the corner, and we also got a cab easily one night. There are tons of restaurants nearby. The original deep dish pizza place, Pizzeria Uno, is on one corner , the ESPN Sports Zone restaurant is on another, and the Weber Grill restaurant around the block, to name a few. There was also a good brewery nearby for drinks. The suite was quite spacious with a full kitchen and a large bathroom. There was a TV in both the sitting area and the bedroom. We were on the 19th floor at the end of the hall and never heard anyone else, so it was quite restful. The building has one of the fastest elevators I've ever ridden on! There is a heated pool (no hot tub!) and small fitness room on the 19th floor, and guests can also use a fitness club that is next door. We went to the fitness club one of the days we were there and enjoyed the expanded equipment they had. Our room had complimentary wireless, and we had no problems with the internet connection. The complimentary breakfast was typical of the hot breakfast buffets with eggs, meat, waffles, fruit, etc., but I thought there were a few touches that made it above the standard. The fruit was all fresh, including fresh pineapple, and there were real dishes and silverware, not plastic. There were two attendants who kept everything stocked and cleared our tables. The dining area was large and comfortable. We were there for one night of the Manager's Special (weeknights, 5 - 7pm) and were shocked at how much food was served. It was really enough for a meal, not the light snacks we expected. We noticed several people doing carryouts to eat in their room, which was easy to do with the full kitchen and refrigerator. We had friendly and polite service from everyone we encountered the entire time, from the valets, to the front desk, to the dining area attendants, and cleaning staff. It seemed like there were just a lot of special touches, like bowls of snacks sitting out when we checked in (tired and hungry) and the complimentary daily newspaper. We got the suite for $119, which was an amazing value for downtown Chicago and the amenities it had. The only downside that others have commented on is the parking costs ($38). However, it was pretty comparable to the costs for parking at other downtown hotels, and it was nice to know that our car was safe in a covered lot. Overall, this was a great hotel experience and good value, and I would highly recommend it to anyone, especially families who need more space and can cut food costs with the complimentary breakfast and Manager's Special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel1961
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed every interaction with the staff at the Homewood but unfortunately the room that we stayed in was in urgent need of an update. We arrived extremely early and were allowed to book in. Star from the front desk called us after we have arrived in the room and asked if everything was okay. At this point it was. Went to the dining room and 30mins prior to it closing, there was nothing to be found and the coffee had run out with people standing, sitting everywhere. Perhaps Homewood would consider extending their breakfast hours so the congestion would diminish. Asked the bellman if there was a place to eat breakfast and he recommended Mary's cafe. This is a quick 2 block walk and we enjoyed our breakfast.
