Later that evening, we noticed that the mirrored closet door was broken, there were stains on the ceiling from former leaks and the tv in the bedroom had such bad reception, we could only watch 2 channels. I'm sure if I had asked to be moved it would have been no problem but we were only staying for 2 nights so did not bother. The Homewood is located very close to Michigan Ave and is surrounded by wonderful restaurants. It is a great choice for a first time visitor to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home!”
Reviews.Author: jilltruely
Reviews.Content: I just visited the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago with my family. I can't say enough good things about our stay! Our room was beautilful and we had an amazing view. The staff was so kind and helpful. The location could not be beat, we were close to everything and right across from Nordstrom! With two free meals during the week the hotel was an excellent value. The breakfast is served daily and offers many options. I have family in the area and I will stay at this hotel again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Amsdentraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel more than met our expectations. It is in a nice spot just a couple blocks east of Michigan Avenue. We have two young children (3 years and 4 months) and the hotel quickly sent up a pack and play for a crib. The room was set up as a suite with a nice sized living area. The living area has a couch that folds out to a bed which had clean sheets already there and bedding in the closet. The living are also had a small refrigerator and sink. There was a nice sized bathroom and and a smaller but nice separate bedroom. Checking the Tripadvisor.com review on this hotel we saw poor remarks about the staff. I had the opposite experience. The staff was helpful, friendly, and prompt. They went the extra mile for us even though I booked our room through priceline. This is what I would expect from a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay for this Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very nicely in the heart of Chicago downtown. Located one block east of Michigan Ave. There are actually 4 Hilton Properties within 3 blocks of this hotel (Conrad, Embassy Suites & Hilton Garden Inn) Upon getting to the hotel we were met by the Bellman who assured once we got checked in that our bags would be brought to our room. We were able to check in early (10AM) On New Years Eve and were originally given a room on the 19th floor. However, upon getting to the 19th floor we tried getting into the room and the key wouldn't work. We went back to the front desk and found out that someone was in this room still. (Oops.) Then we were given a room on the 18th floor (Room 1811) Nice 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen (which would be useful when the family was here or if staying for long periods of time) Room was comfortable and all was in working order. Internet access was a little slow at times, but all in all very comfortable. The hotel is located one block from Michigan Ave, 5 blocks from the Navy Pier and across the street from Shops at Northbridge. If you want to see famous people and sports figures (I would suggest Joes Stone Crab. (Located right on the corner of the hotel) We saw the Coach of the Bulls, Rex Grossman, Brian Urlachers, Jonathan Toews & Coach of the Bears there during our New Year's Dinner. Oprah and Barbara Striesand had been there two nights previous. The hotel is located one short block from the (Grand Red Line Subway) An enjoyable experience and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JakeHKent
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have visited Chicago but have stayed at Hampton Inns in Florida. The Hampton Inn in Chicage was fully booked so had to stay at Homewood Suites but we were glad that we did as it was a great location, lovely suite with all the amenities and room to stretch out. Breakfast was a plus, you needed to get there before 0830 or there was a queue although you didn't have to wait long. Rooms were clean, very comfortable & staff were pleasant and helpful and there were lots of eating places close by to suit all tastes and pockets. All in all a reasonable priced hotel that I could thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: eliseLouisville_Ky
Reviews.Content: Free breakfast buffet, free dinner (Mon-Thurs), indoor heated pool, huge suites with full kitchens and separate bedrooms, one block from Michigan Avenue, across the street from Nordstrom's and a block from Bloomingdales, helpful, friendly, can-do-anything-you-ask-for service...what more could a family of four from Louisville, KY want?? We loved it and will definitely return on our next trip to Chicago. Also loved that tripadvisor did all the work for me! No research required.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: connecticutpat
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at Homewood Suites. The hotel is clean, room was a nice size, bed very comfortable, location is the best, walking distance to everything. Free breakfast every morning which was a nice plus. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: numandruman
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel. Bed was comfortable. Nice flat screen TV in living room. 1 BR suite we reserved had a full kitchen. We didn't use it but it seemed to be just the thing for a longer stay. Right across the street is the Shops at Northbridge and Michigan Ave is one block to the east. This hotel is pretty close to everything including restaurants, shopping and night life. Valet parking was smooth. Hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. It was a very comfortable place to stay and I would recommed it to anyone, especially those on a budget who want to stay someplace nice.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mackoy
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit in Chicago for business purpose, I stayed at this wonderful place for about four mos. It's been the best stay in my life in this kind of hotel. All the people are courteous and very very approchable. I very nice room, good food and it's near in almost all of the nicest spots in Chicago. I will never forget my stay in Chicago, i've been in other countries but this is my unforgettable stay. Thank you Homewood.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service - the Breakfast Staff is supurb !”
Reviews.Author: getty2go
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Homewood Suites all the time on business but have not stayed there on business since 2005 - since that time my company has been doing business in the suburbs instead of downtown. During December of 2007 and this year 2008 I did stay there a few days with my family and was greeted as if I never left. There is a lady named Connie who works the breakfast shift and she greets everyone and always remembers you from years before. A wonderful lady indeed - my wife even commented to me on the way to Chicago if that lady would still be there and would still remember and yes she does! Its a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MommaSuie
Reviews.Content: I had searched several websites for a downtown hotel as we wanted to do some shopping prior to attending the musical "Wicked". I was a little apprehensive about choosing the Homewood, but had a friend tell me I would be pleasantly surpised. I booked two King Suite rooms, one for myself and daughter, the other for a friend and her son. The rooms were very comfortable. The concierge, desk clerk, housekeeping were more than accomodating and welcoming. They appear to make every effort for your stay to be as perfect as possible. The hotel was very quiet in the hallways, even though it was busy. The free buffet breakfast was delicious and was more than expected. If you are looking for a centrally located hotel near Michigan Ave. and would like the best deal for the price, this hotel is it. It does not have the magnificient views of motels directly on Michigan Ave. but it truly is a hidden gem. I will choose this hotel for future use when staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for near Mich Ave”
Reviews.Author: MGreene16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Thanksgiving night since we were joining family at Lawry's two blocks away for Thanksgiving dinner. We booked using Hilton points and called ahead for early check in. Arrived about 1:30 and the room was ready; there was free pink lemonade and snack mix in the lobby along with hot drinks. The front staff was very friendly and efficient. The lemoade was gone in the evening but there was a small store behind reception where you could but drinks, snacks, and souvenirs. Our room was on the 15th floor facing south with a great view of the downtown buildings including the beautiful new 90 story Trump Tower and the back of the Wrigley Building. We're long time Chicago area dwellers so it was nice to see the new addition to the skyline, especialy at night. The living room of the suite had a small kitchenette with a table and two chairs, a sofa bed, and an easy chair. The kitchen was simply but adequately stocked for cooking/dining ; the sofa bed felt "springy" but our 20 year old son seemed to sleep fine. The living room had a flat panel TV; the bedroom an older CRT. The entire suite had interesting art of Chicago architecture. The bedroom was a little small (you had to close the dresser drawer to get around the end of the bed) but nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. There was a single sink across from the closet and the toilet/bath in a separate room. It would have been nice to be able to get to the bathroom directly from the living room but they did fit a lot into a small space. The breakfast buffet the next morning was crowded and we had to wait 10 minutes for a table, but the food was good. The waffle maker had the longest line so that held up the meal. Everything else was being constantly refilled. Overall it was a step up from Hampton but not as good as Embassy Suites. Oddly enough we could smell the 6th floor buffet in the hall on the 15th floor. We picked this hotel because of its rating, and the proximity to Lawry's, Michigan Avenue, and the Loop. The location was perfect; we strolled N Mich Ave a for an hour after checking in, walked the two blocks to Lawry's (GREAT Thanksgiving meal), and the next morning walked to see the <Macy's> windows in the Loop (nothing like the old Marshall Field windows).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for toddlers, lots of comps, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kid74
Reviews.Content: Great place for kids! First, this place was a great value. We booked the park n play package, which included parking ($38) for $139 so it was basically $100 a night for a one bedroom suite. Especially given the location (right in the middle of downtown with great access to all the attractions) we thought this was an amazing deal. The room isn't huge, but was large enough for our family of four (1 and 3 year old) and it's always nice to have a separate room to put the kids! The other great perk to the stay was the free breakfast and dinner on weekdays. We thought the meals would be simple snack type fare, but it turned out to be full meals! The convenience of rolling out of bed and getting a hot breakfast downstairs was great. I figure we saved about twice the cost of the hotel just in food. As others have mentioned, the location is perfect. We took the free trolley right outside the hotel to Navy Pier to visit the Children's Museum. We also had less than a five minute ride to the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Adler Planetarium. We didn't make it to Millenium Park, but that was close by as well. The shopping was also great. The Nordstrom's/Mall is directly across the street and Michigan ave is less than one block away. One tip, there's a Jewel Osco less than a block away, great for stocking up on milk and other perishables for the full size fridge. All in all, highly recommended and we will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Hidden in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: budzy1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with suite rooms. The staff was very friendly - even on a very busy Saturday stay. My family and I stayed for the night of the Festival of Lights on Michigan Avenue. The Michigan Avenue area (a block away) was extremely crowded as expected for the holiday parade. However, the hotel never felt crowded. The pool was clean, heated, an average size for a city hotel. The breakfast was very good. The service was excellent. We would consider staying at the property again for a weekend escape.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mariejolie
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites by Hilton was very clean, we stayed in a non-smoking King Suite which was roomy for my husband and me. The buffet served was good, service very helpful. We stayed a whole week and were very comfortable with the accommodations. We loved the free use of the gym Crunch right next door and took full advantage. The location of the hotel is also very good. All in all, it was a really pleasant trip for us both.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot ask for more”
Reviews.Author: tdboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for three nights while at a conference at the McCormick Place and took taxi's back and forth. This is one great place to stay in downtown Chicago. A great full breakfast each morning and a nice dinner with wine and beer each night are included in your rate. My room was clean and well kept with a great LCD TV in the living area and another TV in the bedroom. Free WIFI in the room is what all hotels should be offering these days. The shower and bathroom were clean and new looking. Location is fabulous, right across the street from Nordstromâ€™s and many other shops. While I did not rent a car and took a shuttle bus from the airport I did notice that parking was over $30.00 a day so I would not recommend a car. There is little need for a car in downtown Chicago anyway. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is travelling to downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Bunnyrabbit115
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Homewood Suites for a girl's weekend in downtown Chicago. The location is great--just a block or two from Michigan Avenue with lots of shopping and restaurants. The main entrance of the hotel faces Nordstrom which is located in North Bridge Mall. Lots of great shopping there and the Nordstrom even has a full-service spa. One of the ladies who was with us had a manicure there and was quite pleased with it. You enter the hotel at the Grand Avenue entrance (there is a valet there) and take the elevator to the 6th floor lobby to check in. The valet personnel and staff at the lobby desk were friendly and professional. Parking is a bit steep: $38/night, but you are in the heart of downtown Chicago..... There is a rooftop pool which we didn't have time to use because we were so busy doing other things, but if you have your heart on soaking in a hot tub, this will not be the place for you.... Breakfast both mornings we were there was quite ample: scrambled eggs, sausage, french toast, bagels and muffins, juice, coffee, biscuits and gravy--lots of choices and all good. Also loved the hot water/coffee station in the lobby with decaf and regular coffee and lots of teas plus hot chocolate packets to make your own and carry to your room! Make sure you head down to Ghirardelli's Chocolate Store where you can get coffee/hot chocolate drinks, of course their signature chocolate candies and even ice cream sundaes and other dessert treats to die for. We also took a horse and carriage ride (35 minutes) around Lakeshore drive and the general downtown area. It was a bit chilly when we went, but we had our Ghirardelli hot beverages, plus the carriage had blankets to put on our laps. Filene's basement, home of great bargains, is next door to Ghirardelli's as is a Borders Book Store. Ate dinner one night at the Grand Lux Cafe. Very, very good. It's owned by the same company that does The Cheesecake Factory. I had a peach bellini to drink and chicken lettuce wraps which was a large portion and I couldn't even finish....desserts are amazing: try the chocolate molten cake or the warm rustic apple pie. Lots of dessert choices--go on their website and check it out. They don't take reservations, so if you go for dinner, try and get there about 4:30. We had a 15 minute wait on a Saturday night and were glad we got in. During our dinner, the lobby area swelled with people waiting for a table...If you get there later than 5:00 pm, expect to wait at least 45 minutes to an hour. Hotel rooms have a nice kitchen area/dining room table--a bit on the small side, but we were on the 11th floor and had a corner room with nice views of the downtown area. Living area had a sofa that turned into a bed. Two of us shared the king-sized bed, and then we ordered a roll-away for the extra person in our party. Nice flat screen tv in the livingroom.....room wasn't ready when our party arrived and check-in staff gave us a bottle of wine to compensate for the wait. Everything was clean and having a refrigerator and all of the usual kitchen utensils (especially wine glasses!) and stove/microwave came in handy when we wanted to heat something up or store it for the next day in the fridge. I would definitely stay here again--it was a bit pricey--aside from the parking, we paid about $280 for our room, but this was a girl's weekend and was a splurge for us. Next time, I will bring my husband and two teenagers here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay with Kids”
Reviews.Author: Mizzou93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel using Hilton Honors points for four nights in a 15th floor non-smoking king suite. We always like the extra space of a suite when traveling with our two children, ages 8 and 6. Pros: The location of this hotel was great for our travel purposes - it was an easy walk to the Navy Pier, up Mag. Mile, to American Girl Place, to the Hancock building and to Gino's East pizza. There is a Nordstrom right across the street from the hotel. We did take a cab to the Field Museum and Art Institute. The suite was clean, beds comfortable, and the carpeting new. The decor was nice. We had a fantastic view of the Hancock building from our room. We appreciated the large fridge. The breakfast (included with the room) was very good - much better than others we've had at other Homewood Suites. The indoor pool was recently refurbished and sparkling clean. The pool is located on the 19th floor (top floor) of the hotel and the city views are amazing - a unique swimming experience! We had the pool all to ourselves, but it is small and could get crowded... Cons: Housekeeping! Our room was not made up until after 4:00 p.m. each day, and we had to call and ask for housekeeping each day. Very annoying! Our other con for this hotel is that there is just a small single sink/vanity area in the bathroom - we prefer the double sinks at Embassy Suites. It could get a little crowded each morning as we all tried to get ready for the day. Also, there is no hot tub in the pool area - that would have been nice to relax in after all of the walking around we did each day. No hotel is perfect, and despite the cons, we would consider this hotel again for a future Chicago stay.

Reviews.Title: “It,s the wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: mascott2
Reviews.Content: Great location,good rooms excellent breakfast(really good choice)pleasant lobby area(Free coffee,juice and fruit for guests)and free use of internet in executive suite)but it,s the staff that most impresses.The guys at the entrace,the dining room wait staff ,the cleaners to reception(Jennifer in particular)all made you feel at home with nothing too much trouble for them.If you want a home away from home then this is the place for you.This is customer care as it should be

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great city”
Reviews.Author: Skiranger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights without any problems. Hotel seemed clean and was run efficiently. Check in is actually on the 6th floor, but the staff on the ground floor were very helpful and looked after the guests. There is a decent breakfast on offer each morning, although the room can get a little crowded, and there is a lot of walking back and forward to get your cereal, juice, coffee, etc. In the evenings the "welcome home" food and drink is a nice touch, although the beer is a little watery and the wine, well, no comment. The location is ideal, not far from the Magnificent Mile, the Loop, etc. Chicago is a lovely city, I'd definitely go back. But with so many tourists and conventions, it gets a little busy at times. Book your restaurants in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Plus”
Reviews.Author: Poesjenel
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Homewood Suites was just about perfect. The suite was beautiful, quiet and nicely layed out. We were there for the weekend, for a wedding, so we did not use the kitchen but it was nice to have. The full breakfast was just wonderful and very ample. Plus coffee and goodies were available all day long. The location is superb, walk out and you're in the thick of things. Everyone was friendly, helpful and available. It's a hidden gem but not too hidden as it was voted #1 Homewood Suites in America. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kate155
Reviews.Content: I read the review on trip advisor before booking at the Homewood suites. Was very pleased with location, and the room. Location was within walking distance to all attractions, and did not have to take a taxi. Able to walk to navy pier, magnificent mile, theatre district, and milenium park. Booking online saved money, as well as free breakfast and dinners during the week. Allowed more money for shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “So many positives but need redecoration”
Reviews.Author: pwr_stn
Reviews.Content: We stayed midweek for 3 nights - 2 Adults & 2 children. It was our second stay in 12 months. What's good - our children enjoyed the pool, large suites with a tv in the bedroom and also the living area which meant we didnt have to watch disney when taking time out. Buffet breakfast is included in the price - we only had to wait one morning for 5 mins for a table. Staff varied from very helpful to business-like with no bad experiences. The location was ideal for us and the free blueline trolley stops beside the hotel. There's two grocery stores located very close and also some great restaurants. What's bad - the rooms need to be redecorated esp replacing the carpets - my feet were dirty after being barefoot for a couple of hours in the suite, we found fingernail clippings when searching for children's toys before checking out and none of us cut our nails during our stay. Otherwise all other surfaces in the suite were perfectly clean. We will go back but only if we cant find an alternative to tick all the boxes in the pros listed above. 12 months ago I would have given Homewood a 4/5 rating but only a 3 this time solely because of the carpets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay over Memorial Weekend”
Reviews.Author: EBROWN8813
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Memorial Weekend for 2 nites, 2 rooms. Great Hotel, we always love breakfast in morning,and drinks in even when applicable. Around the corner from magnificent Mile,and close to lots of restaurants. Staff was great, we even checked in early before noon,and other room available less than hour later. Fresh fruit was available to us,and bell guys are cool. Suites are on small side compared to other homewoods but no complaints here, house cleaning kept our room clean,and we felt safe!

Reviews.Title: “Always love a homewood suite”
Reviews.Author: MichiganO
Reviews.Content: I love the free breakfast and dinners on weeknights. The hotel is clean and nice rooms The pool needs some updating(but kids don't care) My friend and I took our granddaughters for a grandma grandaughter outing and this hotel was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price for a family!”
Reviews.Author: txhsmom
Reviews.Content: We selected Homewood Suites after looking over all the hotels and searching for convenience, family friendly & value. This hotel had all 3! Right near the bus & rail stations (even though the rail was out of service due to construction). Loved the breakfast in the morning and wonderful price. Kids loved the pool and it was never too busy. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Homewood Suites by Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jlkandjsc
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago & I wanted it to be the best it could be. Since I was going to sightsee I didn't want to spend all the extra money on food so I figured homewood suites was the way to go. After reading all the wonderful reviews I was very excited to have the experience. As soon as we pulled up to homewood suites the valet service was there getting our bags and taking our car to the parking garage. The staff was VERY friendly and called up immediatly to see if our room was ready. Since it wasnt they held our bags so we could go see the city. When we got back to the hotel we were checked in quickly and our bags were brought to us. The room was amazing & had an amazing view. The room was AMAZING but I would have to say that Homewood Suites main star quality is their staff. You will not find a better staff. They were so helpful in our planning and directions. Our last night there I wanted to take a carriage ride. We called down to the front desk and within 10 minutes they had a horse and carriage there to pick us up. This hotel has moved up from #4 to #3 since my stay there. In no time this hotel should be the #1 hotel in Chicago. Very afforadable, great location, great staff. I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Chicao Hotel”
Reviews.Author: waktravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location for walking Chicago's downtown, pier, etc. Mon-Thurs. they offered a wonderful early evening free light dining. Our room had a separate bedroom, extremely clean and quiet. The breakfast was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Location, would come back to Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: 1mybirdie
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews for this and other hotels and once i made my selection i was very pleased to see that all the reviewers were right on about tis hotel. We stayed 7 nights and we loved it. we have a 3 year old and it was such a nice place for kids. my son saw another boy at the pool and at breakfast {awesome spread} and dinner the 4 nights it was served. made it fun for him. We took the cab from the airport as someone suggested $41 with tip. You could take the blue line to Jackson, then transfer to the red-line and get off at grand $2. station is 1.5 blocks from the hotel and lots of people do it. Not scary to travel downtown at all. DO NOT rent a car if you are only going to be downtown and do the tourist stuff. Get a 3 or 5 day CTA card from the grocery store around the corner, get the city-pass well worth it also. There are free shuttles that run all over, the hotel has maps, but the trains and buses are so easy,and less crowded then the free trolley, they also run later. Get the card, i promise you will be glad you did. Grocery around the corner has everything you need if you want to cook in the room. Great great breakfast you can take to the room if you want, mon-thurs dinner is good. beer and wine are served and there is a soda machine so it saves lots of money. if you order UNO's call ahead 1 hour then go pick up the pizza, eat in the room not worth waiting for one of 12 tables. No complaints at all. I found all the travel advice on this site right on and helpful. I hope this helps you. We will go back there. You can't go wrong and the staff is SUPER!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: plumperky
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago and we were a little hesitate about staying downtown. We parked in front of the hotel and the attendants valet parked our car and we went up to the 6th floor to check in. The check-in was quick, we went to our room on the 11th floor and was very pleased to see a really beautiful room with kitchen, table and chairs, a sofa and nice flat screen TV. The bedroom was a separate room with wonderful bedding and many pillows and another large TV. Breakfast was above and beyond for a free meal and then to our surprise they provided a free dinner which was buffet style and offered several choices. The location was very convenience, right out front was the trolley and bus stop but it was only a few blocks to the river, easy walk. For $189.00 this hotel exceeded our expectation's.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for exploring downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mizzoutraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a 3 night stay (Thurs. thru Sat.) at this conveniently located property. Our 9th floor suite included a bedroom with king size bed, a sitting room with a sofa bed,and a kitchen. The room was cheerfully decorated and airy. The views outside the the two large windows was good. We were surrounded by skyscrapers-a pretty view at night. The bathroom was of average size; but lacked vanity space. Only one sink and mirror & no extra shelves to put toiletries. This can be less than ideal if the bath will be shared. It would have also been nice to have a few extra washcloths & hand towels-we kept running out. There are an abundance of interesting restaurants and shopping areas nearby (Nordstrom & Bloomingdales), as well as a movie theater. We especially enjoyed the Melting Pot (fondue) & Big Bowl (Asian)restaurants. We were able to walk to our sightseeing boat tour departure point at the Michigan avenue bridge. Also walked to Macy's. We took the free shuttle right outside the hotel to the Navy Pier as it looked like a bit of a walk.(the shuttle can get very crowded on weekends) On the morning of our departure we received very prompt & pleasant service from the bellman who retrieved our luggage & held a taxi for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Ideal Location and Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JillerBob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood for two nights on a quick but lovely trip to Chicago. When we arrived, the staff were super friendly and very helpful. We arrived early and our room was not quite ready, but the staff offered to keep our bags for us while we went for lunch. Before we could even catch the elevator downstairs (the reception is on the 6th floor), they called us to tell us our room was ready. Great people and very easy check-in. The room was spotless and bigger than we expected! It was perfect and had everything you would need. The best part about the room was the BED! It was surprisingly the most comfortable bed we've slept in! Great location - very close to Magnificent Mile and not far from the Chicago Theatre. A nice walk to Navy Pier and just steps to the red subway line that takes you to Wrigley. We will definitely stay here again - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great experience”
Reviews.Author: roxiemoxie2110
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an overnight at Homewood Suites. We live only 90 minutes away from Chicago so have stayed many many times at the hotels right on Michigan Avenue. This time I shopped around a little and found Homewood Suites and holy cow, what a great value and a great place to stay. It was at least $100 less than the hotels I've stayed at on Michigan Avenue plus we had a suite with a full kitchen and bedroom and this also included breakfast and not just a continental breakfast, a full breakfast of bacon and eggs, hash browns, french toast, fresh fruit, juice, rolls, etc. Really, for the price you cannot go wrong. My 25-year-old daughter and I stayed here over the weekend. She travels a lot for business into Chicago and she said she would highly recommend Homewood Suites to her collegues. Our room was very clean, the kitchen utensils were clean (I checked them all out and am very picky) and the bathroom was huge. The staff were very friendly. The hotel is one block off of Michigan Avenue and close to every place you would want to go for shopping, tourist activities, etc. I would suggest you take the trolley or taxi to Navy Pier as it is a pretty long walk. I will be heading into the city next month and will definitely be staying at Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: l3414
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in an excellent location. Everywhere is easy to get to, Michigan Ave is about 5 mins walk. The Red Line, Grand station about the same. The hotel itself is clean, the rooms are pleasant. We had a suite with a separate bedroom and living area. Our son used the sofa bed in the living area, he said it was comfortable. There were two T.Vs, a kitchen area with fridge/freezer, microwave, dishwasher and two electric rings. The breakfast had a good choice of things, although the room was a little small when the hotel was busy at the weekend, we had to wait for a table. There were containers provided to take breakfast to your though. The breakfast staff are very friendly and polite. There is a dinner with drinks in the evenings, Mon-Thurs. We ate out mostly though, but it seemed popular with people with young children. Only one slight complaint, the lifts are painfully slow, there are only two and at busy times you seem to be waiting a long time. Overall I liked this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Homewood Suites in early July. We we very satisfied with the Hotel, and would recommend it to others who are looking for a good value, a great, centrally located hotel which is close to all attractions, a clean hotel, and friendly service. -Rooms - We had a 1 Bedroom suite (2 of us) - it was roomy and clean. We paid $145 per night, which we considered to be a very good value -Service - The staff was friendly and accomodating. We could not reserve a non-smoking room on-line (sold-out), but when I called 3 days before my trip, the desk manager had no problem blocking a specific room for us to ensure that we got what we wanted. -Food - Breakfast and dinner were included. Breakfast was your standard Homewood fare - eggs, french toast, sausage, bacon, cereal, bagels, etc. A good way to start the day. We did not eat dinner at the hotel (if you aren't on a strict budget, I cannot see eating at the hotel when Chicago has so many great restaurants), but it was full every night. We did help ourselves to beer and wine, which we brough back to our room for an early evening break. -Location - A fairly quiet street, only 1 block from Mag Mile, and right in between Rush and Wabash. We walked everywhere (even all the way up to Linoln Park). Restaurants, theater, stores, the lake are all very close and easy to get to. The Red-line El is 1 block away. Cabs are easy to get. -Restaurants nearby - Joe's Steakhouse, Weber Grill, Rock Bottom Brewery, PF Chang's, Gioprdano's Pizza, Unor's, Due, lots more - all within 2 blocks. All-in-all, a good place to stay. Not the lap of luxury, but a good hotel that I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redroc19
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel for our recent vacation to Chicago. We chose this hotel because we had had a good experience in a Homewood Suites before (and we wanted a separate bedroom so that our baby could sleep without the rest of us having to sit quietly in the dark!) and we were not disappointed. Our room was very quiet considering the hotelâ€™s downtown location. We had a great view of the city and some interesting architecture from our hotel room. The hotel was only about a block from the red line which made using public transportation convenient. The free summer trolley to navy pier stopped right outside the hotel. Unfortunately, we never got to use this, but it would have been fun if we had had more time. The exercise room and pool were pretty nice. The pool was heavily chlorinated and not great for small kids (pretty deep). The hotel also offers free guest passes to the gym next door, but we didnâ€™t get a chance to try that out, either. The breakfast was good, but very crowded. They had someone seating you, which made it seem nicer. The hotel staff members we interacted with were all very friendly. The hotel was a large chunk of our vacation cost, but we felt it was worth it. The hotel is also near some interesting restaurants like Pizzeria Uno and Pizzeria Due and the Weber Grill restaurant (which we didnâ€™t get a chance to eat at, but looked interesting). We wanted to eat a Pizzeria Uno (only about a block away from our hotel), and it worked out well because the wait was 1-2 hours on Saturday night, so we just called to order and waited in our hotel room until the pizza was ready.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better service!”
Reviews.Author: ta337
Reviews.Content: Wow. We had such an excellent stay. The rooms were enormous and exceedingly clean. The front desk staff was incredibly accommodating, anticipating our needs. We were delighted to find that the hot breakfast was yummy and that dinner was provided (with free wine and beer). The location was just incredible. The bellman was helpful. I can't think of anything I would change to be honest. Next time I go to Chicago, I won't even consider another hotel! Oh, Texas de Brazil opened up in the same building as the hotel and the scrumptious odors permeated the elevator. Needless to say, we stayed hungry! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, plenty of space, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: givepa
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the July 4th weekend. The room was spacious for a downtown property, including a kitchen with stove, full size fridge, sink and dishwasher! The rate included breakfast, which was very nice for an inclusive breakfast, several hot items, many pastries, cereals and fruits. The pool was located on the top floor, and although a bit small, kept the children happy. However, there was very limited seats - about 8 total! We were a healthy 15 minute walk to shopping, but the doormen were very attentive and we were able to get a taxi quickly. We did not use the valet parking, which at $38/night is a bit steep. We had a relative who let us use her parking pass down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: cincygyrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls weekend for the 4th of July holiday. The Homewood Suites is wonderful! Loved the FREE breakfast buffet; a different daily selection of hot breakfast items including potatoes, sausage, pancakes, french toast, eggs, etc. and several cold items like yogurt, fresh and cut fruit, juices, etc. Staff was friendly and helpful. FREE trolley to the Navy Pier right outside of hotel. Room was clean, ran out of towels and needed mouthwash; someone came right away with the items. Valet parking and bellhop staff wonderful, very kind! Hotel is in great location within walking distance of many restaurants, magnificient mile, grocery stores, etc. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: lishus
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago. When we arrived our room wasn't ready. They held our bags at the valet area and brought them up promptly when our room was ready..which only took about 30 minutes. Our room was very nice. The suites are great with kitchenette, living area, dining table, bedroom and separate sink area from the bathroom. Our room was very clean with the exception of mildew on the grout in the bathroom. With the products available now, there should be no mildew in bathrooms at hotels. It's just too easy to take care of these issues now. The hotel is right on the line for the free blue trolley to the Navy Pier. It's only about a 6 block walk so we didn't take advantage of the trolley...but we do tend to walk a lot. One block west of the hotel on E. Grand and N. State is the Grand Plaza Market. It's a small supermarket. We were able to get supplies for the room there. Prices were only about 5% higher than what we were used to at home, so not bad at all. They have a pharmacy, groceries, toiletries, etc. ESPN Zone is around the corner in the same building. Bloomingdales is around the corner as well. Easiest way to Michigan Avenue is to walk west on E. Grand, turn left on N. Rush then right on E. Ohio. Boom...Michigan Avenue in all it's glory. The location is just unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, if suite's are your thing.”
Reviews.Author: mondrian
Reviews.Content: This is not a well-known hotel in Chicago, but it's really interesting. The location is ideal for just about any purpose: just off the magnificent mile, a block from the red line subway and a few blocks from the El. The hotel is not super-noticeable from the street; the entrance is on street level but the hotel lobby is 6 floors up on the elevator. The rooms are not just suites, they're really large suites -- with a well-equipped kitchen, a living area with sofa and bath, and a bedroom with full private bath. They have nice views of the city and are well-equipt (big screen tv in the living room, large tv in the bedroom). One thing that's a bit strange about the place in this age of niche-marketing is that it caters both to budget-conscious tourists with large families and to business travelers on long-term stays who are using somebody else's money. So on the one hand they have wifi and internet in the rooms, and an enthusiastic full-service business-savvy front desk; on the other hand, they have a mini-market that has basic cooking staples, and they have a *coin laundry* (try finding that in a Marriott Courtyard!). During my stay, they managed to cater to both groups quite well. My only minor complaint was about breakfast -- yeah it's complimentary, and they have a lot of staff on hand to try to make it run smoothly. But it brought back bad memories of summer camp: mobs of people pushing into a tiny serving room to scoop out something from an industrial-scale vat of scrambled eggs. They have a dining area, but it's much too small for a hotel this size, particularly given that the breakfast period is fairly brief.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up to Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: winflack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned home today from Chicago. We stayed at the Homewood Suites for five days. The service was amazing. We were a little early arriving so the door man stored our luggage until it was time for us to check in. The door men were very helpful. They informed us of great restaurants and the best way to get where we were going. The breakfast was good. We had some problems with one of the hostess on one morning. She was a little unfriendly. Other than that all was well. There was plenty of food to choose from and it was decent quality. Wasn't into the Manager reception. We always had plans so it was not an option for us. We walked by one night and there was several people taking advantage of the free meal. The room was nice. We had a great view looking South. We were on the 17th floor. From our room we could see the Sears Tower, United Center, and Trump Tower to name a few. I got to see a lot of construction going on over at the trump tower. The Trump Tower is one of the coolest buildings I have ever seen. Having a kithchenette was awesome. We had a pizza from Giordanno's delivered the first night. We ate half and put the rest in the fridge for the next day. So on the third day, we had a pizza from Gino's East delivered and did the same. By the way, we thought that Giordanno's was the better of the two. For the most part, everyone was friendly at the HWS. It really made our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent stay near Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: jodon
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites has got it all: great location for restaurants, shopping and attractions,comfortable suites,free breakfasts and internet,friendly staff,etc. A super place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Toodles319
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights Tuesday through Friday and we loved absolutely everything about our time here. The hotel is in a superb location, less than a minutes walk to the subway and only a few minutes walk to the magnificent mile. The hotel offers free breakfast everyday and free dinner Monday through Thursday. The hotel staff is very friendly and polite and its nice to see a place where everyone is willing to help out. They had a security guard deliver extra towels to our room. The fact that security is willing to help out guests really says alot about this place. Overall I highly recommend this hotel to all who are traveling to Chicago. You wont be disappointed with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ysouk
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was excellent as it is just beside the subway and the bus stop for the free trolley bus to Navy Pier is just beside the hotel. The room was very spacious. Kind of too big for a solo traveler. The view from the room was excellent and it was a great view to sleep at night. The bathroom was spacious too and the room has a big wardrobe. The kitchen has microwave oven and cooking utensils. Some of the cooking utensils were a bit dirty, probably because they had not been used for sometime. However, the microwave oven was very useful as I can heat up food to eat at night. You can easily walk to the magnificent mile by cutting across the shopping mall across the road. Do check out Pizzeria Uno which is near the hotel that serves the delicious deep dish pizza. For cheaper food, do check out the foodcourt at the shopping mall. The hotel also serves breakfast and dinner from Mon to Thur. I did not find the food that fantastic but it was pretty decent. I will strongly recommend this hotel to everyone going to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dragon8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites for one week in May. It was a very nice all suite hotel with so many amenities. Weather was cool and rainy (2 half days only), but thatâ€™s a given for the month of May. Iâ€™ve attached pictures (not of hotel, as they are exactly â€œas isâ€� on the website). We were very close to everything (red line CTA, shopping on Michigan Avenue, restaurants, convenience stores, bus stops, free shuttle to Navy Pier just a few steps away) etc. The best location we could have chosen. Room was relatively clean. Flat screen in living room was either damaged or had bad resolution, few other minor issues. Rooms were cleaned every day around 10-11am, everything was replenished. I agree with others on this forum that the rooms do look a lot larger on the website than in reality; which is small, but again, comfortable surroundings. Not much walking space in the bedroom and I banged into the wall in the middle of the night on my way to the washroom, so be careful â€¦lol. Our room was quite which we were grateful for. Every vacation weâ€™ve been on, weâ€™ve had noisy occupants, so this was a first. Breakfast buffet had a large variety of choices to suit everyone. We did not care for the liquid scrambled cheese eggs (too dry and rubbery) and bacon, but everything else was great. We had malt waffles every day! Biscuits are hot and tender. Fresh whole fruit or cut up fruit is a plus, as is skim milk and yogurt. I would personally suggest trying the great restaurants that Chicago has to offer rather than the free dinner buffet (Mon-Thursday), but if youâ€™re on a budget or have a large family to feed, etc. you might want to give it a try. There is free red/white wine and beer, and we saw many people come down for just that. Free internet access with color printer in the business center was a real plus for helping us research and print off maps for our itinerary. Printer wasnâ€™t working on the last two days we were there though. Gym and pool on 19th floor with a great night view. We never made use of it, but wish we had the time. Some highlights of our trip were the deep dish pizza which we could not get enough of, the Lincoln Zoo, shopping on Michigan Avenue and The Blue Man Group, which we saw at the last minute. I got pulled onstage by one of the Blue men and it was a thrill to be part of the show for about 15 minutes!! We love Chicago and will definitely return. We will definitely stay at Homewood Suites! Please message me if you require further info on anything at all. We had a fabulous time. Other than our AA flight which was cancelled and delayed by 12 hours, it was a nice vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: OneDirtyMartini
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were celebrating a Bachelorette party downtown and all pitched in on a room at the Homewood Suites because of its great location and the price was reasonable as well. The suite was spacious. We had a nice sized kitchen (glasses, coffee mugs, silverware, plates, etc). Late at night, we called down to room service for extra blankets and pillows. They brought them to our room within 5 minutes...that really impressed me. Also, the king size bed was very comfortable. The overall pros: -plenty of space -comfortable bed with goose down pillows -huge flat screen tv in the "living room" area -well stocked kitchen area -very clean -room service was quick The cons: -remote for the tv in the bedroom didn't work -electrical outlet next to vanity didn't work -pull-out couch was uncomfortable to sleep on -lcheck in is not on the first level of the hotel -parking is pricey!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ImeldaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites for 3 nights in November 2007. (My partner & 10 month Son). This was a great place to stay with a family, the location was amazing and the service at the hotel was wonderful with some of the most friendly staff I have ever experienced. We were blown away with the breakfasts available and the fact that you can pack your own take-away box and take food back to your room! The hotel is directly opposite a chinese restaurant and an amazing pizza restaurant (great for the famous deep dish!) all which come in handy when dining out with young one's isn't your cup of tea! When visiting Chicago again I would definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: ckarras
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our 4 day stay at the Homewood Suites. I have been to Chicago several times before, but this was my first time staying in the Homewood Suites. The homewood suites was nicer and more affordable than hotels I have stayed in previously. My family and I were really impressed with the Homewood Suites. We had a 1 bedroom King suite. As mentioned before there was a full sized fridge and freezer, with a really fast ice maker, a dishwasher, and dishes including pots and pans. I really liked that there was door to shut the bedroom off from the living room. The room was really clean, we were on the 18th floor which is a non-smoking floor, so there were not any musty, old smoky smells that you can sometimes get at hotels. The free breakfast was great, much better than any other free breakfast I have ever had at a hotel. Hot scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, corned beef hash, fresh fruit in addition to typical cold breakfast options like bagels, donuts, muffins, cereal and yogurt. I have to say being able to start our day with a hot breakfast each day was great. The staff was friendly, especially the doormen and valet parkers. We mentioned where we were going one day and they gave us directions to the closest place to get a CTA pass and then told us which bus we would need. Overall our experience was great and we are planning on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: ronmofew
Reviews.Content: It was just OK. Very clean. Polite staff. Quiet. Great Location. Rooms are smaller than they look on the hotel web-site Breakfast was a rip-off, take a short walk to the pancake house. Teeny tiny beds, something between a full and a twin, tight for 2 people to sleep in. We have 3 10 year-olds and needed a suite with room. The couch folds out - fine for kids. $10 per day for internet access... another rip-off. I would stay here again but look at other options first.

Reviews.Title: “At home at the Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: PSOklahoma
Reviews.Content: My stay was 5 days and I was there for a convention. All the staff, from the bellmen to the front desk were friendly and helpful. The breakfast and managers dinner receptions had quite a variety and was always good. The hotel location was great-just one block off Michigan avenue with plenty of restaurants around to choose from, There were two groceries nearby-Jewel Osco and Trader Joes-that I bought wraps & sandwiches to pack for lunch at the convention. (The food situation at McCormick Place Convention Center was awful-but that is another story!) There was plenty of shopping and I never felt unsafe walking alone. The room was nice but the carpet was frayed at the bathroom entrance and I did wonder if the carpets were ever vacuumed as I noticed a cookie crumb I had dropped stayed there almost the whole stay. But still basically a nice room with a nice view-especially at night. My price per night fluctuated from @189.00 to start, up to 312.00 by the end of my stay-of course I would have liked to have the cheaper price the whole stay. I would stay here again (if the price was right) and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The right choose”
Reviews.Author: ShrimpBucket
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, Very close from the Hampton inn and the Hilton Garden Inn (downtown), so donÂ´t lose time, like i did, comparing locations, they are all great. You can have a 1 minute walk to the delicious, pricey, Joe's Stone Crab or a Sushi place with outstanding food quality and a forgettable name; if you walk to the other side you'll find P.F. Chang's. If you can walk more than a minute you will have numerous options. If working out is a must for you, as a homewood guest you can acces the "crunch" gym right next door. It's a really big place with lots of fine equipment, a paradise for the ones who need a gym. If you like running, it takes only a 2 minute jog to the track beside the lake where you can rent bikes or skates or just run. We walked to the stores, restaurants, theater (Jersey boys! a must!), Opera, Navy Pier, etc. If needed a taxi would cost 5-7 dollars. The room is nice, according to the price, with some details on the wallpaper and a small leak when rained (in a corner far away from the bed and sitting area, so we didnÂ´t mind) the room is not big but roomy and the view was perfetc!. Breakfast included is very good: fruit, kryspy kremes, eggs, cereals, breads, yoghur, etc. The staff at front desk are extremely corteous and helpful, they always gave us the best directions, tips and assistance. I will never go back to the other expensive hotels, this my hotel at Chicago from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: dbolt
Reviews.Content: We had a conference at the nearby Marriott and thankfully could not get a room there, since it would have been $3-400 a night there. We found Homewood Suites, which is literaly next door. From our room, we could look into the rooms at the Marriott. Boy are we glad we found this place. We paid $189 a night for 7 nights. If you stay 7 nights, it is considered "extended stay" and it is cheaper-probably cheaper total than if you stay 4-5 nights. Their pricing is a tad bit confusing because most room types have different rates on different nights, so just make sure you know what you average room rate is before thinking you got a great deal for all nights. Location: It is one block off Mag Mile, and across street from Nordstrom, PF Changs, Pizzeria Uno, Bloomingdales, ESPNzone etc. GREAT location within walking distance of anything on Michigan Ave. or the Loop. In the room they have menus from various eateries that will deliver. Rannallis is great for pretty basic italian fare and salads. They are fast and only charge $2.50 delivery. Public areas: The staff is very friendly. You take elevator to floor 6 for lobby, shop, and dining room..... Almost the best part is the breakfast, which is probably the best complimentary brekfasts I have had a hotel ever. Scrambled eggs, breakfast meat, panckaes, french toast or fresh waffles, cereal, donuts, bread bagels fruit, yogurt, juice hot drinks. It got a little monotonous after 7 days, but the higher end-hotels don't even have this nice a breakfast for $$. NOR do the ritzey places have a buffett dinner. It is Mon-Thursday and is basic, but they have themes. Spagetti and meatballs, hamburger, pizza, Philly Cheese steak, chinese, etc. Usually some steamed veggies, small salad bar, hot entree and usually some kind of vegetarian option like mac/cheese, potatoes. Beer and Wine and soft drinks. Cake and pudding for dessert. Very passable, especially if you think that yo are saving $40 on dinner or more. We ate there 2 night out of 7. You can take the food to-go up to your room as well. Room: we had a corner room. All the "_04" rooms are on the southeast corner which affords a view from the Hancock Tower to the Trump Tower and Wrigley Building in the middle. We loved it. You walk in and it has an almost full kitchen (no oven) with fridge, 2-burner cooktop, microwave, sink, dishwasher and dishes for about 4 people. Then there is a living area with dining table/desk, two dining chairs, an easy chair, couch, coffee table and tv. The bedroom has a confy king bed with pelty of pillows and clean duvet cover, tv and standard bathroom. You can close the bedroom door and the couch folds out. You have to go thru the bedroom to get to the bathroom. The dcor is urban, with warm colors and some ncie bw photos of Chicago architecture. There is free wireless and ethernet cable internet in the room, which worked great. They also have a business center on floor 6 with printers, and conference table etc, so you can print out boarding pass etc. All the expensive hotel charge $10 a dayand that is if you can get it to work properly. Overall, we were REALLY pleased with the quality AND value. These days you are lucky to get one of thsoe in a hotel, but to get both-wow, that says a lot. It makes you wonder how Hilton is able to do it, and makes you wonder how much profit these swankier palces make on just a simple room and no extras at all and still charge twice as much. We will be back to this place and will look for more of these Homewood Suites elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very nice”
Reviews.Author: KappyMe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good in general. Good for families like us as rooms are spacious. Good value as breakfast and light dinner (Mon-Thurs) included. Location is great for the Magnificent mile. Main advise is not to trust the staff to help you with any transport. Staff at check-in (6th floor) are unware of information on getting around so refer you to the staff on the ground floor. I needed to get to another town, the staff booked me a terrible taxi with a man with a broken arm at an exhorbitant rate (I think he was related or something). The guy didn't know the route and didn't hang around for the return as previously agreed as he reckons he got an emergency call from the hospital who wanted to see him .... I didn't think hospitals were that responsive!!! I was told by the guy who sorted this out that limos would charge $300 each way. In the end I had to get a limo for the return which cost me $80 ... way cheaper than what the taxi driver charged me. This hotel is a great hotel but diminished by dodgy staff practices.

Reviews.Title: “homewood suites great for the family”
Reviews.Author: mdhkkh
Reviews.Content: Upon the the recommendations of TripAdvisor reviews we chose Homewood Suites on Grand Ave. one block from the Michigan Avenue for a two night stay the week after Easter. It cost $179 per night plus parking. We checked in an hour early and were given upon request a corner room on the top floor. The indoor pool was on the same floor. My wife and two daughters, ages 8 & 10 enjoyed the pool and the convenience of walking down the hall to go swimming. There is a free breakfast buffet and at 5:00 p.m., wine, beer and a light dinner during the week. The location was great and we had a 15 minute walk to the American Girl Store. The concierge/bellman, Rod, was very helpful and got as a discount for the river cruise which was also a short walk from the hotel. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Check out the Homewood Suites web cite for room details and prices..
